12231.content:
Upon arriving at their destination, Ryan looked about to find themselves facing a tall and powerfully build man in his early twenties who had apparently been waiting for them. "Welcome to Eligere Sententia boys boarding school, Master Carlson and company." he said. "I am Dr Thomas Vague; I'm glad that you could all come."

"Thank you sir." politely, Ryan said. "I was informed that we would meet a Juan Smith here."

"Juan Smith is having issues at this moment." struggling not to grin, Devon replied. "He decided to go after Eliza himself as she invaded his home and we were forced to... delay him."

Just then, a small girl, no taller than an toddler, appeared as if she were moving in a blur. She giggled, holding up a set of strangely shaped keys. "I still have the keys to his Anti-Gravity Transport, daddy." proudly, she said. "Juan is fun to play with, he's so hyper."

"Good girl, Sarah." smiling, Vague said. "Just play with Juan for a few more minutes then lure him to my office."

"Okay, daddy!" beaming, Sarah replied.

"Oh, come on!" came a frustrated voice from the hall. "Sarah, I need those keys!"

"You can't catch me!" giggling, Sarah yelled, vanishing in a blur like run. "You can't catch me!"

Juan sighed then paused seeing Chon. "Hey, man!" suddenly happy, he said. "When did you get here?"

"Just now." unimpressed, Chon replied. "You make it a habit to chase little girls?"

"That 'little' girl is fourteen, my age." smiling, Juan replied. "She's also my girlfriend." he then huffed. "I just wish she'd pick a different day to play games with me."

"Sarah was reduced to a toddler by Eliza as she though she had one of the rings." serious, Vague said. "However, she is still a witch and specializes in attribute spells."

"Like speed." grinning, Chon said. "Nice."

"Juan you are not going anywhere so please join us." serious, Vague ordered.

With that, everyone followed Vague down several halls, passed a number of classes to a pair large oak door at the end of one corridor where he suddenly turned to the group. "Beyond these doors is the office of the most powerful man on earth." he said with a hint of pride. "Devon Bizarre, twin brother to Elvira Strange, the head witch."

Just then, the door opened inwardly and a powerful voice called out, "Come forth and know me better!"
For a brief moment, Ryan suspected this Devon Bizarre had the same fear curse on him as Moriarty Strange but he sensed no looming threat, just an incredible power. Venturing in, they found a luxuriously decorated room with a huge desk with a massive man sitting in a custom built chair behind it. Devon was not obese, just unbelievably muscular.

"Tremble not at my presence." in a booming voice, Devon said. "You have no need to fear me."

"We are here regarding Eliza hunting down the last remaining pieces of the Pharaoh's rings." serious, Chon said.

"Ah, yes... the rings said to return a witch her powers or to grant a male powers of a witch." darkly, Devon said. "It was those rings who made what John Light Killer is today."

"Do you know more about that?" curious, Ryan asked.

Devon took a breath. "The Pharaoh's rings are like a puzzle." serious, he began. "They have to be placed in a specific order on the fingers for them to grant any power. The rogue council experimented on John, placing the rings onto his fingers in various orders in hopes of unlocking their secrets."

"The rogue council?" startled, Jenny asked.

"The Mafia of the witching world." serious, Devon replied. "We mad scientists have our own version, are known as the shadow tribunal." he sighed. "John managed to escape and destroy the place he was held in, the rest you know."

"They won't do that to me again..." trembling with fury, John muttered.

"Easy, bro." firmly but kindly, Ryan said.

"If you find Eliza first, she is all yours." looking John in the eye, Devon said. "Your orders are to secure the rings, we don't care what happens to Eliza, she was warned of the consequences of going after those rings."

"I think I've got an idea on where the bomb is. When you're done wiping your ass check the top floors near the roof for any sign of the bomb. You remember how to defuse it right?" Ryan asked.

"Yes I do." Light said.

We question her and relay the bomb location to Light. After that.....Well we'll see how helpful she is." Ryan said.

"Got it pal." Chon said.

Ryan shut his watch off and left the room.

I can hear dear Jenny crying too but my physical self is unattached from that world."

"Just think of her and send a mental response." Smiling, Maria said. "Your body will respond and speak for you." She then raised a finger in warning. "Tell her nothing of this world as there is no guarantee she will see me here when she passes."

I nodded and sent a response. "Do not fear, Jenny. Chon and I are on a secret mission that requires us to be in a state astral projection. I will give a full report upon my return. Take care of our physical selves until then."

Maria held back a giggle once I had sent the message. "You should know Jenny hates cryptic messages." Lightly scolding, she said. "She will be summoning everyone she knows to figure out what is going on."

"I still don't know what is going on." Serious, I replied.

"You are in a parallel universe." Serious, Chang explained. "In your world, magic is the reigning power which is geared solely for girls with boys having a magic that is physically based."

"In this universe, chaotic science is the reigning power which is geared solely for boys with girls having the magic that is elementally based." Turning serious, Maria added.

Chang nodded. "We have contacts in your world that tell us rogue witches are about to attempt to open a portal to a mythological realm of pure raw magic." Darkly, he said. "Here, there is a group of mad scientists trying to make a portal to other Earths in our universe."

"From the reports we are receiving, the two experiments will be executed at exactly the same time and date." Serious, the strange man said. "We fear that the two experiments will open a portal, linking our two worlds."

"This is Neon Erratic, head of the Failure Oversight Department." Serious, Chang said. "He answers to Devlin Moray, the head mad scientist."

I nodded but said nothing. Neon Erratic was a tall and dark man with red eyes and a bald head. He wore an expensive looking suit with a white lab coat covering it. I caught a glimpse of a gun and sword in a sheath and holster at his sides.

"What do you need us to do?" Serious, Chon demanded.

"We need your help to stop or at least slow down these experiments so the disaster we fear will not occur." Softly, Chang said. "You can either help us here or I can come to your world temporarily to help you there."

Chon turned to me. I knew he was searching for my input but I also knew he did not want to lose his brother again after just finding him. It was time like this I wished crazy shit didn't happen in my life.
1242.title: You sense Jenny trying to reach you.

12422.content:
Ryan's POV

"We can be of better help in a world we are better familiar with and have allies who will stand by us through thick and thin." Serious, I said. "I'm sure Chon would agree that everyone would like to see Chang back in action, even though it is for a short while."

Neon nodded. "So be it." Calmly, he said. "Be aware, however, that this world and who you discovered within it must remain beyond top secret."

"This is not Heaven but a parallel world some of those who had passed on found themselves living a second life." Serious, Chang said. "Call it reincarnation, call it what you like but..." He bit his lip before finishing, "you can imagine the panic any knowledge of this world would bring to your religious community."

I nodded but did not respond. I fully understood the disaster that even rumors of the world we had visited would bring. "What do we tell the others about Chang?"

"You will be telling them the truth as Chang will be permanently returning to your world." Surprising all, Neon said. "Only all of your memories of this world, minus your mission, shall be erased from your minds."

"I thought I could not go back." Confused, Chang said.

"To even send two here through astral projection, a rip must be opened." Serious, Neon explained. "A solid form must be sent through to seal the rift." A slight grin touched the corners of his mouth. "As you had volunteered for this mission, you will be the one to make the sacrifice."

Before another word could be said, there was a flash and I found myself lying on a bed looking up at the ceiling. I heard gasps all around me and propped myself up on one arm to look around. All of my friends were in the room, looking in my direction with shock on their faces. Huanle, Chon's sister whom he had discovered and found only days before was holding a hand to her mouth, tears flowing from her eyes. "How..."

Before she could stop herself, she ran to Chang, leaving a trail of tears behind her and literally jumped into his arms, sobbing. Chon was quick to join in the embrace, a family reunited at long last.

John, the Light Killer threw me an impressed look before giving me a thumbs up. Amy was stunned to silence but she was soon frantically drawing in her notebook as if she feared she would lose the moment. All the others were stunned to silence but Jenny walked up to me with a stern look on her face. "Okay, I want to know everything!"
12422.title: Miracles do happen.

Before anything could be said, the head witch, Elvira Strange entered in the room. "I am afraid that will not be possible, Miss Forth." Serious, she said. "The details of how and why Chang Kay was able to return to the living is classified."

"Unless you wish to vanish from the face of the Earth, do not dig too deep." She then turned to me. "You know the mission, Mr. Carlson. Brief them."

With that said, Elvira left the room and all eyes turned to me. "This other world Elvira spoke of is where Chang has been all this time." Serious, I explained. "I was only there briefly so I know nothing of its workings or how or why Chang came to arrive there."

"So what's the mission?" Curious, Jon Doe asked.

"Both worlds have reason to believe that rogue witches are about to attempt to open a portal to a mythological realm of pure raw magic." Darkly, I explained. "In the other world, from what I was told, there is a group of mad scientists trying to make a portal to other Earths in their universe."

I sighed then turned to Chon who replied...
124222.title: Elvira Strange enters.

Ryan's POV

Gasps erupted from the group to Chon's response. "From the report we had received, the rogue witches set to make this attempt are gathering here as part of the work force assigned to Girl Island." Gravely, he said. "We have until they are shipped out to weed them out and either stop or slow them down."

"Why?" Curious, Amy asked. "Is this not a matter for the rogue hunters?"

1242221.title: Countdown to disaster.

I feel so surreal, my brother is actually here. Here in the flesh, the same age as he was the last time I remember him. Jeez he's now only looking a few years older than me, perhaps this is karma. My quest for redemption is rewarded with my Brother being brought back to this world, had I continued I surely would have met a worse fate. I can't help but feel the pang of regret in my chest at what I did in revenge of his demise. We walk to a balcony on the roof, Chang gazes out at the dorm huts across the grounds.

"So you live here now?" he says.

I nod "Yep, we're a co gender dorm. Its on a person to person system, that's why we have kids living with us."

Chang nods, there's a pause in the air. I can understand why. Chang is about to speak but then stops. I nod for him to go on.

"I......watched over you....." Chang said.

My Brother places a hand on my shoulder in reassurance. Followed with "I know Chon, as I said I watched over you and saw your change and progress. You did a great thing taking those girls in. You even managed to find Huanle."

At this I then realise something came to mind for me. "Speaking of Huanle, elder Brother I must ask........Did you know of her?"

Chang sighs deeply before saying ".....Yes. I found out about her a few months before I passed. As you know our homeland frowned on having large families. Our parents found that Huanle had magical talent and left with her, thinking likely they could profit from it more than I could make with my career. When I wasn't helping you and my fellows I tried to track her down, our parents have passed. Huanle was at a witch school, I planned to try and get to her but then those rogue witches came....."

I nod and reply with "I know and with how I acted the witch council hid the knowledge from me, I found out after me and the team sneaked into the witch council headquarters in Edinburgh. Once we saved Jenny I found her."

My Brother nods and smiles "It all turned out okay Chon, we did the best we could at the time and had no clue what could happen."

12422213.title: Follow Chon and Chang.

124222131.title: Continue

Chon's POV

Elvira smiled and replied...

choices: We consult with John about our plan
Rhea has already made her move.
Elvira talks with her daughters about this revelation.

Chon's POV

With that we move towards the dorm room of John Harrison......
12422213111.title: John Harrison, the pseudo witch.

124222131112.content:
Chon's POV

Before long we arrive at the dorm, John has had the whole place renovated to be his workplace. Just goes to show nepotism works, but I don't care. I note that I can't sense any chi energy inside, likely John has either departed this place or he's put up some ward to mask that. Likely its science. The thing with my chi energy is it works better with magic ironically enough, mad science lacks life inside of it. Technology is cold and sterile and so I can't manipulate it or sense it very well. But regardless I feel John is certain to be here, no doubt preparing for Elvira's request.

"I was meaning to say Chon, I'm impressed by how you compensate for your lack of eye sight. Being able to read auras of life isn't an easy ability to learn with the chi arts." Chang says, patting me on the shoulder before we go in.

I'm momentarily taken aback by this, but I smile. I'm gonna have to get used to this, same with Huanle. We knock on the door, only to hear a loud scuffling noise. We waste no time, Chang quickly delivers a one inch blow to the door. Applying the pressure needed in the middle of the frame, a split second later it bursts into several splinters. It seemingly deactivated the wards John used, because I could then quickly sense the auras of.....two beings....

John was on the ground, being accosted by Rhea. Her ruby red evil aura starkly contrasting the noble blue of John, she currently had him locked into a very clear MMA hold. She quickly detects us and yells "You will not interfere! Don't worry John I'll save you from all of them!"

I'm not even going to think about that, I instantly leap into the air with a loud "ATTTTTAAAAA!" aiming a flying kick right at Rhea's head. But in an instant there is a loud crackling noise, followed by me landing on the floor with a thud. Rhea has vanished taking John with her.

"Curses....." I mutter out, pounding the floor in annoyance. Rhea has revealed her hand, likely planning this far before I was involved.

"Steady on Chon, John may have left us a clue as to where he was taken." Chang says as he walks into the room. We promptly get ready to look around.

That girl. What she said......

"Chon, we must not bring her lethal harm. If she is wise enough to one up John we must turn her to good." Chang says before we start.

"..........I know........" I mutter back, if I can be redeemed so I can she.....
124222131112.title: Rhea has already made her move.

choices: Rhea contacts Elvira about her new hostage and Brother.
John's Sisters get word of this
Chang and Chon arrive at the scene

I'm also pretty surprised at how easily John was taken down there, that guy can put one over on me and Ryan. Though I think over it, if she really is a Harrison it makes sense. The only one that can beat one is another one of them sometimes. Chang spends no time standing still though, he is digging through the nearby drawers.

"Chon, I'm gonna check around here. See if you chi senses can detect any clues." Chang says, I doubt it will work considering the inclinations towards technology here. But it's worth a try. I can't feel Rhea or John's chi signatures anywhere, she likely is near the outskirts of the school at least. Likely taking John away to somewhere.

"Mom and Sisters are the password, she is included. Good luck if you see this."

I think I get the idea. I stand up and say to Chang "Check the computer, try using John's mother's name and his Sisters. Include Rhea in there too."

Chang quickly boots it up, we try their first names all together. No dice, so we use the first letter of each. Bingo.

"We're in, how'd you figure that out?" Chang said.

"John left us a bit of advice in case this happened. Hopefully that's not all." I say as I lean close to my Brother.

After a few minutes of this we strike gold. "Yeah he's left other stuff. Turns out he's already worked on his own investigation, even managed to leave some coordinates to where Rhea kept a second base. Bet you she's there." Chang says.

Chang shrugs and says "Hard to say, okay I got it on our phones. Let's tell Elvira and make our way there. Hopefully John is alright."

As we head out the room I say "I'm sure of it, Rhea is the one that warrants our caution though. Hopefully we can get her to stop all this before its too late....."
1242221311121.title: A clue is found

12422213111213.content:
Chon's POV

We've got a lead thanks to John, now we just need to follow up on it. Chang as we run out activates his phone and puts Elvira on the line "We've got good news and bad news, bad news first Ms. Rhea got to John first and got away with him, good news is he left us a clue and we're following up on it."

Elvira responds with "Excellent, stay where you are for one moment. I'm sending Huanle to accompany you for extra aid."

I frown, its not that I don't think Huanle is capable. Far from it, back at Witchbloom she had top marks. When your an orphan for years you likely focus on your studies, I would know after all. But Elvira is keen on this, I think she just wants a magic element involved because of her kind. I won't object though, no use in arguing with a head witch I say.

Before long Huanle joins us "I'm briefed on what's happened, let's go guys. The Kay siblings shall save the Harrisons." she says with a smile.

Chang chuckles at that and I actually find myself grinning too. So this is what it feels like, something tells me I should get used to it. But then I realise Rhea likely doesn't have this. But regardless we have to stop her. With that we are on our way, leaping off the dorm roof and into the tall forest trees behind us.

Parkour is something that I've learned since childhood so I can leap across both trees and rooftops with ease, either to hunt a foe or to flee the scene. Chang obviously still maintained his prowess in that world he was in, Huanle.....Well okay she's still new to it but her ballet practise and use of magic lets her keep up with us to some extent.

"How far till we get there?" Huanle says

Chang is leading us with his device and points north before saying "Just ahead of us, its underground."

I extend my chi senses, this place is filled with such life that I can have issues discerning certain things unless I focus really hard. But I can sense movements ahead but underground.

"This is it, but where's the entrance?" I ask.

As if on cue we hear a loud roaring noise, we stagger back as out of the ground comes this massive entrance. It resembles a bunker gateway with a door, I quickly move into and channel some chi energy into my hand. Blasting it right in the middle to force the door open. Instantly the smell down the stairs is of copper and soot.

"She's down here?" Huanle asks.

I nod, Chang says "We don't know how much she has down here, be careful......" with that we head in.....
12422213111213.title: Chang and Chon arrive at the scene

Biting my lower lip Chang would say "Let's stay sharp, we don't know how long Rhea has had to set traps.....

Yeah that's true, maybe the prefects had done anything about this we wouldn't be here. Then again the forests around Starmage can be very expansive, it does fall under their jurisdiction though. With only a brief cracking noise to give away our position.

"Dolls?" he mutters, before carrying on with "That's odd, Rhea seems more like a tomboy than anything else. Why would she have these lying about."

124222131112131.title: Am ambush

1242221311121313.content:
Elvira's POV

I'm been thumbing over a copy of the file I gave the Kay siblings, Rhea.......I swear the name rings a bell to me. Perhaps that is my mind just playing tricks on me, surely I'd have known that Jack had a child. Then again he was silent for so long.....not even I with my resources could track him down. I suppose I did teach him the best lessons about avoiding magic it seemed, perhaps that was the one good thing about my zealotry in letting my daughters use magic on him.

I sigh, I should tell them. They have a right to know just in case, I doubt Rhea's claim is legit. But should the worst come to pass and the truth is so, we must be prepared.

In a short while I set up a conference call spell, talking to Natalie and Catherine via crystal balls.

"Hello Elvira, is everything okay?" Natalie says, Catherine is silent as she waits my response.

I cough, in the way one does to prepare for a speech. "My daughters, I'm afraid the past could be coming back to haunt us."

Catherine frowns before saying "How so?"

"There has been an individual causing disruption at Starmage Academy, a girl called Rhea. She claims to be a direct heir to Jack." I say, looking down after it. I couldn't help that last bit.

Natalie gasps, there is a tense-ish silence in the air. Finally after a few seconds Natalie says "What? I thought Jack he.....had no children. That was why he passed his teachings to John."

I look in the file again, just to remind myself of it and say "Yes, that we know of. Remember its been years since he was last sighted, there could be plenty of time for him to father a child."

Catherine was silent, before adding in "Yeah, given how we......treated him I doubt he would feel compelled to tell us about it. Probably thought we and our kids would treat them just as bad as we did......."

I nod and then say "As I say we have no concrete proof at the moment, I doubt were Jack to have a child he'd have allowed her to be so......troubled." I want to believe that, even after what happened with him.

"So what is being done about this? I've not heard from John, is he okay?" Natalie asks, a hint of concern on her features.

I smile and respond with "He should be with Rhea, I believe he's likely let himself be captured so he can get close to her. No one again. The corridor empty, the stone beneath pale and withdrawn. These were the kind of games Amy liked to play. Now she would be hiding around the corner, watching Ryan's reaction with inscrutable eyes. There were things he liked to keep private, other things that needed to be kept hidden, and at times, Ryan suspected that Amy Don was reaching for ways to draw him away from those items, those secrets -- that this was no mere girl's foolish, flirtatious play.

Then again, she would often smile at him over a book, or nudge him during a lesson, and wasn't it all in flirtatiousness? Weren't those eyes perfect pools of sincerity?

Now he seemed to hear her feet scuffing the flagstones, and so peered further out, intent on catching her looking, when again a nudge, and she appeared from the opposite side instead, smiling brightly, with those painful pools of sincerity glistening.

They were eyes she often used to great effect, though they had always had less of an impact on Ryan than she'd privately hoped. He was an odd bird, this one.

Even now, his eyes were rankling. "Well?" he said.

"They say you're a fast one," she intoned, raising a clenched fist. "But that you hide it from your own and bestest roommate." She smiled. "That if I held a handful of fireflies, and let them suddenly seek their own way, you could catch the whole in a handful of your own, and return them to me."

Ryan sighed at the theatrics. "Well?" he said again.

The pools glimmered. "Well, I have such a handful, see?. And I will bet you one kiss that you cannot catch them all."

"I might not like the prize."

"You will," she threatened.

He sighed again.

"Ready?"

Another sigh.

She opened her hand, and the bugs, rendered sterile and almost invisible by the daylight, streamed out. Ryan moved into the corridor, shutting the door behind him.

"Well?" she demanded triumphantly.

Ryan sighed again, then held his right hand, which was clenched into a fist, close to Amy's ear. The buzzing of the maddened, though unharmed, insects was quite audible. Quite, he thought, yes, quite. Her sincere eyes narrowed to hardened points.

http://images5.fanpop.com/image/photos/3...

"Well, I guess there's just the matter of my reward now," he sighed tiredly.

She snorted. "Says you. I bet you a kiss that you couldn't catch them all. But you DID catch them all. So."

"So?!"

Then she swished the tail of her skirt haughtily behind and went jauntily on her way with her handful of bugs (though not without another backward, inscrutable glance at Ryan's suddenly infuriated face).

Furious, he rambled. He pointed at my group. "Do you have any idea the number of procedures, processes, and all around red tape you had forced into motion, Tex Moray!?!"

"You are barking up the wrong proverbial tree, Mat Moray!" Angry, Tex countered. "You were the one who started the fight, you paradoxical, obstinate, Gynophobic, pre-adolescent buffoon!"

"Father is so going to experiment on you for opening a rip with your overuse of chaotic energy!" Firing a blast at his brother, Mat screamed. "You'll be Jessica's twin sister for a year!"

"I beg to differ, dear brother!" Firing back, Tex screamed back. "It is you who will embrace the feminine lace of a pretty dress and fall under the urge to play with dolls!"

I slowly lowered my sword, not believing what my friends and I were witnessing. The rip that had opened in the halls of our school and pulled us in was the result of two children having a fight?
1351.title: were violently pulled in.

choices: I am told to pick their punishment.
13511.content:
"Enough!" Sternly, I yelled.

The two boys stopped their argument and turned to me, curious as I sheathed Asura, seething with annoyance. "Let me get this straight!" Fuming, I said. "This rip which involved us being dragged here against our will, and we expected the worse. Like maybe Pandora was ringing and we had to kick it's teeth in. But nooooo, it was some kids having a 'love tiff' in their living room!"

I was pacing back and forth, making dramatic hand gestures all the while Jenny tried her best not to laugh at the situation. The two boys were clearly powerful to have opened a rip in the fabric of time and space and that they had not opened said rip intentionally but they also clearly lacked the maturity to use such power wisely. It was what infuriated me the most, power without responsibility.

"He started it!" Pointing at each other, the two boys protested.

"I'm finishing it!" Starting everyone, a booming voice commanded.

I turned to face a towering muscular man with jet black hair and fiery hazel eyes which fell onto my group and I with a certain cold calculation that even made me wince slightly. "I apologize for your rude summoning into this world, noble travelers." His voice softening, he said. "I shall make haste to return you to your point of origin once the two worlds align again."

"What do you mean once the two worlds align?" Curious, Charlie asked. "We want to go home."

"Parallel universes orbit around each other like the moon orbits our planet." Patiently, the man explained. "Once I detect that world which matches your specific energy signature, I will open the rip and send you home."

"Um... sir?" Wincing, Jenny said. "How long will that be?"

"No longer than a week, my dear child." Managing a smile, the man replied. "By the way, I am Nathan Moray; mad scientist extraordinaire." He gave a slight bow then frowned, turning to the two now clearly frightened boys. "This is my youngest son, Mat and my middle son, Tex. Rest assured, they will be severely punished for their actions in this incident."

Tex and Mat began to cry, quivering in fear. I began to wonder what punishment would await them in a world where mad science is the ruling power. I turned to Chon who seemed to be thinking along the same lines as I; we feared the worst...
13511.title: I break up the fight.

135111.content:
In a true mad scientist style, Nathan pulled two vials of colored liquid from his right chest pocket and threw a pink colored one at the youngest boy, Mat. He screamed, seeing the vial flying at him but he was not fast enough to dodge it. The vial hit him and shattered; immediately causing a pink colored ooze to rapidly cover his entire body! Mat screamed at the top of his lugs, struggling to rip the ooze off of him, crying and begging as if he was in intense pain.

"What did you do to him!?" Concerned, Jenny demanded. "Stop it! Can't you see its hurting him!?"

"He is not in any pain." Rolling his eyes, Nathan said. "She is just a complete drama queen."

"She?" Confused, Jenny asked. She turned to where Mat had fallen to find a small girl wearing a schoolgirl uniform in his place. "Oh my..."

"Daddy!" Tearfully, Mat whined. "How could you!?"

"The event will wear off in a few hours... Mattie." Grinning, Nathan said. "Consider yourself lucky I did not make the change permanent."

With that, he turned with incredible speed and hurled the second vial at Tex. Only he was ready for it and used some type of mental shield to deflect it. "I will not allow myself to be subject to change, father!" Annoyed, he said. "Choose a different punishment!"

The vial flew back across the room, directly at me! Normally, I would have been able to dodge such an object with ease but I knew that if I did, it would hit one of my friends. I heard Jenny cry out a warning but it was too late. The vial slammed against my chest and I was instantly covered in a green colored ooze that seemed to seep into every pour of my being. Asura did not react so I had to assume whatever was being done to me was neither life threatening or permanent. Once the ooze fell off and dissipated into nothing, Jenny looked at me surprised. "What did that stuff do to me?" I asked.

Jenny blushed brightly then began to giggle. "Not bad, Ryan." Barely controlling her giggles, she said. "You make a very cute..."
135111.title: Nathan punishes his children.

1351111.content:
Ryan's POV

"Fuck did you call me?" I muttered out, I kinda felt groggy after that vial hit me. Like I'd been punched or something, but that was no strange feeling to me. After all I got kicked in the head several times by Chon and lived so yeah, used to it. But I still felt....off, like something was there that there shouldn't be.

I looked down, no breasts there. There wouldn't be anyway, British people are supposed to be immune to it. Something to do with a great war that happened long time ago, British people eventually just became immune to it due to constant exposure to it. I remember when some witch students in the US tried to use a genderswap spell on me, I just folded my arms and laughed at them. Was there any other sort of magic they used? Jenny was a pro at healing magic, even better with her cat blood.

Chon wasn't British, but he was immune as well. His older Brother was killed by witches, in turn this left Chon with a seething hatred for anything magic related. Like a sort of rage barrier if you would. There was one time when a young witch tried to perform a transgender spell on Chon. He would have broken her arm in three places if me and Jenny didn't intervene, and don't get me started on what he wanted to do with Charlie's older twin sisters.

But back to my current situation, I felt strange. I quickly blocked everything out, the two odd boys arguing, Jenny laughing. My hearing felt….odd, like it was more sensitive. Something else felt odd, I felt there was something on my body. Like a…tail?

My eyes went wide, I turned to try and catch a glimpse of this limb. But then I realize that I’d not get it that way, so I reached a hand behind me. And sure enough I felt a tail there, I was as composed as best I could. Since becoming involved with the supernatural I had learned to be as composed as possible, even more so considering I had become the unofficial head of the dorm.

“The FUCK?!” I found myself yelling out, I could hear Jenny laughing. Charlie was confused, Chon was on guard and looking at the apparent Father of the two boys who were responsible for bringing us here. Amy was just looking stunned, I really wish Light was here. Having a big guy like him meant everyone usually had the kid gloves on.
I then turned my attention to the boy who had deflected the vial at me, I think his name was Tex or something? He was giving me an odd sort of look.

“A male Neko?” he said aloud. So that’s what I was? I always heard it was females who were that, but I could be wrong of course.

Suddenly my body was on auto pilot, I dropped Asura. Who had been oddly quiet, usually he was barking about danger being near. With both my hands free I grabbed the Tex boy by his collar, and lifted him up.

“Enough!” the Father bellowed, I heard him. I was tempted, it’d feel good to be sure. But I knew I needed to be reasonable, after all we were in their place.

“Sorry! Thought you lot were attacking, Asura!” I said, in an instant the blade flew into my left hand.

“I apologize, you were brought here by accident. My children can be a tad hard to deal with as you can see, they are good hearted though I assure you.” Their Father said to me.

“Pssh, that’s what they all say.” Chon said, I couldn’t blame him. I turned to look at Tex, he looked a bit shaken. Probably because I was grabbing him without using any magic or stuff like that.

“Let’s just calm down, I’ll find out where you came from and discuss with your school. I can tell from your uniforms, why don’t you sit down and have some tea?” the Father said, he was trying to be the peacemaker here. I could tell, I’ve said stuff like that before.

“Fine. “ I simply muttered, I’ve been attacked once. I don’t know how long I’ll be like this, I may have just ended up creating history. Bloody great, the man gestured to a nearby table with a pair of couches. My team and I took a seat, my tail now sticking between my legs. Jenny looked like she was about to burst into laughter, but my stare got rid of that.

“Sexier than you.” I muttered to her, a pout on her face in reply.
1351111.title: A catboy? How?!

13511111.content:
"I apologize for your, um, inconvenience." Expertly hiding a grin, Nathan said. "The event that had altered your DNA will painlessly reverse itself in exactly three hours and fifty two minutes." He then allowed the grin to show, adding, "I must admit, a male Neko is an interesting choice."

"Choice?" Surprised, I asked. "What do you mean?"

"The serum you were hit with changes the subject into the one being he is the most curious about." Bemused, Nathan replied. "In your case, I believe you were curious bout your Neko girlfriend."

I blushed slightly at that as Jenny giggled before stroking my neck. "It's not so bad, is it? Smiling, she asked. "I mean, you did come out looking cute."

The gentle stoking was sending waves of pleasure down my spine and I began to purr. I snapped out of it though and gripped Jenny's hand. "Play time later." With a half smile, I said.

Jenny grinned as I released her then turned to Nathan. "Where I come from, we are supposed to be immune to magical transformations." Serious, I said. "How was I changed?"

"The laws of physics and genetics do not work the same in this world as they do in yours so your immunity does not have as much power here." Serious, Nathan replied. "Our worlds are compatible enough to allow a safe change." He again grinned. "However, your immunity did come into play as the serum was designed to change a person's gender as well."

"Thank goodness for small favors." Sighing, you said. "My sword normally moves on its own to defend me against threats..."

"Your life was never in any danger." Simply, Nathan said. "Your sword must have sensed that and not acted as there was no need to reveal its power to strangers like ourselves."

"Good point." Thoughtful, I said. "What will be done with your son who caused this change?"

"Your transformation was completely accidental." Annoyed, Tex blurted out. "It is not my fault or concern that you can not dodge a low velocity glass projectile."

Nathan shook his head. "It is your fault and concern that you can not redirect said projectile away from innocent bystanders." Sternly, Nathan countered. "Therefore, as your punishment, you will return to our visitors' world when the rift is open. There, you will spend three weeks to a month as a transfer student until; your power gains enough resistance to send you back home."

Tex turned pale. "That is can't be legal!" Startled, he protested. "There must be some law forbidding such a practice!"

Nathan let out a maniacal laugh that even made me shudder slightly. "It is forbidden to permanently transfer a person into a parallel world." Amused, he explained. "However, a temporary transfer is perfectly legal." He then turned to me. "All I require is the permission of a party from the other world."

"He will return here on his own in three weeks to a month?" Confirming Nathan's words, I asked. "We will not have to open a rift for him?"

Nathan shook his head. "It is not necessary." Bemused, he said. "If you all were to stay here, you would automatically return to your own worlds in the same amount of time as the rip was not lock sealed when it closed."

"Lock sealed?" Confused, Charlie asked.

"Its like bricking up a door." Simply, Chon explained. "Once sealed, its hard to open again."

Nathan nodded. "Exactly." He then turned his attention onto Chon. "I see someone attempted to make you a male witch." Chon sighed then silently nodded. Nathan shook his head. "You are close to being just that; a powerful one in fact."

Chon raised a single eyebrow but remained silent. I knew that he was not very comfortable with the subject and I was about to speak when Charlie chimed in. "What are you saying, Mr Moray?"

Nathan smiled, keeping his eyes on Chon. "With your permission, young man, I can take you across the threshold. Our mad science is centuries beyond magic; I could enhance your power so you can work magic as a male the likes witches could only dream about." He paused, allowing his words to sink in before more softly adding, "However, as you are guest to this reality, I am required to first gain your permission."

Chon remained silent then finally replied...
13511111.title: Things get explained.

choices: Tex gets enrolled, and meets the rest of the dorm.
Nathan decides to have his daughter brought along.
135111111.content:
Chon’s POV

I heard the man offer to teach me magic, did I hear that correctly? Magic, the very thing that killed my older Brother. He was offering to teach me it? I don’t think he was lying when he said that, but what to do? Witches had killed my older Brother, and in turn I hunted them to the ends of the Earth and brought violent death upon them.

Back when I was starting at this school I viewed it as a blight, something unstable and a ticking time bomb. It was far from my use of martial arts and chi energy, what good was magic when a blade was close to your eyes?

Just then I heard a voice in my head scream out with “Learn it! Use the very tool that took that which was dear to you! You could wreak your revenge, and crush any who opposed you!” it was soon followed by images of me tearing my foes limb from limb. Fireballs shooting out of my left hand, and I grabbed a witch with the other and set her alight.

But another voice chimed in with “That tool cannot be trusted, it took away your Brother. And what were to happen if you turned to evil? Power corrupts, absolute power will corrupt absolutely. Your hands are already powerful, and stained with blood. Just how long would it take for you to trip over the blood that you have spilled onto the floor?”

That was a fair point, what if I turned evil because of it? Would Ryan strike me down? Would my adopted children fall into evil also? Or would they strike me down? It was quite a somber thought to be sure, could I be trusted with such a thing? If I was here before I took in those twin girls, I might have accepted and gone after those who killed my Brother with even more reckless abandon. Until I was either in a body bag or they all were.

I didn’t care back then, when the odds were bad I threw myself into the chaos. Perhaps it was out of some misguided belief that if I died I’d be with my Brother once again.

But now I was different, I had things to cling onto. Things worth fighting for, and I wasn’t going to give it away just so I could learn how to transform into a cat.

“No, thank you. I don’t trust it, in my belief and experience magic in general is a blight. Something that can’t be fully controlled, I will not use it. For I would most likely succumb to the darkness around it.” I said, turning around.
I thought I could hear Ryan, with my enhanced senses I thought he was giving a minor smirk. No doubt impressed by my self-control. I remained silent.

Ryan’s POV
“Well you have improved Chon, I thought you have taken that in a heartbeat to gain more power. But you would probably be corrupted, and it wouldn’t be pretty for any of us.” I thought to myself. I was ready to go, and I was thinking about my form right now. A catboy, and considering what Jenny just did to me at least I knew how to please her in the sack.

I recalled a time when me and Jenny had left starmage thanks to the October holiday, and a neighbor had seen Jenny’s cat ears and tail. However she seemed to think that Jenny was visiting me for some uh….fetish sex. Thankfully she didn’t freak out or anything like that, otherwise there would have been an incident for sure.

And then my gaze turned to the guy who was protesting, Tex or something was his name. I don’t know why, it must have been my cat genes. But I was starting to get a bit annoyed, so I said something that would put him in his place for sure.

“One of our dorm mates is a former cannibal, and I stress former. But I doubt your brain would sate his hunger anyway.” I could tell we were going to get along just fine, and sure enough he was about to come up with something to say back to me. However he got cut off by his Father.

“Enough, I understand your reason for not wanting to learn magic. I shall respect your decision, Tex you will come along with our guests and explain the situation. And no buts. Are we clear?” he barked out.

I saw Text open his mouth as if to say something, but then he sighed and said “Yes Father, lead the way.” Looking at me.
I merely nodded and motioned for the rest of my team to come with me. In truth I wasn’t exactly happy with this, but at least it wasn’t some giant thing with more teeth than the Osborn family trying to make a lunch out of me.

“One last thing, while you are in that state do not attempt to mate with your girlfriend. The results could be unpredictable, I can tell you that at least.” I turned to look at the man with wide eyes, I could see that happening. And then me and Jenny would end up creating what could be a male Neko. Better to just let nature run its course, if we do have a kid then…..Nah better not think on it now.

The Father opened a portal in front of us, I grabbed my katana and Jenny’s hand. Doing a motion with my head for Tex to come with us, without a word we entered the portal to travel back to Starmage.
135111111.title: No, thank you.

choices: A general tour of the school.
1351111112.content:
Just then, a teenage girl entered the room and took notice of us. "Daddy, who are these people?" Worried, she asked. "Why do I sense a rift in the house?"

"These people are from the other side of the rift, Jessica." Calmly, Nathan replied. "They are from the world your mother was born into." He smiled. "I was about to send Tex with them for a few week visit. Would you like to see the world your mother came from?"

Jessica smiled. "I'll get packed!" Excited, she said.

There was a dull flash and Jessica was holding two pieces of luggage. Tex grunted before a second flash revealed luggage of his own. "How long will we be staying with them?" Curious, Jessica asked.

"About three weeks." Honestly, Nathan said.

Jessica nodded then took note of my new form. "I take it Tex had some fun with you?" Bemused, she asked. "I'll help."

She waved her hand at me and I instantly found myself back to normal to Jenny's smile. "You made a cute Neko boy." Teasing, she said. "It's a pity I can't change you into one back home."

"You are a witch." Flatly, Chon said.

"You are a genius." Unphased, Jessica countered.

"His brother was killed by rogue witches." Wincing, I explained. "They also... did things to him."

Jessica frowned. "My mother was killed by a rogue Chi master." Softly, she said. "However, revenge is fool's game." She turned to Chon. "There is good and evil in all of us. If you seek evil, that is all you will ever find."

A small grin touched the corners of Chon's mouth. "That's what Jenny said to me when we first met."

"I can see you are all going to get along just fine." Grinning, Nathan said. He opened the rift then pushed Jessica and Tex forward. "I will see you two in a few weeks." Oh, and Ryan..."

I turned to Nathan. "Yes?"

"No special treatment." Expressing a deep seriousness, Nathan commanded. "They are to be treated like any other temporary transfer student. No better and no worse."

I nodded. "I understand."

With that, I followed the others into the rift and it closed behind us. We were back where we started with two new students to watch over. "I wonder why Mr Moray demanded no special treatment." Curious, Jenny said. "What makes them so special?"

Jessica sighed. "My grandfather is the head mad scientist, the leader of our secret world." Gravely, she said. "He is the equivalent to your head witch, the leader of your secret world. My father is next in line to take the throne."

"That's just great." Sarcastically, Charlie said. "We have to babysit royal brats."

Jessica giggled, seeing Charlie's humor. Tex however gave a humorless laugh, causing the rest to laugh with Jessica.

After the laughter died down, I took Jessica and Tex to...
1351111112.title: Nathan decides to have his daughter brought along.

choices: The Ren twins hear of the new students and try to pick on them.
13511111121.content:
Ryan's POV

Upon entering through the rift we were greeted by the prefects, the cavalry arrived. Too bad it was late as usual, I learned not to really rely on them. Too busy helping other people, that's why I ain't inclined to be one. If I was told to be one I'd just shrug and do it.

Light walked over to me and said "What happened boss?" noticing our new arrivals. Oh how I wished I'd been able to bring him with me, if you have a choice between taking me or Light. Your going to take the big guy into a fight, the guy could walk into a nuclear explosion and be just fine.

"Long story." I said, I then turned to Jenny and Chon and said "You guys stay here, bring everyone up to speed." moving down the hallway I motioned to Tex and Jessica and said

"You two come with me, the Dean will want to have words with you. And do me a favour, don't speak to anyone yet. The last thing we need is an inter-universe war." I said, the truth couldn't have been further based off my personal history.

"Sure lead the way." Jessica said to me, Tex was silent. As if he was reserving judgement till we met the one in charge, well that was fine by me.

I moved out the dorm, a couple of prefects came up to me. But before they could speak I just said "Taking them to the Dean, everything's fine now move." both prefects who were girls were silent. But they moved aside, knowing I wasn't one to be argued with right now.

After giving another motion for the two guests to follow me, we walked up to the main building. I had blocked everything out, I was just focused on this. A short elevator ride later and we went down a grand hallway, whereupon a pair of red and fancy doors stood.

I knocked on it a couple of times, I heard a female voice say "Enter." and did so.

"Ah Carlson, what brings you here?" Elvira said, she had been reading a large and thick tome and set it down upon seeing me. She frowned when she saw the two people I was bringing.

"I see you've come back from that rift travel, who are these people?" Elvira said as she stood up.

"Uh Jessica and Tex Moray, they are from the rift we went through. Their Father wants them to be here for about a month or so." I said rubbing the back of my head.

Elvira was glaring with intent at Tex, it was the sort of look that could make a normal person start sweating with fear. I could tell. But oddly enough Tex seemed unfazed, Jessica was lightly biting her lower lip.

"You, Tex Moray is it? "You are just as cocky and impulsive as your grandfather, Devlin Moray. I can tell that much by the look in your eyes." Elvira said folding her arms and looking at him with a look of minor annoyance.

Tex smiled. "Why thank you." I inwardly groaned, that was the last thing you should have said idiot. Not even Light is that thick, and he's still learning to read and write cause he spent most his life as a test subject.

"That was not a compliment." Sternly, Elvira said. She then whispered, "Damn mad scientists..." She turned to me. "Devlin Moray is the head mad scientist in his world." she explained to me.

Okay now I groaned aloud, I felt a headache coming on. I had enough of mad science in this world, and now something from another? All this was really getting to me, I think I need to visit a shrink. That would be nice.


"I take it we will have to treat Tex carefully then I take it? You know with the kid gloves." I asked.

Elvira smiled. "Treat him like any regular visiting student." Firmly but kindly, she said. "Tex's father left strict instructions not to allow Tex any special privileges. He is not to be treated better or worse than any 'troubled' student."

Well that was a relief, at least I could kick his arse if he got out of control. "What about the chick?" I asked.

"My name is Jessica." she chimed back.

"You are to be treated the same also, now if there's anything else Carlson please take them back to your dorm. They start school first thing in the morning." Elvira said, she was about to sit back down and start reading when I realised I did have something to ask.

"There is something actually Dean, how did you know their Father?" I asked, I was curious.

Elvira sighed and took a deep breath, oh boy here came a big explanation. But it's what I asked for.

"200 years ago, a gigantic rift had opened over the lands of this world. It enveloped several witch boys and girls into another universe, one that mirrors our own. But instead it was the boys who were the ones that could use what we over here refer to as magic. But instead they called it mad science, a term that was later used for what boys now use over here to combat magic. I'm on personal speaking terms with their Father, only those who have attained true power in their fields can talk between worlds." Elvira said as she walked around the room. Ending it by looking out the window.

I took in a deep breath myself, trying to wrap my head around this. Multiple worlds exist, different types of magic exist.
"So there could be an alternate universe, where I never went to this school then?" I asked aloud.

Elvira gave a grim nod "And trust me when I say that is not a universe you wish to go to, let's just say that without you Carlson your dorm mates would have never been okay." she said.

I blocked the morbid thoughts out, that was all I could do. Jessica put a hand on my back and said "Don't worry about it, just do what you can here."

Upon hearing that I gave a smirk "Sounds like something my girlfriend would say."

With that I bid farewell to the headmaster of the academy, and left with my two new dorm mates.
13511111121.title: The dean, Elvira Smith.

135111111211.content:
-Ryan's POV-

Soon after leaving the dean's office, I saw Rose and Carla Ren standing near Tex and Jessica Moray. Knowing the two girls, I inwardly moaned as I listened in.

"So you are the visitors from the other side of the rift." Curious, Carla said. "I heard only boys can work magic there."

Tex chuckled madly. "You call that a test flame?" Amused, he asked. "How pathetically weak."

Only Jessica remained diplomatic. "A small flame does not necessarily equal a weak power, Tex." Firmly but kindly, she warned. "Rule twenty of the book of mad science...."

"I know... I know." Sighing, Tex said. "He who underestimates is a fool from the beginning."

"You are a fool for even trying to match wits with us." Grinning wickedly, Rose stated. "We can kick both your asses back to your home world."

With that, she summoned a flame of her own. Watching from a close distance, I was about to step in when something happened...
135111111211.title: The Ren twins hear of the new students and try ...

choices: I am invited to the meeting.
Devlin wishes to talk to me alone.
1351111112112.content:
-Ryan's POV-

Dark clouds quickly moved over the area as flashes of lightning and distant thunder shook the skies, startling everyone who heard them. This was unusual and had unnatural written all over it. One did not have to be a genius to know trouble was about to brew. "Asura!"

An open window allowed my sword to fly to my hand. Just as I sheathed her at my side, one lightning bolt struck through the same open window at an unnatural angle. It flew passed me harmlessly, striking the floor between the Ren sisters and the two visitors. There was a flash before a tall, dark elderly man appeared where the odd lightning had struck. He sported an eighteenth century gentleman's suit with unusually long coat tails that moved about as if they had a mind of their own. He wore knee high riding boots, a top hat covering his raven black hair, and carried a silver tipped cane with a large diamond. His eyes hid behind round shining glasses while he held a toothy, almost sinister grin. It was the head mad scientist of the alien world; Jessica and Tex's grandfather, Devlin Moray.

"I simply must remember to tone down that teleporter." Waving at a the stunned Ren twins, he muttered. "It's so dramatic." He chuckled madly. "I do apologize if I caused you a fright."

He then turned away from them to face Jessica and Tex. "What, what are you doing her, grandpa?" Worried, Jessica asked. "Is there a problem?"

"My sweet wildflower, you worry too much." Grinning, Devlin said. "Relax and enjoy the wonders and discoveries that await you in your mother's home world." He then turned to Tex, still grinning.
"Greetings, my insane grandson. You have a rare opportunity to reap your harvest of alien knowledge. Experiment, explore, and expand your visions to the next horizon."

Tex smiled proudly. "With honor, grandfather."

As I watched this exchange, I found myself feeling greatly outgunned against this head mad scientist. I could feel his power literally radiating off of him. The Ren twins, I noticed, also could sense his power and wisely hurried away so not to provoke him. I stiffened slightly as he turned my way and offered a sinister grin. He surprised me by removing his hat and bowing deeply in a proper England greeting. "Greetings and salutations, Ryan Carlson." Standing, he said. "Your heroic exploits are legend even in my world. You have my deepest respect."

"Um... Thank you, Mr Moray." Taken back, I said. "Please state your business."

Devlin placed his hat back onto his head and motioned to the dean's office with his cane. "I have an important meeting with dean Tanaka."

"I fear Mr Tanaka has retired from the position of dean at this school, Mr Moray." Serious, I said. "The new dean is Mrs Elvira Smith."

Devlin chuckled. However, this was a kind chuckle that showed his true gentle nature. "You have the correct definition but the wrong usage." Firmly, he said. "Mr Tanaka is also your world's ambassador. He is the one who negotiated a lasting peace agreement between yours and several other realities, including my own. We code named him 'The Dean'. "

"Just when you thought you knew everything about someone..." Bemused, I thought. Then I said, "As a school prefect, I must insist that you enter the school by more normal means in the future. Your entrance could have sparked a panic."

"Master be careful, he may not have any magic or science ability. But I can sense power from him!" the voice of my katana said in my mind. I do not respond, now is the time for action not words. And Dex seems to know that, for he's already on the attack. In a near second he moves towards me, swords ready to slash down in an X at my chest. I quickly backstep out the way, his blades cutting nothing but air.

I will be at a disadvantage in this battle, as I cannot kill this guy. If I were to do so it would complicate matters further, Dex however has seemingly no hesitation on his part. He intends to kill me, but I will not grant him the chance. He has no idea of what he is dealing with, I only need one chance to win.

I quickly thrust my blade forward with a stab, only for Dex to harmlessly and rather gracefully tilt his body to the side. I click my tongue in my mouth as he brings his left sword towards my neck, I duck under the swing however and thrust the butt of my hilt into his gut. He winces and staggers a little, I use the chance to get some distance by jumping to the right hand side and then back.

Dex merely grins at me however, it's like he enjoys this. I don't want to think about it though, all I know is a whackjob is trying to kill me on the rooftop of my own school. And I won't allow that to happen.

I focus my willpower into my katana, Azura's blade glows a light blue in response to this. I then move the blade around in the air, the blue aura trailing behind the sword. Just to let my opponent know he is dealing with someone with a better blade. "Against anyone else you would be a lethal threat, but to me you will merely be a good workout." I muttered.

Dex kept his grin on "Ah that's a nice sword, I'll enjoy cutting your arm off with it still holding onto it." he said. Licking his lips after it.

As soon as he said that I began to attack, using my swords blue aura as a projectile. The blade shaped energy wave zoomed towards Dex, who again tilted his body to avoid the attack. But I was on him as I went to swing my katana to his abdomen, but he responded by locking both swords against my own one.

"Struggle with all your might, that will make the kill so much better...." Dex muttered.

I said nothing, keeping my focus on the swords in front of me. Only for Dex to suddenly bring his leg up, kicking me below the belt. I could swear my nuts just pushed up into my body, my face contorts into a wince and I'm forced downwards. But not before driving my fist into Dex's gut.

The guy grunts out, moving back and away from me. I take the chance to roll away from him, trying my best to block the numbing pain of my balls. Although my face certainly shows it, and Dex smiles gleefully at me. Oh that fucker, if I didn't need him alive I swear he'd be in for it.

"Needing to fight dirty? Pussy." I state, if he wants to play mind game I ought to return the favour. If only just to give him one spiteful little comment.

Dex just keeps smiling though, and proceeds forward while dragging his swords along the ground. I sheath my blade and get myself ready, Dex brings his blades up for a large jumping uppercut intended to slice me up. Only I have teleported out the way, using my willpower combined with Azura's abilities. In a second I'm behind him, and he knows it as soon as he lands on the ground. In an instant he turns to face me, but I draw my blade and dash forward.

Now we stand back to back, and I sheathe my blade once more. A thin blue line travels past Dex, and blood gushed out from his side. Followed by a yelp of pain, I turned to see Dex on his knees. One of his swords dropped as his hand moved over his wound.

"Y-You bastard, my Father will hear about this!" he spits out as he turns to face me, his face no longer has it's grin. I say nothing, I merely bash him on the head with the butt of my sword. There's a "Dink!" noise and Dex flops over out for the count.

I then proceed to patch his wound up, using a piece of my shirt as a bandage. I then slung him over my shoulder and left the rooftop, making sure to bang his head on the wall. "Prick...." I mutter.

Ryan's POV

The next day I'm in a bus leaving Starmage, in the bus with me are Jenny and Charlie. Our plan is to visit this tailor shop and get a suit for Charlie, or at least that's the plan. I'm hoping that no one will notice Charlie and realise he's a magic familiar, I try to block out the thoughts of him being kidnapped. The kid's had enough shit happen to him.

The ride is a mostly silent affair, Charlie is watching the windows and seeing everything zoom past us. Jenny is silent too, as she and I look around to make sure no one's looking at the kid.

We then get off the bus in a town called Wandill, it's a quaint little village place. I've only been a couple of times to this town, too busy with either school work or other things. But a lot of students like to spend time here, but I'm not here to kickback and relax. No I'm here to get things for a bonding ceremony.

"Stay close to us kiddo." I mutter to Charlie.

The kid nods and grabs Jenny's hand, who smiles and grabs my own. I share the smile and nod to both of them, thankfully luck is on our side. As the tailor's just down the street from the bus stop. and we quickly make our way over there. On the shop window there's various suits, a white morning suit, one with a red tie, hell even a rainbow suit. Charlie eyeballs it and say "No...just no..."

He rolls his eyes and we enter, a bell above the door ringing. We are then greeted by a woman in her 60's, with greying black hair and a purple apron on. She's wearing a pair of glasses and her hair is neatly placed in a bun.

"Hello young people, what do you require today?" she said with a warm smile.

"Uh we need a suit made for the kid here." I say motioning at Charlie.

The woman adjusts her glasses and looked down at the kid, smiling before saying "Ah you must be the child the head witch was talking about, come let's get your suit made. It's on the house."

"Come on Charlie let's go." Jenny said as she gently leads the kid to a mirror.

"R-Right." the kid says to her. The shop owner is telling him to raise his arms up and have them measured, I'm blocking it out. I look around and see things like other suits and dresses, boring.

Then I see a pair of people, and they look familiar. I squint my eyes, and then I see it's those two people from the other world. Tex and Jessica, and they look like they're shopping here. Tex is picking out a suit and Jessica a dress, did they? Better find out....

I walk up behind them, each step I take is quiet and subdued on the floor. Before I'm behind them and then cough to get their attention.

"Jesus Christ!" Tex says, taken aback by my sudden appearance.

"What?!" Jessica says equally surprised.

I smirk, all that training in Asia paid off. The looks on their faces are priceless. But then I go down to business by saying "So what you doing here?" in a casual tone.

"Getting clothes for a ceremony." Jessica says.

Upon hearing that I frown, it seemed like they knew didn't they? I needed to know more, but I figured I might as well be honest with them. "Your not invited to Charlie's bonding ceremony." I say to them while folding my arms.

Tex smiles upon hearing that, okay not what I expected. But then he says "We're not going to that anyway, we're attending another ceremony here in town."

Jessica then chimes in with "It's an anniversary celebrating the rift's opening. Your former headmaster Mr Tanaka is going to be knighted by our Grandfather, as he was vital in keeping the peace following the end of the magic and science war. Your to attend as well."

Upon hearing that I frown even more. "Why me?" I ask.

"In case you haven't noticed you have performed several deeds of note, such as saving the former test subject known as Light Killer. Not to mention your the school's best prefect." Tex says with a smile.

I'm not smiling, how the fuck did they know about Light? Aside from Tanaka and my friends nobody knew who he really way, unless Mr Tanaka told them.

"When is this?" I ask, something tells me I won't like the answer.

"Noon on the dot in 3 days why?" Jessica tells me.

Yeah I really didn't like that answer, and now I feel a headache coming on. That's a sign of something bad coming.
"Charlie's bonding ceremony is at 4PM in 3 days, your serious about bringing me along for this?" I mutter, looking to see Charlie still getting his suit made with Jenny and the shop owner.

"Yes, your going to be Knighted as well alongside Mr Tanaka. To not show up would result in your school losing face, I think your former headmaster would agree that you need to attend." Tex says to me with a frown.

Fuck, fuck fuck fuck. I didn't like this at all. I needed to be in two places. I needed to do something.
"I'll go, but on one condition." I say.

The pair are silent and I say "As soon as the knighting thing is done I'm gone, and I want transport picked out for me."

Tex nods to me and replies with "Sounds reasonable, we'll make sure to arrange it for you."

I give a nod back, and Jenny says to me "Ryan come on, we might as well get a suit done for you as well."

"Sure coming." I say as I walk back to Charlie and Jenny, I'm gonna need to discuss this with my dormmates and come up with a plan.

13511111121212111311112111.content:
-Ryan's POV-

My keen senses told me the the entrance was not what it seemed to be. John sensed it as well and we exchanged worried looks. Mr Tanaka chuckled. "All of the entrances are rigged with a teleport ring, set up on the inside." Calmly, he explained. "They will send any would be party crasher miles away." His face then turned dark. "They have zero tolerance for interruptions."

I nodded but remained silent as we reached the door. A single guard dressed in a high tech armor nodded at each of us as we passed. He bowed respectively to Tanaka and myself. Tanaka gripped my shoulder and bowed back with me quickly following before entering the building. The inside looked much like a medieval castle with a modern twist. The entry way was huge with banners of various family seals being proudly displayed from the ceiling. One that caught my eye was a skull with crossed swords and a moray eel slithering out through the skull's mouth. It was indeed a dark image.

"That is the crest of the Moray family." Sighing, Tanaka said. "Don't let the image deceive you; their motto is, 'Through death is rebirth'."

Inside the main hall further in, I saw a number of seats facing a single huge throne carved out of a single piece of pure crystal. I took note of several guards, dressed and armed in a similar manner to the sentry outside. John, taking notice of this as well sighed. "They are there to protect the king of their secret world, the head mad scientist." Whispering carefully, he said. "The head witch, Elvira Strange has similar heavy protection. Hers is merely more discrete."

"You are not accustomed to their ways, Ryan so you need to keep two things in mind." Darkly, Tanaka whispered. "One, do not speak unless directly spoken to once the ceremony begins. Two, mad scientists make swift, wild motions. Do not take them as aggressive actions."

I nodded but did not respond as we were instructed to stand in front of the throne. A male guard gave us a few brief instructions. "Stand at attention and keep your eyes on those of the head mad scientist when he appears." Firmly but kindly, he said. "He demands full attention of everyone in his presence."

Tanaka and I nodded and the guard left just as Devlin Moray appeared, walking in from a slight distortion in the air. He was dressed in what appeared to be a suit of armor straight out of a science fiction fantasy movie. "To all those who are witness to this ceremony, these two have committed acts of epic courage and valor worthy of song and legend!" Strongly, he announced. "Tanaka, brought lasting peace to our worlds with patience and persistence worthy of any mad scientist! Ryan Carlson freed the lost soul from our world and breathed new life into him before he could be broken!"

Cheers rose from the crowds as Devlin Moray then turned to me. "In our belief, every drop of blood is a piece of our soul." Serious, he explained. "A vial of blood was stolen from my son and taken to your world where our forces are not permitted to travel to maintain the peace. It was used to create who you know as John Doe, the Light Killer. This was reported but we believe the message was intercepted." He sighed. " We will talk of this in length in due time."

With that, the ceremony began with Devlin Moray knighting Tanaka and myself. As the Native American warned, Devlin used wild, swift motions when performing the task but we were only lightly tapped on the shoulder. He then presented us each with a ring with the Moray family seal embedded on the crown. They were each hung from a gold necklace. "With this ring, you are under the protection of the royal family." Serious, Devlin said. "Live in peace and prosper." He then motioned us to face the crowd as he announced, "I present to you, Sir Tanaka and Sir Ryan!"

The crowd cheered as Tanaka and I bowed to the witnesses of the ceremony. Just as we rose, I jumped finding myself inside the back of a moving limousine. I turned to find Tanaka smiling at me. "Well, they did promise you swift transport to the other ceremony." Grinning, he said.

"Bloody hell!" Startled, Charlie yelled. "Where did you two come from!?"

"Watch your language!" Scolding Tanaka and I said in unison.

135111111212121113111121111.content:
Ryan's POV.

Being teleported was an odd feeling, it felt like you were going somewhere but didn't know. Granted I did know where I was going, but....ah it's an odd feeling to describe. Better not dwell on it, after all I have pressing issues to attend to.

"Are the V girls in the church then?" I say, I need to know about the current situation.

"Yeah they arrived in there 5 minutes ago, we took another route to avoid too much heat on everyone." Chon said, that's a relief. Now all we need to do is get Charlie in there, get him bound to Viva and Vogue and hey presto! Problem solved for the time being. Although something tells me it won't be for long, but then I'm just being pessimistic.

Charlie seems a bit nervous about everything, I can understand that. He's pretty much being shotgun wedded, granted it's with girls he really likes. But still, add to that he still doesn't actually know how to harness his power yet. Looking back this sort of thing may have occurred with John and Megan, I didn't bother to ask.

I glance to Light, and he looks really not at home. He's never worn a suit before, when I first met him in that forest he wore nothing but a pair of white trousers from his test lab. Even then when he wore the school uniform he was always shirtless as much as he could be, something told me he just wasn't used to the stuff. I then look at his white shirt, and see his black tattoos glowing slightly.

Chon meanwhile just looks like he just wants to get this over with, I can tell he's still not too chuffed with what his adopted kids are doing. But they asked for it, and besides I can just tell him how powerful they'd become thanks to Charlie buffing them with magic power. Then he'll change his tune no doubt.

"We're here." said the driver in front of us, I didn't get a look at the guy. But right now we needed to get in that church.

And as soon as we step out....what a scene. There's various girls, aged 12 to 16. Who are all wearing wedding dresses, and upon seeing Charlie nervously exit the limo they are all screaming at the top of their lungs. I groan, should have known it'd been linked. I ever see that Dex Bedlam git again I'm gonna chop his nuts off and stick them on a frying pan.

"THERE HE IS!!!!"

"HEY MAGIC BOY!!!!"

"OH SO CUTE!!!!!"

The girls were shouting various other things to him, flirting comments and the like. I shook my head and walked in front, thankfully the prefects were keeping them away from the line. I eyeballed a few of the rouge witch hunters, from what I remembered they were the elite of the elites. Elvira was coming through, I honestly felt like things might be okay if we have experience security forces like them.

Chon and Light are walking on Charlie's sides, the kid keeps his eyes front and centre. Meanwhile the girls are throwing things like roses, gift wrapped boxes, kiss stained tissues and the likes. Chon and Light swat away any hands that manage to slip through the guards, they were given orders not to go any further than that. Even though Light would have no qualms about breaking them, but we need to stay focused. Mr Tanaka is behind us, I'm feeling glad that he's here. Even though by all rights he's retired and could be on a boat with his wife sailing the world, he's still pitching in when we need it.

I manage to make my way to the front of the church, with my fellows. I turn to look at Charlie and say "Ready kiddo?"

Charlie manages a nod "Y-Yeah, I'll be glad to just be with Viva and Vogue." he says to me. He's smiling after it, that's good. I can tell that he really wants this, those girls will treat him right I'm sure. And with that I proceed to open the door to let us all in.

Ryan's POV

The doors to the church open with a loud and heavy creaking noise, it's all I try to focus on as I block the noises of the female mob outside. No use in paying attention to them now, after all the prefects and the rouge witch hunters can handle them. I make a mental note to thank Elvira later, having elite law enforcement like them around certainly makes me feel better.

And so we walk forth into the church, and I'm amazed at the sight of the interior.
http://www.stpaulschurchog.com/files/wed...

There has been no expense spared, even though it's just a minor ceremony from what I'm told. But of course Charlie is a rare thing, and so something like that demands protocol. Which reminds me, I quickly turn around and adjust the kid's tie. It looks a bit ajar, Charlie just looks at me with a funny look.

After that's done I see Jenny to my right, and instantly embrace her. She licks my left ear and mutters "What kept you?"

"Scientists and their stuff, nothing to worry about now though. It's done, let's get this done." I mutter in response.

I then take a look at the V girls, the pair are wearing identical dresses. Pearl white with "Beloved." written in Mandarin at the hip of their dresses, no doubt something that Chon put in. Speaking of which he's gone over to them, kneeling down and checking their outfits. He's griping about how they haven't got it right or something like that, I shake my head and take a seat in one of the front rows.

Jenny moves to me, and takes a seat to my left. Amy is sitting behind me, with Light and Lunar. Chon is at the other front row, with Mr Tanaka. Elvira arrives in a room to the left, dressed in an elegant black dress and a book held in her hands. I assume that's the vows she's going to say to Charlie and the girls.

"You got here safe then Carlson?" she asks me.

I smile and nod "No trouble at all Dean, what about the girls?" I ask.

Elvira sighs and said "You no doubt saw the mob of girls outside trying to seek Charlie's affection yes?"

I nod and the Dean goes on with "As we brought Viva and Vogue into the church there was a large group of boys doing the same thing."

Now that was odd, I can understand Charlie considering it has been leaked out that he's now a walking beacon of pure magical power. But why the girls? The only thing they had was that they had been daughters to a rouge witch called Eva, but they disowned their Mother after Chon adopted them.

Mr Tanaka then sheds light on this for us by saying "Viva and Vogue's biological mother is rich, from her years of criminal activity. As she is in witch prison for life due to several charges, that wealth is automatically passed on to her daughters. Whoever marries them will gain that vast wealth."

Upon hearing this Chon gives a heavy sigh and replies by saying "Another piece of information that bastard, Dex hacked and sold?"

"Yes I'm afraid, our school really needs to improve it's security. I hope you haven't become lax in this Elvira?" Tanaka says with a smirk.

Upon hearing that Elvria grins and says "Technology these days."

Just as we are about to begin though, Chon suddenly raises his head and says "Someone's coming!" and no sooner does he say that do two people I hoped wouldn't be here.

"Hi Charlie!!" the voice is that of Rose Ren, one of Charlie's older twin Sisters. I groan aloud and drop my head into my waiting hands.

Rose and Carla have somehow entered the church, I forgot all about them. To be honest I was hoping they'd have no idea this was even happening. They're wearing dresses for the occasion and look really happy, funny considering up till now they've treated the poor kid like shit. Only after hearing about what he really is do they finally act nice to him.

"Piss off." Light bluntly stated, glaring daggers at the girls.

Upon hearing that Carla pouts and says "Come on we need to be here, Charlie is still family. Therefore we're required to be here."

"Yeah he's still our Brother! And also we're all people from Starmage are we not?" Rose chimes in, they're faking it. A beast doesn't change it's ways just because it doesn't bear it's fangs.

Mr Tanaka looks at Elvira silently, who gives a nod. The native American man sighs and says "You may attend this ceremony, but any trouble on your part will cost you dearly."

Rose and Carla simply nod and sit at the far right row, way at the very back. With that Charlie is already at the altar with the V girls, as some music that I picked out begins to play.
