1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

I walk to the door and open it, I then look at Ruby and say "Well? Ladies first."

In response to this Ruby tilts her head and says "Well thanks, your a top student and a gentleman. All in one."

"I try to do so." giving a small smirk, I motion with my head and Ruby heads in. Wordlessly Weiss, Blake and Yang enter also. I take a moment to look at the school before making my way back in, inside the dorm is a buzz of activity as it usually is in this time of the day.

"Everyone in the living room!" I shout as I enter there, I motion for team RWBY to take a seat. The girls take one of the big couches, the one right next to the window. One by one my friends enter the room and take up various spots in the room.

"Now for those who weren't here when I did my briefing we have some new guests. And they're from another world, not the one we've been to before but another one. Introduce yourselves girls." I say as I grab a folding chair and sit next to them, Jenny does the same.

"Okay well uh....I'm Ruby. And this is Blake, Weiss and that's my Sister Yang. We're like an elite team of monster hunters, and we're called team RWBY! I know it's kinda odd and we get mixed up at times, but ya know!" Ruby says. Smooth, real smooth.

"Yep, well you girls know me. This little kitty cat is Jenny Forth, she's a Neko. Half human and half cat witches. I didn't mention that last night cause you just got in." I motion to the brown haired girl that I call my love.

"Meow! I'm half cat alright! Check it!" Jenny says, she flicks her fingers and suddenly brown tufts of fur pop up on her head.

Ruby's eyes go wide as she leans forward to look at them. "Oh wow! They look so cute! Can you make them move?"

Jenny giggles, and her ears go back and forth and side to side. Ruby leans forward as if to touch them but Jenny quickly leans back and says "No! They're sensitive, o-only Ryan can touch them! These sacred tufts of fur! Hiss!!"

In response I quickly cough and lean forward, putting my hand on one cheek so Ruby and co can't see my blush. Dammit Jenny, your getting the brush on them later tonight! Blake is paying close attention to Jenny's ears, is there a similarity with the pair of them? Maybe, side note ask Jenny if she can have fancy eyes. Ruby huffs and sits back, Weiss rolls her eyes at this. Yang gives a little chuckle.

"Moving on, you already know this one. The guy with the red blindfold is Chon, he's my wingman." I motion with a hand. In response Chon nods politely to team RWBY, even with his blindfold it's evident he's staring right at them.

"Woah! Can you see us?" Ruby asks.

Chon gives a small smirk before saying with his Chinese accent "Why yes, it's one of my many powers. I can detect your chi and see you based on it, your hearts are in the right place morally."

Yang smiles, I quickly asses that she's looking at his biceps before saying "So I gotta ask. What's behind the blindfold? Is it another blindfold? Can you shoot lasers?"

Oh shit, you shouldn't have said that. Fuck, fuck. Chon's smile suddenly turns sinister, Viva and Vogue close their eyes and cover them with their hands. The man then stands up and walks forward, I quickly turn my gaze around as Chon's hands go up to remove his blindfold. Suddenly the temperature in the room just dropped harshly, and I can swear I hear muttering in Chinese. Sounds like something from a ghost or something.

Chon then sat back down and had his blindfold on, mercifully it was only a few seconds. I risk a glance at team RWBY, who actually look unsettled by it to varying degrees.

"Do you walk around with an injury like that?!" Weiss spluttered out, a good thing her hair can't get any more white than it already is. Blake's silent, but her eyes are wide.

"Damn, that was.....just..well...spooky." Yang mutters, man I remembered the first time he did that to me. Fuck I couldn't eat for the rest of the day. Ruby rubs her eyes real quick, you know that colour she's got is pretty nice. Not as nice as Blake's, still good though.

Chon smirks and says "That answers your question, these blonde girls are my adoptive kids Viva and Vogue. Do say something my dears." he motioned to the twins. When it comes to those Chon's actually a really good carer for them, he's actually happy thanks to them.

"H-Hello, a pleasure to meet you." they state while they give a bow. They're shy when it comes to meeting new people, they've had it rough before they came into Chon's care. To put it mildly.

"Aw hey there, so are you the grasshoppers to uh, ol redeyes here?" Yang says, redeyes? Really? Damn.

Viva gives a little giggle before saying "Well yes, we train everyday. We're only to fight as a last resort though."

"Yes, we only fight to defend others. Like our dear Charlie! Give us a hug." Vogue says as she leans in and wraps her arms around his left.

"Sister I am hugging him too!" Viva grabs Charlie by the right and they both glare at the other, the aforementioned shyness went right away when he was brought in.

"So Chon was it? Your daughters are both dating the same boy?" Weiss says with a small frown.

The Chinese man merely grunts and says "They are not harmed, so I see no problem with it. Charlie introduce yourself boy."

Charlie then nods to team RWBY, he's not saying anything so I motion with my hand for him to do so. "Um, h-hi. Your our new dorm mates yes? I'm Charlie, pleased to meet you."

I lean in to Ruby and mutter "The kid's had a very rough and abusive childhood as I said earlier, he can be a bit timid towards women because of it."

"Oh.....well he does seem happy at least." Ruby responds, something about when I said women made her a little sombre. I simply nod, the kid has been through a lot. Least I can do is make him a better life.

Its then that Yang noticed Light and says "Hey there big guy, what's the weather like up there?"

Light's 6ft 9inches tall, and he emerges from behind the kitchen table. He's shirtless as he usually is, with his intricate magically enchanted tattoos on display. Yang looks like she's eating the eye candy, the tattoos and biceps. Team RWBY's checking those tattoos out, I have to admit even after being used to them they can still catch your sight.

Light frowns before saying to me "Boss what is she talking about? We can all see the weather, it's right out there." and he then points at the window behind RWBY.

In spite of his name Light is actually very dim, the room becomes very quiet. And I turn my head away in shame, Yang leans in and mutters "Is he serious?"

"Fraid so, his name's Light by the way. Though he prefers John." I mutter back, better set the record for the future. Just in case Yang thinks Light's playing her, he couldn't play twinkle twinkle little star. Weiss frowns before shaking her head, Blake lifted an eyebrow and Ruby blinked rapidly. Light simply does a meh motion with his hands before getting a cola can from the fridge.

Shomei then coughs politely before saying "Your are new dorm mates yes? My name is Shomei Akatsuki, pleasure to meet you." and he gives a formal bow as well. Weiss smiles before nodding her head to him. Blake does the same respectful gesture, perhaps it's how Sho carries himself.

"That's a nice jacket you got there, are you like some sort of military officer? Tenhut!" Yang says giving a salute, it's the way Shomei carries himself. And how he wears his usual coat, and he is former JSDF.

Sho frowns, before giving a small chuckle and saying "Er, something along those lines. It's a long story, best saved for another day." he's usually straight laced. But we're rubbing off on him, Ruby and co might be surprised regarding him.

"Well the girl in the corner is Amy, and Lunar's next to Light." I state, Amy simply nods and waves. She's not really a sociable person. More so with guys, but she'll warm over time I'm sure.

Lunar meanwhile states "Hello, I know little about Remnant. I have always curious to know more, I hope you can assist me with that." she bows, and then suddenly her head comes off! And the people of team RWBY react in shock to this, heck that always gets me. And Lunar delights in it I'm sure.

"Oh my God!" Weiss yelled out as she fell back in her chair. Lunar quickly scooped her head back up before giggling.

"My apologies, it's just I'm a robot you see. And from what I've learned from human nature pranks on newcomers tend to be common. Again I apologize if I caused any undue stress or harm." Lunar says with a nod of the head.

I rub my temples before checking the room, I then say to Light "John where's your Sister Jane?"

"In the library." Light mutters after crushing the can in his hands.

Thought so, that girl took to books like a fish to water. Blake then pipes up with "Um would it be alright if I could check the library? I'm interested in seeing what is there."

"Fine with me, anyone else going?" I say standing up, Jenny pinches my butt and walks out the room to signal yes.

Weiss stands up and says "I'm going to relax for today."

"Yeah same here, can't make my puns if I'm tired." Yang says as she heads to her room.

"See you later Carlson." Ruby says, the three of them retire to their dorm room. I motion to Blake to follow and we're out with that.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Meeting the rest of the team.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

The following morning, I wake up to a visit from dean Elvira. She had a bemused look on her face which was rather out of character for her. She smiled at team RWBY who were all waking up at the same time.

"I apologize for waking you all up before classes but I need you all to meet the new team junior rogue hunters to form at Starmage." Politely, she said. "This group rather surprised me but I am curious to see how they pan out in the up coming days."

Dean Elvira lead us all out of our dorms to a dorm on the other side of the school. She then motioned me to enter as I was the leader of my group. I grab the door by it's handle and open it, and instantly I am shocked by what I witness. There, standing in the middle of the main room of the far dorm was the team Elvira had mentioned. It was Rose and Carla Ren, Charlie's sisters! With them were three of the most infamous quasi rogue students Starmage had ever seen! What threw me off was that they looked really....well.....different.....

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/pret...

Rose had pink hair, and Carla was dyed blue. They and the other quasi rogues were wearing dress style uniforms straight out of a fantasy costume store. They looked ridiculous! The one with the green hair was Lisa Montaron, she was known for drawing pictures of boys dressed as girls and pasting them on their backs. The blonde was Eliza McTon, a bitchy cheerleader in the Starmage cheerleading squad. And the orange girl was Erin Godda, a rather hotheaded woman with a penchant for picking fights with guys.

"Oh hi Ryan!" Carla shouts with a really gleeful wave, all of it just seemed so damn surreal. The hair, the outfits and the beaming smiles seemed so out of place for them that I half suspected they were under some bizarre curse. Suddenly Rose leaned down and....gave Charlie a hug?! It seemed oddly friendly too.

In an instant Viva and Vogue are right at Rose. Just as it looked like all hell was going to break loose Rose backed away, with her hands up to signal peace. "Woah! Easy! No harm meant girls!" Rose says with concern in her voice.

The V girls cling to Charlie's and glare daggers at Rose, to be honest I was waiting for them to beat the shit out of Rose and her sister. Only they held themselves back. Chon had trained them well. Viva then blurted out, "What's with the hair and outfits?"

Carla smiles and says "Well you recall that incident with Matt, and how we were punished for it yeah?"

How could we forget, I felt like celebrating. But I merely just nod my head, this prompts Rose to go on with "To put it mildly, we were experimented on. And it wasn't very nice, at all. It's amazing a human can survive without a spine eh Sis?"

My other Sister nods and says "It was sort of like a wakeup call, all that torture and we realise something. We put you through that, but for much longer. And we know that our Mother is to blame for that, but in the end our actions are also to considered our own."

Rose then chimes in "We vowed never to walk down that dark path again! We want to make things right, and so we've set about finding other women in our school. Who you could say were teetering on the brink towards evil, we shared what happened to us and explained what we had in mind."

Lisa speaks with "We've decided to renounce our ways, and try to set about fixing our mistakes and helping those in need! So from now on we're the...."

"Princesses....." Erin says, with practised bravado.

"Of........." Eliza

"Justice!~~" Rose and Carla says at the same time, the group then get close to each other and smile and make poses.

Both my team and team RWBY are silent. We were at a loss for words to say thew least. Now I know why dean Elvira seemed so bemused. The worst quasi students in the history of Starmage were suddenly switching sides and fighting against evil?! I will believe that when I see it in action; words only carry so much weight. The silence was broken when Matt Moray, the transfer student to Beacon Academy spoke.

"Your uniforms are certainly eye catching." Raising an eyebrow, he said. "I suggest you tone them down a bit and go for a type of armor as you will no doubt face rogues who will consider you 'traitors' to their twisted cause."

"Oh these are armor!" Grinning, Rose replied. "We made them this way so to draw a villain's attention away from the victim we are rescuing!"

"Wow.." shaking his head, Charlie said.

The three groups then fell into conversation; an oddly friendly one at that. Dean Elvira giggled before taking her leave. "This will prove to be interesting." Amused, she stated. "They will be acting prefects while you and your team are visiting Beacon Academy."

This shocked the hell out of me! "What?!"

"Do not fear, they will be closely monitored." Smiling, Elvira said. "This will be their one test to prove their worth after renouncing their old ways."

With that, she left, looking rather bemused. I could not blame her, I was bemused as well but by the sheer irony of it all. I turned back to the conversation to hear Ruby ask Ozpin "When these people enter Beacon Academy, they are going to need weapons to fight the darkness."

Ozpin chuckled ever so slightly. "My dear Ruby... they are weapons."

Ruby gasped. "What?"

Ozpin turned to the three groups, clearing his throat. "I believe some practice duels are in order so we can all see if the err... Princesses of Justice are ready for their role as temporary prefects."

"That is a good idea." Serious, I said. "I need to know if Starmage is in good hands while we are off to another realm."


Hours later, all three teams meet at the dueling field where Ozpin paired the first match. He told me that I would pick the next pair to face each other. The first two to face off were...

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

"Why these two?" Curious, I asked.

Ozpin smiled. "Both are relatively new and not completely certain of themselves." Calmly, he replied. "Ruby is very fast and skilled with her Scythe but, on the same coin, Matt can summon anything he wishes out of pure energy including clones of himself." He turned to Matt and Ruby. "Begin!"

"I'll make this quick, kid!" Charging Matt, she announced.

Matt grinned. "You think?"

Suddenly, there were ten identical boys facing Ruby with their fists raised. She stopped, momentarily confused which was all Matt needed. He fired an energy blast from his and his clones' hands, sending Ruby stumbling back.

"Expect the unexpected, Ruby." Smiling, Ozpin instructed. "You do not know your opponent as well as the creatures of darkness."

"I'm over here, little girl!" Taunting, Matt yelled.

"No!" Calling out, a clone said. "I'm over here!"

"Don't listen to them!" Yelled another clone. "The real me is over here!"

Each of Matt's clones had run off in different directions, surrounding Ruby. They were each claiming to be the real Matt. Fortunately, Ruby saw through their scheme and jumped up out of the path of their blasts, allowing the energy beams to cross, hitting all of the clones. All of the copies vanished in a puff of smoke, leaving the real Matt momentarily stunned as Ruby landed on her feet.

"There you are!" Grinning, Rose announced.

"The same trick rarely works twice, Matt Moray." Grinning, Chon called out. "Try something else."

Ruby charged again, this time keeping her eyes on the real Matt. He responded by raising his wolf like tail, summoning a magical shield. Ruby's scythe made contact. She smiled seeing the shield shatter but frowned as the pieces came together to form a scythe identical to her own only in Matt's size.

Matt gave Ruby a mad grin as he expertly spun the scythe around like a baton before pointing the curved blade at her. "On guard, Ruby!"

Ruby smiled. "You may have made a copy of my weapon but you have no experience in using it!" Boldly, she said. "I'd surrender now."

Matt childishly stuck his tongue out at her. "Blah, blah, blah!"

"Does Matt really think this match is a game?" Shaking his head, Light inquired. "In real life, his antics could get him killed."

"He is also only seven years old." Calmly, Ozpin countered. "To boys that age, everything is a game. he needs to learn that he must mature before his time if he wants to face monsters."

I turn to the Dean and give a nod before saying "Yes, in swordplay. Why do you ask?"

Elvira smiled before saying "Would you and him be interested in seeing what he is capable of? Against say Blake Belladonna?" in response I look to Charlie. The kid briefly meets my gaze before looking at the grass in front of him, is she serious. Against a member of Team RWBY? Blake looks noticeably hesitant, perhaps because she is slated to fight a child.

In response I instantly turn to Elvira and Ozpin before stating "Mr Ozpin, Dean Elvira I must protest this. Charlie has barely learned to know what it is to wield a blade, let alone tap into his powers as a magical familiar. "I see, and based off your comments you bet against him?" Blake asks with a frown, she doesn't seem too happy that she seemed to be slated up against a kid.

Ozpin nods before sighing, he then states "Yes, but you have to understand that this is important. Not the fact that I lost 20 dollars. "Correct, however we'll get nowhere if neither trusts the other. Since Charlie will not fight Ms Belladonna will there be others to volunteer?" Elvira says.

Before I can talk further Chon pats me on the back and says "I'll step up."

The blind man smiles and walks forward and nods to Blake. "I am simply curious as to how these people fight, Blake since you seem to be chosen will you battle me? I assure you despite my blindness I am perfectly capable of holding my own in fights, as you might know."

Chon smiles and then kneels down, he had hidden weapons there it seemed. And he produced a pair of Shaolin hook swords, he then took his uniform's coat and shirt off. He handed them to Viva and Vogue who bowed to him before stepping off the field.

"You will fight to either first blood, or until the other yields." Ozpin states as we make our way off the field.

"Go elder Brother!" Viva shouts.

"Take that woman down! To Chinatown!" Vogue cries out.

Chon says nothing, but merely nods to Blake as he settles into a stance. Blake readies her weapon, and then settles into a stance of her own. I'm actually looking forward to this one, and it begun....

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Chon's POV

So I finally get a chance to face one of those from another world, I will be honest with my opponent now. I draw my blades and crack my neck lightly and state to Blake "Blake-san, I don't trust you 100 percent."

Blake lifted an eyebrow and says "I see. I felt that from you Chon, its fine. I feel similar to you."

Thought so, we are from two worlds. Carlson probably doesn't like my view here. But I can have my own opinion and mindset. Blake readies herself and so do I. I make no dilly dallying and use my chi to boost forward and aim a kick at Blake's gut, Clearly she was taken aback and landed a good distance away but recovered quickly, Blake quickly drew her weapon and fired a bullet at me, the handle taking a gun like format. I naturally tilt my body to one side to avoid it. My past in hunting witches gave me plenty of experience in avoiding long ranged attacks, she fires more but I simply run and use my reflexes to dodge them.

"You will need to do better than that to get Chon lady!" Viva yelled out and I smirked in response.

I close the distance quickly, Blake wide eyed at my agility and speed. I lift my left blade and aim to slice into her midriff. Blake blocks and then uses her bladed sheath to try and attack me, I roll away and stand up. My chi energy surges in my body, radiating in a thick blue aura to remind Blake she faces no mere blind man. But the blind revenge of China.

I continue on the offence, attack, attack and attack. But instead of swinging with a blade I instead lift up my left leg and connect at the waist, instantly Blake's eyes roll back in her head and I lifted her up 2 feet in the air. Blake groans as I struck her in the liver.

"Hey low blow!" Yang barks at me.

"I made a fair move." I simply remark. When I was fighting witches they would do anything to win, I am simply applying my own tactics based off my experience. Blake rolls backward and suddenly I notice that she has a long black cloth wrapped around her weapon and flung it at my feet, wrapped around my leg. Yanking the ground out from under me, sending me down to the grass. Blake tries to yank me towards her, but I quickly dig my hookswords into the grass to remain where I was.

Using my chi energy I grunt loudly and heft my legs upwards, Blake was taken aback by this and as I suspected I was physically stronger than her. I lift a hooksword up to try and cut her rope, sensing this Blake retracts her weapon away from me. I roll away and move once again to press the offence. I prefer to be the aggressor in battle, always dictating the pace of the fight if I can help it. Blake dodges my strikes with my hookswords, but I use my reliable fallback.

Hand to hand.

I fling my weapons up into the air, as expected Blake is momentarily caught off guard. I use my chi energy to manipulate the movements of my hands, appearing as blurs to the untrained eye. Blake's seemingly are. I proceed to follow up with a series of kicks and punches, Blake tries to muster an offence but by the time it takes for her to lift her weapon up I socked her in the gut. I floor her with a palm thrust to the gut. As Blake makes to stand up I catch a hooksword by the handle and aim the blade at her neck.

"Yield Blake-san, I win." I simply state.

Blake pants quietly near me, her eyes focusing on the gleam of my steel hook swords. She then says "Fine you win."

I put my blades away and let Blake stand up, she was probably expecting me to help her up. "In my country's culture we don't shake hands. But a bow shows our respect." I perform said action.

"Uh okay, nice fight Chon. You certainly live up to your nickname." Blake dusts herself off. I wave to Viva and Vogue and give a small smile.

Ryan states to me "Know I can count on you pal." Carlson probably knows how I won, I mixed up my offence and relied not on just my weapons but my entire body. Blake probably didn't expect that.

Ruby nears me and asks "Say Chon, I am curious. You glowed blue in battle, can you use Aura?"

"Ah Aura, well its not that. Its known as chi, the life force inherit to all living things. Its similar in practice I see now, we can use it to protect ourselves for example." I reply, Are they one and the same? Could I use Aura and a Semblance? Our world is already vast and another is almost entirely different.......

Amy quickly threw up a force field only this time, it was a sphere, protecting her and her team. Unfortunately, that left Team RWBY to fend for themselves.

Weiss, her outfit covered in food stains, was less than impressed with Matt and Amy. "Revenge will be ours and it will taste sweet!"

The other girls voiced their approval and the free for all food fight was on...

Students go there during their time off and some even stay there if we don't have enough rooms for them, I've been there a few times myself. But for the most part I've just kept to the school and hit the books when I had time, all the stuff we get up to leaves little room for studying. http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/mega...

Jenny meanwhile is in a pair of blue jeans, black sneakers and a creamy white jumper. Light's got black leather pants and shoes with belt buckles all tied around the ankles, with an orange jumper with the sleeves torn off. Lunar wears the dress that she normally has, she doesn't really need to wash her clothes. What with being a robot she doesn't really produce sweat after all.

Chon's wearing black tracksuit trousers and shoes, with a red shirt that has Chinese letters for fighter. The V girls wear matching white jeans and pink leather jackets. Charlie's got that coat I bought for his birthday, a red and white one. He's wearing a pair of shorts and sandals.

Huanle's wearing a red qipao and thigh high boots. Sho's still wearing that sort of military uniform he's always got, it helps him use his blitzmotor. The tech that is fused into him. Jane's wearing a big green dress, she smiles a little but glances around the place as she normally does.

I turn my head and nod at team RWBY, they've changed as well. Weiss has a really nice white dress with black buttons, not too far from how she looked before. Ruby's still got that hood on, but she's casual looking too. Gotta admit Yang's got a nice coat on, Blake's simple but nice.

They give their thanks, I'm on next with Jenny and we sit behind Ruby and co. Everyone else piles in after, I'm sitting in front with Jenny taking the window seat. Ruby and Yang are behind us, with Blake and Weiss behind them.

Sure enough we're all on and the bus starts driving, as we go through the pristine forests that surround the land of Starmage Yang taps me on the shoulder and says "So Carlson, tell us a bit bout yourself why don't you?"

"Alright. Shoot." I response leaning back in my seat.

"How old are you?"

"17."

I thought Yang was the same age as me, Ruby looks just a little bit younger than us. I've got an eye for details.

Yang's silent for a moment, I can tell she's looking at Ruby there. But she responds with "Me and Ruby are Sisters, we've sort of got the same problem with parents. Just kinda the other way around....."

"No, Neko's are the only ones that occur. We don't know how they came to being, other than witches hundreds of years ago attempted some form of ritual. To let them shift into the forms of their favourite pets, but something went wrong and we don't know it." Jenny explains.

"Wow, lost to the ages then? Say do you get any perks with that though?" Yang asks.

"Yeah we get some gifts, better smell and hearing. And our magic tends to be more potent than a typical witch, not to brag but I'm one of the best in my year it turns out." my girlfriend gives a little giggle in response to this.

"Means she can't ever play hide and seek, makes things too unfair." I remark, Jenny elbows me in the arm with a huff.

Before long we arrive, it's not too far from Starmage after all. It's pretty bustling in the evening, most students come here after all. So there's a lot of trade from the students. Me and everyone else get off the bus and Elvira states "Okay everyone, you've been given money. Do what you wish, but be here for 7 or your staying at the capsule hotel for tonight."

"Capsule what?" Weiss asks.

"It's a place where you sleep in a really small room for the night, quite popular over in Japan from what I know. Anyway, off with all of you!" Elvira says as she walks back into the bus.

He offered Jane a plate of cookies, which she timidly accepted then offered her a seat while he sat down in a chair opposite of a table. "First of all, Jane, I completely understand your fear of combat." Calmly, Ozpin said. "No warrior wishes to see anyone killed who does not deserve it. However, the food fight in the cafeteria was mere play, why did it frighten you so?"

Ozpin tilted his head slightly to one side. "What do you mean?"

"I was trained to fight to kill!" Crying, Jane screamed. "I can't do that again!" She slumped in her chair, sobbing. "I can't... not again!"

Ozpin was silent for a moment before stating, "I see..." He then took a sip of his coffee. "The monsters of Grim do not have a soul, Jane."

I raised a single eyebrow as Jane looked at Ozpin, curious. "No soul..." Wincing, she asked. "How is that even possible?"

"They were created through dark energy." Simply, Ozpin replied. "You can use the skills that were given to you for evil to do great good."

"How?" Hopeful, Jane demanded. "How can a trained killer learn not to kill?"

"By releasing your aura." Standing up, Ozpin said. "It is a part of your very soul which surrounds and protects you from evil and harm."

Ozpin shook his head, a smile forming. "I will not be doing this." Calmly, he said. He opened the door, revealing Light who was listening in from outside. "He will."

Light entered the room, looking confused as Ozpin closed the door. "What is this about auras and my sister's soul?" Gruffly, he demanded.

"Place your left hand onto her right shoulder, Light." Ignoring the question, Ozpin commanded.

Light turned to me, raising an eyebrow. I nodded and he did as Ozpin instructed. "Okay..."

"Close your eyes, Jane." Calmly, Ozpin said. "Focus on your inner self."

Ozpin then walked Light through a strange ritual similar to the awakening of ones Chi I learned from Chon when he awakened the chi within Viva and Vogue. Once the ritual was over, Jane opened her eyes and smiled slightly. "I feel... strange." Softly, she said. "In a good way but still strange."

"By releasing your aura, the memories of your torment are but a forgotten dream." Calmly, Ozpin said. "You will still remember them only you will no longer be controlled by them." He then sat back down at the table, taking a sip of his endless cup of coffee. "If you wish to join us at Beacon Academy, you will need to forge a weapon as well."

I decided to check up on Jane the next day to find that...

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

We soon arrived at Beacon Academy which hovered high above a small city we were told was called Vale. The kid, Matt Moray was standing alone in a neutral stance with his hands behind his back. He was wearing the Eligere Sententia school uniform which was black pants with a light grey stripe one the outer sides, a white shirt with grey tie and a long white lab coat with black boots to finish the outfit. On the lab coat was the insignia from the school which was a DNA strand with two swords crossing through it.

"I guess he will be representing the school from his own world." Softly, Weiss muttered. "I shudder to think what they might teach there."

"I've never been there." Honestly, I said. "I have heard that their teaching methods are... unique."

Weiss shrugged it off and moved on as the doors to the ship opened; we had arrived. I looked about, impressed by the fine architecture and diversity of students. Matt Moray was exiting with a number of robots carrying his small cargo of spice. Where did he get those? Nearby, Weiss was with her servants, moving her cargo of dust. The two shot each other an impatient look then walked away from each other with a huff. I smiled, knowing that they come from similar backgrounds; both used to always getting exactly what they wanted.

"This place is amazing!" Whispering, Jenny said. "I wonder what type of magic or science keeps this place hovering over the city!"

"Maybe you can ask Ozpin when you get the chance." Smiling, I said.

Jenny smiled back then turned to see a tall man in some kind of military uniform approaching. Ozpin gave a slight chuckle seeing him and motioned us all to his side. "Students, guests, this is General Ironwood from the city of Atlas." Introducing us, he said. He then frowned slightly motioning upwards to a large number of flying ships. "I see you brought your army here."

"I take my work with me everywhere I go, Ozpin." Calmly, he said. "Speaking of an army, who are these strangers you have brought with you?"

"Prince Matt Moray." Stepping forward, Matt stated. "I and this group were invited in a gesture of good will between two parallel worlds whom a stable opening had been formed. This one week visit will not disrupt the normal affairs of this world."

"A prince, huh?" Unimpressed, Ironwood stated. "Do not expect me to bow before you."

Matt frowned. "A true warrior bows to no man." Sternly, Matt said. He turned to his robots. "Escort me to my quarters! I must prepare for the opening ceremonies!"

"Yes, my prince!" Saluting, a robot responded.

The robots escorted Matt away with his small number of large suitcases as Ironwood watched him leave. "Well, he's a charmer." Sarcastically, he said.

Ozpin smiled. "He is a child, General." Smiling, he said. "Also, he has something that may help our world greatly in the days to come."

Ironwood raised an eyebrow. "Really?"

"We will discuss the matter at a later time." Politely, Ozpin said. "Right now, I must speak to our new students so if you will excuse us."

Ironwood nodded then left as Ozpin turned to my team and I. "I allowed Matt to move ahead because I have already given him my speech earlier." Calmly, he said. "You are all here to expand your knowledge and hone your skills but all I see at the moment is wasted energy."

I winced at that as Light raised a single eyebrow at that while Chon grunted, clearly not liking where the speech was going. Still they remained silent as Ozpin continued.

"Knowledge will only get you so far. More advanced weapons are only as good as their greatest weakness as they can be taken advantage of." Serious, Ozpin said. "Knowledge, strength, weapons and tactics must all work in unison to achieve the status of a true Huntsmen or huntress. Your initiation begins tomorrow at sunrise; be ready."

With that, he walked away from the group as Yang took one of Light's arms. "Come on, big guy!" Smiling, she said. "I'll show you to the dorms!" She winked. "I'll then show you your dorm. Growl..."

Jenny suppressed a giggle as Yang lead Light ahead of the others while Rose motioned to a different direction. "The exchange student dorms are down that hall." Kindly, she said. "You will find your names posted on the doors."

"We each get separate rooms?" Curious, Chon asked.

"It's one large dormitory with several bedrooms." Smiling, Rose said. "We are used to hosting large amount of exchange students."

A snort escapes my lips "Pretty much, the people who made me did all sorts of things to me. They didn't care about my say in it, they just wanted a weapon that could beat the shit out of things. They succeeded in that at least, because I broke free and killed them. Well most of them anyway."

"Woah.....Light that's....." Yang mutters, I risk a glance over to her and I see concern in her eyes. I look down at the murky water and see my reflection in it.

"Mhm, they got what they wanted but they couldn't control it. When I broke out, all I could think about was fighting. I picked fights with anyone and anything that came near me, I relished the feeling that I got from winning, from crushing anything that stood before me. Bears, humans, you name it. I became a fucking monster who was only focused on destruction....." I mutter, I give a heavy sigh after it all. Memories of my time wandering, with only a pair of ragged white trousers. I kill a bear in one punch to the head, and then I rip it open and feast on it's guts without even roasting it.

Yang says nothing at first, but she puts a hand on my back. My instinct tells me to freeze up, and I do. But Yang keeps her hand in place, and eventually my body accepts it. And she then says "So how did you meet Carlson then?"

I give a chuckle to that and say "I wandered onto the forest near Starmage, Carlson's a prefect there you know. And he caught me and demanded to know what I doing, probably thought I was some random bum from a looney bin. And he ends up kicking my ass, first time anything ever beat me. And I'm laying there flat on my back, and I'm just muttering for him to finish me."

Yang gives a laugh and says "Course I'm the second person who's kicked your ass, I got the right cheek. Anyway go on."

"Well Carlson's a nice guy, so he doesn't kill me. Instead he asks who the hell I am and everything, and it was pretty surprising. No one ever bothered to sit down and talk with me, but we chatted and I told him everything. I didn't know that I had things to hide. We came back to the place where I was made, everyone's long gone. But I put the place to the fucking torch, anything I couldn't burn I blew up." I still remember the smell of the fires, and the sounds of glass cracking. It makes me feel happy.

"I'm glad you did Light, you found some peace with it. I can tell." Yang says comfortingly, she leans closer into me. And I welcome it.

"So once that was done, I turned to Carlson. And swore that I'd follow him no matter what, the guy helped me when I needed it and I'd help him the only way I knew how. Follow him to hell and back." I mutter, it's actually really nice being able to tell someone outside of my dorm what happened to me. Feels.....liberating.

Yang turns my head to face hers, her fingers under my chin. She has a warm smile on her lips and whispers "You know, hearing all that. Just makes me like you more big guy, could you do me a favour?"

I say nothing, but simply nod. And she mutters "Hold still......." she leans in and kisses me. Once on the cheek, then on my lips. I've done this before, Lunar was curious about it. But it's different with Yang, Lunar was curious. But Yang, she knows what she wants. She's aggressive, and I love it. We're making out now, her hands run around my chest. My hands go to her hair, Yang flinches briefly. But she lets me do it, perhaps as a display of our trust. And for now I forget my troubles and issues, all that matters is Yang.......

I was currently meditating in a forest clearing not too far from Beacon, to get better accustomed to this new world and its natural energy. I am told the Grimm live on negative emotions, I am glad then I sorted my personal baggage before I came to this place then. Don't want to make myself a massive target after all, I lost track of how much time I spent here, but I feel more in tune with my surroundings now. Speaking of which......

"I sense you." I mutter, its that girl from the hot springs. I can smell the grimm taint on her. She stands at least 7 feet away from me, I stand quickly but don't turn around yet.

"Only because I wished it to be so blind one." Mirage states with contempt in her voice. I clench my fists, I'd love to batter her but I don't know how powerful she is. Better play carefully now until I can get into position to run......

"What do you want from me? I'm just a blind young man." I say, taking a step to the left.

Mirage chuckles and says "No, I sense your power. The life energy, its anathema to my fellow grimm. You need to be dealt with, I just so happened to come across someone from your world who just so happened to draw me to her."

I lift my head, suddenly a rattle of the nearby bushes comes a blur of red chi energy. I quickly roll to the side to avoid it. Something grazes my chin however leaving a cut, I stood up and rubbed it with my hand. I get a feel of what this person looks like......

https://www.pinterest.co.uk/pin/25192079... (First one on the left)

I gasp quietly, this girl is blind like I am. Mirage laughs and states "Now I can crush you without even thinking, however I felt it more ironic your removed by a blind person. This one was trained from birth by rogue witches to kill. That's right, a gift from your world. Now begone....." Mirage vanishes from the place leaving me with this woman.

"Away with you assassin!" I shout, drawing my hook swords from my back and leaping at her intent on driving my hooks into her shoulders. She however moves out her palm and blasts me back with her magic, I can tell its that. She radiates it, and her chi is red. Intent on ending me, many have tried. None succeeded.

I land on my feet though I skidded back a fair distance away, her power is indeed very considerable. But there's something......primal about it, like wild and untamed. She's not formally trained like the Harrisons, but still powerful. No doubt amplified by her rage. I take a step forward only to feel a sharp pang in my cheeks. Next thing I know I stagger to one knee.

My head feels numb, suddenly I realise. She's poisoned me! Those claws and the attack on my head, I detect her rushing at me in an effort to try and cut my head off. I quickly gather my energy and roll to the side. I must defeat this before its too late.

Luckily this is not the first time opponents have tried to use poison on me, I quickly cover the wound with my hand. Using chi energy I focus on the point where the infection occurred, a blue glow emerges from it. I have already performed the act. I will need to avoid further injury until the poison is fully gone. I will not play around, my first strike must be a winning blow.

I step back and jump into the air, I must assume she can detect me in a similar manner. I land on a tree and make sure the crunch of my feet on the wood is detectable. She tilts her head up and yells, running at me again and leaping into the air. Perfect. Now she can't dodge my next move. I jump at her, intent on delivering a major blow. She's not much of a tactical thinker.

My hook sword drives deep into her left shoulder, spraying blood from the wound as my weapon connects. I then grunt as I feel a pang in my gut, she drove her claw into my midriff. We fall to the ground in a messy heap. We pant quietly, my wound is an ideal place to spread the poison. But at the same time I delivered a strike near her heart. I use my chi energy to help resist the poison. She puts her hand on my side, I'm too weak to try and shove her aside.

"You.....defeated me." she mutters. A voice that sounds oddly delicate in light of her murderous nature.

I don't say a word, she continues. "What will happen to me? I....lived a life of pain, its always been with me."

This.....she sounds like me.......

After I cleanse my poison I bite my lower lip. She says "Please.....spare me.......in return I will serve only you......you......my life.....for yours......."

She was like me, as I once was. I hear Carlson's voice shouting but I can't discern his words, I use my strength to put my hand over her wound. To try and heal with what energy I have left.

It glows blue. Her mouth opens slightly and I pass out shortly after........I just hope its the right decision.......

The day sped by, I read some books in Braille to pass the time. I actually translate some books from time to time as a hobby. I'm so used to it now, it helps to pass the time while I contemplate what happened to that girl before she met me. The next day I wake up fully healed, Lunar's knowledge of human anatomy combined with my chi energy manipulation leads to a quick recovery.

I'm standing up and walking down the hallways, when suddenly a loud scream comes my way. I rush towards it, I sense the girl. She's grappling with two nurses, kicking and throwing stuff in her room. I quickly bolt in and shout "Hey stop! These people are here to help you damnit!"

After I introduce myself I feel her blind gaze on me, she's silent and her head turns to one side. "Very well." she states in a monotone voice. The girl slouches and lets the nurses place her onto the bed, she's dressed in a plain white gown. I can detect numerous marks on her skin, signs of her previous battles perhaps?

I move into the room and say to the nurses "Can you please leave us for a few minutes? I need to speak to her."

One of them says "Fine Chon, but one of us will be waiting outside just in case." the peanut gallery departs and I hear the door shut.

"My life for yours." she says.

"Are you ok?" I ask as I walk towards her, slowly in case she made any sudden moves.

"I am prepared, if you ask I shall lay down my life for you." her response was so....certain. No hesitation either, like she believed it.

I'm silent for a few seconds, pondering this. I then say "I didn't ask that. I asked if your well."

I can sense her mouth opening slightly, she quietly states "I.....my wounds from our battle have healed if that is the answer you wish. No one has asked me about that in a very long time......"

"What's your name?" I ask.

".............."

No response from her. "You don't have one?" I ask.

She nods. "As far as I can remember I have only ever been given terms like child or weapon." she states.

"You will aid me then?" I ask.

Another nod. "Again, my life for yours. I will abide by your judgement." she mutters as she sits in an Indian position.

It doesn't take me long.

I lean back on a wall and fold my arms. "I know, you will be called Mang Zhao. Blind Claw."

The girl changes to a kneeling position on the bed and bows herself down. "I will accept the name Master, I am ready to serve."

Frowning I say "Don't call me Master, my name is Chon. Look I don't know what happened to you, but if your willing to follow me I'll do my best to help you. I will come by tomorrow to pick you up. Do not attempt to escape, prove your loyalty to me."

If she abides by this I will trust her then. Mang bows to me and says "I will do so. Will you require anything else of me? Am I allowed to defend myself if it is required?"

I need to be specific? Oh boy. I sigh and say "Only if your opponent is being stupid and waving a weapon in front of your face and being clearly intent on it. Now be well and I will pick you up tomorrow. Farewell."

With that I exit the room, and I walk to the wall opposite and slide down it somewhat. I then say to the nurse outside "Keep an eye on her." before moving to exit the infirmary. Now I got a assassin to look after? Well she might know about Mirage, and it seems like she's on my side now.

I can only see blackness without my magic, its one of my few constants. I gaze up at the ceiling, I cannot gain any sleep. My mind is always like a violent tornado, I've been in hospitals before. I escape each time, but I......don't want to this time. For some reason, I want to stay. I want to. Its because I have sworn to follow him. That man. Chon, he gifted me with a name. Mang. I like it already. I've been nothing but a weapon, a tool to be used and discarded. Is this what they call appreciation? I've.....never had that, I've seen it. But never.....

A rustle of steps from the hall is detected by me, but its coming towards me. Stopping just outside my door, my magic flows through my body. It's wild and chaotic, but I can garner things from it to make up for my lack of sight. If its a nurse they will only poke their head in, I'm partially restrained. My master is testing me, I will not fail him. I will only attack if I am directly attacked. I don't have my claws, but my magic is powerful. I can turn a whole room ablaze with just a wave of my hand.

The door opens fully, its an attack. Surely. But I remain motionless, using my magic to lower my breathing to appear as if I am totally out. Its hard to keep me sedated, I've built up a resistance to general toxins among them. I feel a figure glide across the floor towards me.

Its her. The woman who ordered me to attack my new master. She now stands over me, I tense up my hands. Ready to unleash my pure and unbridled rage at the slightest provocation...…

"You have failed me, now you latch to the one who you tried to end?" Mirage said tauntingly to me.

I grit my teeth and say "He has spared me and I have sworn to protect him for it. Harm him and I will destroy you no matter what."

Mirage simply snickered and lifts a hand, instantly I move to attack. A ball of fire engulfing my left hand as I seek to uppercut her and smear the walls with her. She teleported somehow out of the way, standing back at the door.

"I suppose I will let you live, after all your just a weapon......" Mirage mutters to me.

Something inside me snaps, I fling a ball of magic energy at her. Just like the wind she was gone, and I broke the window.

A nurse runs in, its one of those what do you call them....Faunus? I say "You need to improve your security. I was nearly attacked."

I hope he isn't angered.....

Ironwood nodded. "It will place everyone at risk for that short period of time but its better than losing all control." He turned to me. "What's next?"

Ironwood raised a single eyebrow to which Sho said, "We stop all of their attempts to interfere with the Vital festival until they become frustrated enough to make a mistake."

Matt nodded. "Exactly."

"And if they manage to destroy Beacon tower..." Frowning, Ironwood demanded.

"I have already constructed a satellite, which will serve as a replacement for Beacon tower should it fall." Smiling, Matt replied. "All I require is the transmit frequency."

Ironwood told Matt the frequency then asked. "When will it launch?"

His question was answered as a rumble shook the dorm room before Matt began to fall into hysterical laughter. "Victory to science!"

A small grin touched the corners of Ironwood's mouth. "You are insane." Softly, he said. "But... you prove your worth."

"That rumble no doubt panicked a lot of people." Frowning, Winter scolded.

Matt shook his head. "I masked the launch with a number of fireworks." Grinning, he said. "If anything, it gave them a thrill."

"What's the next step?" Serious, Ironwood demanded.

I steeled my eyes. "We wait..."
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Ironwood and Winter waiting for us.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

The following morning, we were approached by Professor Port. He was a tall and muscular older gentleman with a thick eyebrows and mustache. He was dressed like a hunter of old from our world with what looked like a blunderbuss rifle with axe blades on the top and bottom near the hilt.

"Mr. Carlson, I understand that you and your party do not have team names but I ask that you form a party of four to come with me on a field trip to Mountain Glen."

"May I ask why?" Raising an eye brow, I asked.

"You can but I doubt my answer will be to your liking as it is clear you are on a mission of your own making." Serious, Port replied. "Regardless of where you are from, you are registered students and will go where the professors instruct."

I sighed. There was no arguing that. "Very well but I must insist we know what we are jumping into. Each member of my team..."

"Could find themselves in any given situation at anytime." Serious, Mr Port interrupted. "If you have as much faith in your team as you let on, they can handle your mission without four of you for a short time."

"I'll go with." Serious, John said. "That makes two."

"Count me in." serious, Chon said. "That's three."

Port nodded. "Very good and the fourth member shall be Miss Don."

Amy turned to professor Port surprised. "Me...?" Port nodded. She sighed. "Very well."

"We leave immediately." Calmly, Port said. "You have ten minutes to gather your weapons and a minimal amount of gear. We will be gone for three days."

"What's in Mountain Glen?" Curious, Charlie asked.

"It was an extension of Beacon long ago." After a pause, Port explained. "However, it was abandoned after it became overrun with Grim."

"What brought the Grim?" Wincing, Viva asked.

Port shrugged. "The city became too big and emotions flared." Simply, he replied. "It is negative emotions that attract the Grim."

We all nodded to that and prepared ourselves. After assembling our packs, I sheathed Asura while Chon did the same with his curved swords. Amy packed extra notebooks and sheathed her Rapier sword. John only packed a few light snacks and grabbed his stone sword. Port raised a single eyebrow but said nothing. He merely motioned the four of us to follow him out of the dorms to an awaiting airship. As my group boarded, he stopped me as I began to pass.

"We are receiving strange reports of unauthorized activity in Mountain Glen." Quietly, he said. "Our mission is to investigate this... discretely. Brief your team on the way."

I nodded then boarded the airship and we were on our way to begin our mission...
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Field trip to Mountain Glen.

I'm acting on instinct and wrap my arms around her waist and stand up with her, Yang takes this vertical cue and wraps her legs around my waist.

"Light....." she mutters into my ear, it's a hungry and husky tone. Yang nibbles on my ear and I purr in delight as I carry her along the pier, I move to press her up against the wall that leads up to where the gate is. Yang leans back and wriggles up in my hold before grabbing the back of my head, promptly burying my head into her ample cleavage. I close my eyes and indulge in the warm and soft flesh as she cradles me there, her breasts form around my head. I can't remember the last time I felt so well cared for, Yang rests her head on top of mine and runs her hands through my hair kissing the top of my head after it.

I look up at her from her valley of flesh, she looks right happy. Yang leans in to kiss me again, I eagerly return it. After a few moments of this Yang says "Light we should probably get home. Your gonna need some rest for tomorrow....." purring in my ear after it.

"Long night?" he mutters

Chon quietly chuckles and says "You deserve some happiness John."

I walk past the blind man and say "You should get some too man. Don't give me that asexual crap too."

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Light opens to another...

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Later that day, Yang called her uncle, Qrow. She was excited that she had found someone she believes would make the perfect boyfriend. She described Light to him and how well they got along with each other. "I really like him, uncle!" Enthusiastic, Yang said. "I think I finally found the one! You know; the one to finally settle down with!"

"I heard about him and his crew." Calmly, Qrow said. "They came from another world, a completely different reality from what we know."

"So?" Unfazed, Yang asked. "What difference does it make where he and his friends come from?"

"What are you going to do when it comes time for him to go back, Yang?" Serious, Qrow asked. "They aren't here to start a new life; they have lives of their own where they came from."

Yang frowned. "From what he told me, his life where he came from wasn't the greatest." Stubborn, she said. "He could have a better life here, with me."

"That was his past, Yang." Darkly, Qrow countered. "That and your not answering my question. What are you going to do? Will you beg him to stay while his friends return to their own world? Will you go with him? Or will you let him go?"

"I..." Yang fell silent.

"You need to give this some real serious thought, Yang." Serious, Qrow said. "John Doe, or Light; whichever you want to call him, will not stay forever unless you make a decision and talk to him about it."

With that, Qrow ended the call, leaving Yang with much to think about.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Wisdom of a Qrow.

choices: Four fools looking for a fight.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Matt's POV

I was nearing my dorm, which I shared with the group from Starmage when I encountered a small group of boys blocking my path. They all had cocky looks on their faces. Nonintellectual fools, do they even know who they are grinning at?! I am the prince of an entire world! They can not hold a candle to my authority!

"Well, well, who do we have here?" Smiling, the tallest boy inquired. "A rather strange looking Faunus."

The other three boys chuckled but paused as they took notice of my robot guards who fingered their rifles in response to the sarcasm in their voices. "Halt!" Firmly, I commanded. The robots stopped their advance and I crossed my arms.

"I am prince Matt Moray of Nero Earth!" Sternly, I stated. "Stand aside or be moved aside!"

The robots raised their weapons in response to my command to which the four boys laughed. The tallest, whom seemed to be the leader raised a large mace for me to see. "Do you seriously think we are afraid of your little robots?" Defiantly, he demanded. "Also, your prince title holds little weight in this world."

My eyes narrowed. "Does it now?"

I summoned my energy clones in the form of small wolves which surrounded the four arrogant fools. As I had expected, they all drew their weapons with a hint of concern in their eyes. The wolves growled and howled around them bearing their razor sharp teeth and claws. Of course, I had no intention to order an attack unless they attacked first. After all, I did give my word not to attack unless attacked upon only I did not promise to bear my teeth when annoyed.

Then a female voice spoke out in surprising authority. "Team Cardinal, do not move!"

I turned to find a formally dressed woman approaching us with a riding whip in hand. "Matt Moray, call off your pack this instant!"

I smiled kindly. "We were merely showing off our weapons and semblances with each other, madam Goodwitch." Innocently, I protested. "There is no conflict here to be concerned about."

The members of team Cardinal quickly backed me up to avoid any trouble only Glenda Goodwitch was far from impressed. "Now, Moray!"

I sighed and waved my hand, causing the energy clones to vanish. The members of team Cardinal put their weapons away in return. Glenda Goodwitch then smiled slightly. "Save your energy for the initiation, young prince." Calmly, she said. "Believe me, you will need it." She then eyed the four boys. "I suggest, for your own pride and dignity, you do not try the patience of our latest visitors from Starmage Academy."

The four boys made way for my robots and I to pass through only the team leader whispered, "This isn't over, you little brat."

I only smiled and stuck my tongue out at him. Although I was aware it was childish, I also knew it would greatly infuriate the brainless brute. It was only a matter of time before he gave me the perfect excuse to take him down a notch. I smiled at Glenda Goodwitch before entering my dorm and closed the door.

Unknown to me, Glenda Goodwitch shook her head as she passed Ryan and company in the hall. "That little boy may be powerful but he lacks experience and maturity!" Quietly, she muttered. "He is going to get himself or someone else hurt... he needs to grow up fast!"

Ryan turned to her, hearing her comment and frowned before seeing team Cardinal blocking the hall, grinning at him and his group.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Matt encounters some trouble.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Upon reaching our dorms, we encountered a group of four boys in medieval style armor standing in the hall. At first, they seemed intent upon blocking our path. I caught a brief vision of Light moping the floor with them with his stone sword and threw him a concerned look.

"What is it, boss?" Catching my eye, Light asked.

I motioned to the four boys. "Are they really worth our time?" Loud enough to hear, I inquired.

Light looked at the four boys, who were flashing cocky smiles and chuckled. "They remind me of that gaudy group from Starmage." Smiling, he replied. "At least these blokes are more flashy looking." He then eyed the four boys, flashing his sharp teeth in a smile. "I'll handle this one."

Light walked up to the tallest man who took a short step back before holding his ground. "What are you looking at?" Shaken, the boy demanded.

"I'm looking at you, genius." Smiling, Light said. "If you want a fight, then ask to face us in the training arena; I'd be happy to mop the floor with you." His smile then turned to a scowl that caused the boy to take a second step back. "Otherwise, get lost!"

The four boys, albeit reluctantly due to their pride being hit, they walked away without a word. Light then smiled again when he reached me. "I know their kind, boss." Softly, he said. "They're trying to get a feel for the competition before the matches begin."

I nodded, having met groups like that during the fight games at Starmage. They pick a little fight to get an idea of their opponent's strengths and weaknesses so to form a plan of attack before the matches begin. It was not exactly an illegal tactic but it was dirty non the less. "They won't get any Intel from us but they may have gotten some from the impatient prince."

"Of that I have no doubt." Firmly, Sho commented. "See the scratch marks on the walls? He had shown the boys his little army of wolves."

"He gave his word not to attack." Irritated, Chon said.

"He did not attack." Again motioning to the walls, Sho said. "He may have promised not to attack but he did not promise not to bear his fangs and growl." He sighed. "Still, that boy has much to learn."

We all entered our dorm to find it was much like a house with several bedrooms, each with our names on them. My name and Jenny's name were on the same door. We entered to find two separate beds which we immediately pushed together. Jenny used a bit of magic and made it one big bed for us to share.

I then came out and found Matt's bed room; the name was still on the door. I pushed it open to find a rather large laboratory inside. Of course, I was not surprised. Mad scientists could place their laboratory anywhere, even in the smallest of places.

"Do you always bring your work with you, Moray?" Flatly, I asked.

"This is a portable laboratory." Kindly, Matt said. "It is merely for study of the various plant life in this world to see if they can grow their own spice." He sighed. "It is one of the reasons Ozpin took me under his wing."

I nodded. "I see."

That night, we all slept well. Jenny and I had our first restful sleep in a long time. The following morning, I woke up refreshed and energized. We all then prepared for the initiations.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: continue.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Lunar prepared us all a hearty dish of scrambled eggs, hash, grits, sausage links, and English tea. It was an interesting choice to which I had to ask her why she selected such a dish for us. Lunar smiled and replied, "Juan Smith suggested it. He will be at the initiations today as well."

I smiled knowing Juan Smith from the States in my own world. He was at the front line of an effort to stop rogue witches and psychotic scientists from rekindling the ancient war between the two powers. I shuddered to think what the world would have been like if the war was not kept secret from the general public.

"Who else will be at this initiation?" Curious, Chon asked.

Lunar though a moment. "I believe Juan mentioned a reformed Dex Bedlam and a girl named Huanle."

"My little sister will be at the initiation?!" Surprised, Chon asked. "Why was I not told of this earlier?"

"She was a last minute entry." Entering the room, Matt said. "The same is true for Dex Bedlam and his cousin, a kid named Ron Schizo."

"How exactly do you know this, Moray?" Frowning, I asked.

I suspected he had somehow hacked into the school's computers, being a mad scientist. Only, to my surprise, he replied, "They were present in the meeting when I discussed going to Beacon with Ozpin. We all needed permission from our guardians first."

I was about to speak when the door to the dorm opened and Light entered with a huge grin on his face. I wondered where he had vanished to the night before. I grinned seeing the telltale lipstick stains on his mouth and face as Yang peeked in behind him. "Morning, everyone!" Happily, she said. "I sort of borrowed your friend for the night."

Viva and Vogue giggled seeing Light practically float into the room with an uncharacteristic smile on his face as he walked into the washroom. "I hope you didn't tire him out too much." Smiling, I said. "We have initiations today."

Yang giggled. "He'll be fine! If anything, I energized him!" She then spotted the food on the table. "Yes! Breakfast! Mind if I join you?"

Nearly an hour later, we all met on the edge of a high cliff on a large metal platform. Professor Ozpin and Glenda Goodwitch were present. It was a warm clear morning even as the sun was just beginning to rise.

"Students, your goal in this initiation is very simple." Calmly, Ozpin explained. "On the north end of this forest, you will find temple ruins where I have placed a number of artifacts. You will retrieve one such artifact and return to the cliff where you started."

"You will face the Grim along the way." Darkly, Glenda added. "Do not hesitate to destroy those who stand in your path or you will be killed."

"You will be all falling and will have to rely on your own landing strategies." Firmly, Ozpin said. "Here we judge which team you will be in."

With that, the platform suddenly sprang up, throwing the entire group into the air towards the forbidding forest. Jane let out a surprised screech while Matt laughed. He rolled himself into a ball, forming a shield around him yelling, "Cannonball!"

Asura sensed my predicament and unsheathed itself before flying under my feet and slowed my decent as if I were riding on a flying skateboard! I guess there are advantages to having the soul of a warrior in your sword. "What caused you to fall from such a dangerous height?!" Concerned, Asura inquired.

"It's part of an initiation at a school in another realm." Calmly, I explained.

I quickly gave Asura the details to which he stated, "I will serve faithfully in this and all worlds you travel!"

Upon reaching the ground, I sheathed Asura and looked up to see Matt slam into a tree, causing it to fall from where it was hit before he slammed into the ground. He got up, laughing weakly as he stumbled about, obviously a bit stunned. "That was fun!" Smiling, he said. "Let's do that again!"

"I suggest we march forward to our objective, Moray." Appearing through a clump of trees, Sho said. "The artifacts may hold a great significance in higher standing to those who obtain them first."

I raised a single eyebrow to that statement then smiled as I realized that Sho was playing on Matt's pride. "You may have a valid point." Musing, Matt said. "The Grim are attracted by negative emotions therefore I suggest an agreement to cease and desist all negative thoughts between us."

"Which is what, exactly?" Cautiously, Sho demanded.

Matt smiled. "Just call me Matt and I'll listen to you." Calmly, he said. "Calling me by my surname agitates me to no end."

Sho nodded. "Matt it is, then."

Matt nodded back. "Lead the way; I will assist where I know I can be of best service."

"Well, that was easy enough." Shrugging, I muttered.

Then Jenny landed next to me from the trees. "I wonder how long that will last." Smiling, she said. "The new generation working with the old."

"I would not say 'old' in front of Sho." Smiling back, I said. "We better get moving."

Jenny nodded and we made our way through the forest.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: The initiations start.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Juan's POV

Immediately upon taking to the air with the large primitive catapult platform, my trusted lab coat responded to the situation. It became rigid along the outer edges becoming a personal glider. I steered the glider through the trees by shifting my body to the left or right until I reached the ground a few short meters away from the cliff. Upon landing, my lab coat became loose fitting again and I awakened Glitch from her slumber with a sharp whistle. The silver robotic lizard crawled out from a deep inner pocket of my coat and perched herself onto my shoulders before giving off a series of beeps and bops. It was a language I created for her so, naturally, I understood it completely.

Glitch was my weapon of choice. She was as long as my arm and had the ability to transform into virtually any weapon within her size then return to me if thrown or hit away from me. My lab coat was my defense of choice of which often times automatically responded to most threats. If it did not detect a threat, I would have to manually activate its systems; nothing is perfect. It was actually standard equipment for any mad scientist in my world. Glitch however was entirely of my design; she was more than a pet project, she was a friend I could depend upon in any situation.

"Oh, stop complaining, Glitch." Calmly, I said. "I let you sleep in. It's time to get to work."

The sounds of a fight close by sent me into motion and I rushed passed a group of high bushes to find Huanle facing a number of Beowolves with with a Jian, a type of Japanese broadsword. Huanle made various acrobatic moves, swinging the sword with deadly accuracy before firing a shot from a type of musket that doubled as the sheath for her sword. I jumped in, giving a mental command to Glitch who transformed into a sickle sword that had a wide flat end like a hammer.

"Let's make this a more fair fight!" Charging in, I yelled.

Huanle merely nodded and the two of us attacked the pack of Beowolves. I made short work of those who came near me with the sword and my lab coat fended off those who managed to sneak up on me with coat tails that moved like vicious whips on their own with a razor sharp side that sliced through the monsters easily. Huanle did not need rescuing by any stretch of the imagination but it made dispatching of the monsters that much easier.

"We must hurry to the north end of the forest." Calmly, Huanle said. "Our objective is not to fight these creatures but to get passed them to the artifacts and return to the cliff."

I nodded and motioned to the path ahead of us. "Then let us not waste any time."

Huanle and I ran down the path to the north where we encountered another member of the party of exchange students being initiated. We met up with...
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Focus on Juan and Huanle.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Juan's POV

In the next clearing, we encountered the infamous Dex Bedlam. The man had been more than a handful for Starmage security in the past before his good/evil dual personality issue was shall we say corrected at Eligere Sententia. From the last reports I had read, he was now a force to defend the peace between witches and mad scientists. We walked up to him as he fired a blast of electricity from his two katakana swords into an Ursa or Grim bear. He then threw a blade with a ring and wire attached into it and pulled the wire causing the blade to explode, killing the Ursa.

"The temple is about four hundred yards ahead." seeing us, Dex said. "However, there is a problem."

"Let me guess, a death stalker." Taking a step back, I said.

Huanle also took a step back, drawing her Jian as Dex tilted his head to one side, curious. "Yes; I saw it napping just ahead in a sandy clearing." Softly, he said. "How did you know?"

"It's awake!" Jumping back, Huanle warned.

Dex jumped back with the aid of rocket powered boots as the giant Grim scorpion crashed through the trees, snapping its claws at the three of us! It let out a roar before sending its acid poison stinger at Huanle who raised her Jian in defense! She managed to block the attack while Glitch transformed into a laser rifle which I fired at the beast. Unfortunately, the blasts seemed to only bounce off doing nothing more than aggravating the monster. Then a blue ray fired in from behind and the death stalker was frozen in place by its feet as Lunar landed next to us.

"That will not hold the creature long!" Firmly, she said. "I suggest we get what we were sent here for and get out fast!"

"I second that notion!" Pointing to the woods, Dex said. "Only I suggest we avoid the sandy clearing; it may be a trap for would be prey."

I nodded as I too had studied the creatures of Grim before entering this situation. The death stalkers left sandy traps to capture prey so they could eat at their leisure rather than spend the energy hunting. The four of us ran from the struggling death stalker into the woods, following the edge of the sandy clearing to the temple ruins...
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Dex Bedlam.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Huanle's POV

"Fucking move!" Dex yells out at the top of his lungs, his blood red hair swaying wildly alongside that black jacket that's tied around his waist. Those long legs are enabling him to rush ahead, though Lunar's flying just behind him. Perhaps to stay with us all, it's at times like this I'm grateful for Chon putting me into those running practise lessons.

"Again I stress that the grimm monster we left back there will be free around 4 minutes, once we rush to the ruins we should procure the relics. Hopefully some of our allies will be present there and can assist." Lunar says, I have to admit she's speaking very calmly in spite of the situation. Perhaps it's because she's an android? There's no room for speaking about that right now though, I hear a loud crashing noise behind us. My hair on the back of my neck stands on end, but I don't dare turn around. It's that monster getting free, I grip my Jian and move with everyone else.

"I guess we're a team now then?!" I shout over the din of the noise behind us.

Juan quickly turns his head to be while saying "There are four of us present Huanle, I believe it to be the case. Quickly now!"

We're getting nearer to the ruins, Lunar estimated we have a 4 minute head start. But still that's not much of a reassurance, we come to the steps of a tower as our robot girl promptly states "Our objective lies above theses stairs!"

No sooner has the robot said that does the death stalker behind us let out a large, feral like roar. I quickly turn around in spite of my instincts, fuck it's loose! And it's charging right towards us. I then look to the people with me, Dex suddenly moves towards me and says "We gotta get up this tower! Taking the stairs is going to be too fucking slow!" with that he takes a dagger from his coat after sheathing one of his katanas and I notice it's linked to a wire that comes from a coat pocket.

The redhead sticks the dagger in Lunar's hand, Juan nods and we're all suddenly in agreement. Juan converts his weapon into a sort of whip and wraps it around Lunar's left leg, meanwhile the robot accepts Dex's dagger and he wraps the wire around one hand and promptly grabs hold of me.

"Don't you let go, or you'll die." he states, and I know what's about to happen. And I cling to Dex as Lunar readies herself and promptly flies upwards, we're going to bypass using the stairs and take to the sky. That way we can get to the objective sooner, but still I'm really terrified. And I let out a scream to let everyone know that.

Dex promptly wraps his long legs around me, to ensure that I don't fall. And he merely gives me an irritated look, I stop my scream and feel a blush creep around my cheeks. You know in this light he kinda looks handsome, even with the blood red hair and that x scar on his face. Sure enough I see the top of the ruins, and there's people already there.

"Carlson!" Juan shouts. I see Ryan there, with Jenny and Chon and Light. They've grabbed what look like white castle pieces, and there's also Sho with Matt. And Jane and Amy, Jane as usual looks terrified at what we've brought with us. But everyone's here, thank Kami.

"We've got company, Juan. You and your team grab those last pieces, we'll fight this grimm! Charge!" Carlson shouts as he draws his katana and everyone promptly prepares for combat. Dex lets go of me as we hit the ground, I grunt as I roll for a little before standing up and moving to the last set of pieces.

"Black knights." Lunar simply remarks. Dex scoffs before taking his, sticking it in his coat pocket. He's not going to the fight though, instead he's actually making to exit the ruins as Juan and Lunar join the fight.

"Hey!" I shout, moving to grab his shoulder. Dex swiftly turns around and looks at me.

"What? We got what we came here for. Isn't that all that matters?" he says.

"But our friends are in danger, we need to get out all together. As a team Dex." I say, I make sure my expression shows I'm not cowing here.

Dex simply rolls his eyes and replies with "They're your friends, not mine. Fuck it I'll help." with that he moves past me and throws a dagger at the grimm monsters showing up. He's a bit of a loose cannon, but Chon was able to turn a rouge witch's daughters into prim and polite young ladies. So maybe I can help Dex with his issues too.
