Focus on Charlie and the V twins.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

The battle with the death stalker attracted a pack of Beowolves to the party. Fortunately, Sho, Matt, Amy, and Jane saw them coming and focused their efforts onto them. Amy took an idea from Matt's landing strategy and fired spherical force fields at the creatures like cannonballs, tearing them apart while shielding herself and her three team mates. Sho ran passed the shield, slicing and dicing the monsters with little effort while dozens more came running to fight. Jane used her staff to fire energy arrows at the Beowolves but there seemed no end to them! Sho jumped back then turned to the others.

"Amy, place a force field around the Beowolves! Don't let them gain any more ground!" Barking orders, he yelled. "Jane, you are with me! The Beowolf with the silver fur on its back, that is the Alpha! We kill it, the others will fall!" He then turned to Matt. "Matt... feeding time!"

Amy did as she was asked but made a stressed face as the monsters began banging against the field. "This won't last long!" Urgently, she yelled.

Matt summoned his wolf pack and charged the Beowolves inside the wide circle of a force field and attacked them in force, devouring them quickly! Finally, Sho and Jane charged the Alpha Beowolf! With their combined efforts, the leader of the pack was destroyed and the remainder of the monsters fled back into the woods! Matt walked back to the group with a pained look on his face as Amy canceled the force field, exhausted. "I'm going to hurl..." Sourly, Matt said.

"Find a tree." Backing up, Amy stated.

Meanwhile, I was busy with the death stalker. After several failed attempts to kill the beast, Light leaped high into the air with an enraged battle cry and struck the monster on the head with his stone sword! There was a loud boom as the bony armor of the beast cracked in half! The death stalker roared in agony as Jenny used her magic to open the crack further! Chon and I then charged forth and struck our bladed into the crack, sending them clear into the monster's brain! One final roar later, the beast was dead! There was no need for any talk among us as we had worked as a team for a long time at Starmage. Still, it was an exhausting battle.

From above, a Nevermore or Grim Raven screamed from above and fired its quills at Huanle! In a surprising move, Dex jumped in the way and sliced the quills before they came close then fired a blast of electricity, sending the beast flying away but circling back for another attack!

"We have the trees as an advantage!" Quickly, Lunar said. "We need to ambush the beast as it circles back; we only have one shot at this!" She turned to Juan. "Can your friend, Glitch fly?"

Juan nodded. "Of course!" Hurriedly, he replied. "What's your idea?"

Lunar turned to Dex. "We need two of your explosive daggers and your crack-shot aim!" She then turned to Huanle. "Loan us your musket and be ready with your Jian! You will know what to do!"

As the giant grim raven circled back around for another attack, Glitch flew in front of it, firing weak laser blasts into its eyes! The beast gave chase, following Glitch into position for the trap. Dex fired two of his explosive daggers from Huanle's musket style laser rifle one right after the other, striking the Nevermore in the neck! Lunar then grabbed the long strings attacked to them and yanked hard! Not only did the daggers explode but the force of the yank sent the nevermore into a crashing course with the sand clearing! Huanle, seeing her opportunity, rushed to the beast with magical speed and sent her Jian crashing down, severing the head of the monster!

With the battles won and the forest quiet again, we all made our way back to the cliff unchallenged!
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: The power of teams.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Hours later, after we all had time to rest and shower, we stood on the stage in the academy's auditorium where Ozpin called the groups to the center stage.

"Ryan Carlson, Chon Kay, Jenny Forth, and John Doe." Summoning us forward, Ozpin announced. "You four retrieved the white rook pieces. From this day forward, you will be known as Team Wreckage."

The four of us exchanged smiles as the audience applauded us. The name certainly fit as we wrecked any enemy who ever threatened Starmage. Ozpin then finished stating, "Lead by Ryan Carlson."

Jenny smiled at me while Chon gave a respectable bow and Light grinned, giving me a thumbs up sign as if he knew all along I would be the leader. Upon leaving the stage, I watched as Sho and his group walked onto the stage.

"Shomei Akatsuki, Matt Moray, Amy Don, and Jane Doe." Summoning them, Ozpin announced. "You four retrieved the white Bishop pieces. From this day forward, you will be known as Team Smash. Lead by Shomei Akatsuki."

My group and I applauded with the audience. Matt nodded at Sho who responded with a short bow before the group left the stage. When they approached us, Jenny placed a hand onto Matt's shoulder. "Are you okay with not being the leader?" Gently, she asked.

Matt smiled, eyeing Sho. "A prince is not a leader but a leader in training." Calmly, he said. "Shomei Akatsuki was kind enough to offer to take me under his wing and guide me on that journey."

"Matt shows a lot of promise at a young age." Firmly but kindly, Sho said. "However, he lacks focus and discipline. I believe that, with some training, he can grow into a fine leader of men."

I smiled at that, knowing that Sho will do all he can to help Matt with his issues. We then turned back to the stage as the last group was called forward.

"Lunar Messiah, Juan Smith, Huanle Kay, Dex Bedlam." Summoning them forward, Ozpin said. "You four retrieved the black knight pieces. From this day forward, you will be known as Team Legend." We all applauded with the audience as Ozpin then said, "Lead by Lunar Messiah."

"Well, that's it." Smiling, I said. "We got our team names."

Suddenly, I heard Ozpin call out, "Charlie Ren, Viva Kay, Vogue Kay, and Ron Schizo."

I whipped around to see the four kids on the stage! Chon had turned around as well and was looking towards the four children as Ozpin spoke. "The four of you thwarted a Grim attack on Vale, saving dozens of lives. This has earned you a team status." We all exchanged shocked and concerned looks as Ozpin continued. "From this day forward, you will be known as Team Severe. Lead by Charlie Ren."

The V twins hugged both Charlie and Ron, cheering as the audience applauded. I applauded as well but made note to speak to Ozpin about this incident as none of us were informed of this happening. I was certain Chon Kay would have a word with Ozpin as well due to his girls falling into danger. For the moment, we allowed the four kids to enjoy their moment.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: The award ceremnies.

choices: Flashback the kids in Ozpin's office.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Once the ceremony was over, we returned to our dorms with Ron Schizo joining the group as a member of 'Team Severe'. The kids all sat down in the common area; they knew we all wanted an explanation.

"What had happened was not of our doing, Mr Carlson." Defending the group, Ron stated. "We were simply the right people in the wrong place at the right time."

"I will talk to the leader of Team Severe." Bluntly, I said.

"Then you talk to us all." Standing up in defiance, Ron said. "I do not answer to you."

The kid had a point but I needed to get answers and arguing with him would only waste valuable time plus I did not want Viva and Vogue to get any ideas from him. "Sit... down." Firmly, I demanded.

Albeit reluctantly, Ron sat down but there was a scowl on his face. I hated to be cold with him but there was no time for kid gloves. I turned to Charlie. "Explain what happened."

"As Ron said, we were just the right people in the wrong place at the right time." Calmly, Charlie said. "We had all gotten passes to go to the fair in Vale and explore the many shops with some of the credits we were given for expenses..."

**************************************************************************** **********************************************

Viva and Vogue led Charlie by the hands into the fair with Ron Schizo tagging along as they had all become fast friends due to their closeness in age and similar interests.

"What is with the utility belt?" Giggling, Viva asked Ron. "You look like a comic book hero!"

Ron chuckled. "My father is an inventor for the special armed forces in our world." Smiling, he replied. "He likes me to be prepared for anything at any time as there are people who will use me to get to him."

"That sounds a lot like BB." Smiling as well, Vogue said. "He taught us how to stand on our own feet and fight for ourselves and those we love."

"BB?" Confused, Ron asked.

"They're referring to Chon Kay, their adopted father." Kindly, Charlie said. "They think of him as a big brother so they call him BB."

Ron smiled. "Cool!"

"I was taken under Ryan Carlson's wing after the courts took me away from my mother and sisters." Now looking sad, Charlie said. "They were not exactly the best role models."

"Rogues, huh?" Wincing, Ron said. He then smiled. "Use your past to strengthen your resolve for a bright future."

"Here Here!" Cheering, Viva said.

Charlie smiled, motioning to the many shops. "Enough going down 'amnesia lane'." Chuckling, he said. "Let's hit the shops!"

A loud crash and screams drew the group's attention to the far side of the fair. They saw a large hole in the perimeter wall with a number of Boarbatusks or Grim Boars charging in from the outside with an Eras or Grim Bear right behind them! Men, women, and children alike scattered, screaming in terror as the creatures attacked them at random.

"How did they smash through the wall?" Shocked, Viva asked.

"That doesn't matter!" Taking command, Charlie said. "There are people in danger and we are the only ones equipped to help them!"

"Then let's do it!" Drawing his gun sword, Ron said.

Acting upon all of their training, the four charged the invading creatures. Needing a weapon, Charlie grabbed a flag pole from a wall mount on the run and swung it with all his might against the first monster. To his surprise, there was a bright flash and the Boarbatusk was literally sent flying over the high wall!

"Damn, Charlie!" Killing another monster, Ron yelled. "Not bad!"

Although Charlie was surprised that he had used magic, he had no time to worry about it. "Watch your six, Ron!" He threw the flag pole at creature charging his friend from behind! The pole impaled it through the head before bouncing back to his awaiting hand! He then turned to Viv and Vogue. "Let's show them what twin witches can do!"

Viva and Vogue were fighting the monsters with magically made katakana swords similar to Chon's. They jumped back to Charlie's side and touched his shoulders. Immediately, an energy field surround them and Charlie threw his hands out just before a powerful blast of magic fired from them, throwing the Grim bear back through the hole in the wall! Ron, seeing his opportunity threw what looked like a grenade at the hole! It exploded, forming a foam like substance that sealed the hole in what looked like solid rock!

"Cement foam." Softly, he explained. "It will seal any door or hole with a foam as solid as cement. They won't get through that before the wall is repaired."

With the invasion thwarted and the monsters destroyed, the people of the fair applauded and cheered. The children were, for once, the heroes of the day!

**************************************************************************** **********************************************

"When Ozpin returned from the initiations, he was told of the incident and he summoned us to his office." Finishing his story, Charlie said. "He thanked us for our bravery and asked us to attend the initiation ceremony."

I grunted, looking Charlie in the eye. "What of the flag pole?"

Charlie smiled and pointed to a long white staff with a red flag near the pointed end leaning against the closet door in his room. "Ozpin let me keep it as my weapon of choice."

I shook my head. "Interesting..."
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: We question the kids.

choices: Chon meets Ren in the library.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Matt's POV

Later that day, I reported to Ozpin's office at his request to find him and General Ironwood waiting for me. There was a serious tone in the room, making me uneasy. "I received your summons, headmaster." Politely, I said. "If you are asking about the spice, I have not yet begun my investigation."

"Ozpin informed me that this spice your brought is your world's equivalent of our dust." Calmly Ironwood said. "I am confident my scientists can speed the investigation along if you are willing to lend me a sample for them study."

"I have samples of refined spice, not raw spice." Firmly, I said. "However, I will give you a a few samples for study if you can gather samples of Remnant's native plants for me to study."

Ironwood nodded. "Consider it done."

I nodded then summoned two vials to my hand. One was liquid while the other was a powder. "The liquid is called a serum or potion." Calmly, I explained. "The powder is the same but in a solid form."

"What is the difference?" Curious, Ironwood asked.

I smiled. "The serum is more stable. Don't drop the powder unless you wish to redecorate this room and don't sniff it unless you want to lose your head, literally."

Ironwood smiled before placing the two vials in his vest pocket. "I will see that samples of various plants are sent to your lab."

I watched Ironwood leave then turned to Ozpin. "Will there be anything else?"

"There is one other matter I wish to discuss, Matt." Calmly, Ozpin said. "You have been studying the Grim creatures very carefully, almost to an obsessive degree. Why?"

I sighed before walking to the window. "During the initiation, my pack devoured a small pack of Beowolves to thwart an attack upon my teammates." Softly, I said. "They are all made of dark magical energy; the reason they do not have a soul."

"You may sense dark magic within them but they are much more than that." Frowning, Ozpin said.

"Hens why I must study them." Firmly, I countered.

"Just don't get too close with your studies, young man." Serious, Ozpin said. "The Grim may not have a soul but they are not without intelligence."

I raised an eyebrow to this but before I could ask any questions, Ozpin dismissed me with a polite wave of his hand. I left his office with yet another riddle to unravel. He was not telling me something only what was it he was unwilling to share?

Elsewhere...
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: continue.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Chon's POV

The following morning, we had a break from classes and I made my way into the grand library. I got a number of looks from the other students. I could tell what they were thinking; a blind student in the library. If they only knew I had my own way to see. Still, I was not there to educate anyone, I was there to enjoy some peace and quiet. I heard a low commotion near the center of the room and moved in to investigate. At a large table, I found the members of RWBY in the middle of some form of role playing strategy board game. Ruby had her head down with a defeated look on her face; I guessed she had made a less than spectacular move that cost her. I walked passed them to find Ren reading with Nora napping next to him.

"I see the warriors are enjoying their down time." Approaching him, I said.

Ren looked up from his book with a serious look on his face. "Those who only think of the conflict will lose their soul to it as that is all they will be left with." Cryptically, he responded.

His words hit home as I had once only thought of my conflict against witches and magic. My private war had earned me the title of 'The blind vengeance'. Only I was now a changed man; I even adopted two young witches who call me their older brother. "I see you read up on me." Softly, I said.

Ren smiled. "Actually, I know nothing about you except for what I had picked up from the 'chatter line' of rumors and conversations." Calmly, he said. "I prefer to know someone better face to face." He motioned to the exit. "Shall we take a walk?"

I nodded and followed Ren out to a large garden off the library with various benches for people to sit down and read outside. I briefly told him of my past and my brief one man war against witches. He listened carefully; only nodding or grunting in response until I had finished.

"The grim in this world is a constant threat." Calmly, he said. "I have read about many people launching a one man war against them but it is futile; they outnumber us millions to one." He then smiled. "You had achieved the true height of a warrior, Chon Kay."

"How is that?" Curious, I asked.

Ren motioned to Viva and Vogue, sitting on a bench with Charlie and Ron not too far away. "You had made friends out of an enemy."

I smiled at that; Ren was very wise for his age. "True."
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Chon meets Ren in the library.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Amy's POV

Well it looks like Chon's getting buddy buddy with Mr fancy in green over there, well at least he's happy. And he's not cursing magic or anything like that, sure we argue here and there. But Chon's a changed man now, a good thing that happened too. No doubt in the future he'd have probably ended up as a wandering assassin for hire, killing anyone for the right price. He's good at sneaking up on you too, the guy can tiptoe over twigs and dry leaves without you knowing of his existence. It can be quite the pain at times let me tell you, and what makes it worse? Viva and Vogue are learning how to sneak around too, in Chon's efforts to teach them how to fight without their magic. They get up to no good with that I'll tell you now, the number of times they've tried to get my precious sketchbook....

As I sit down at a table I take out the book, it's magically enchanted to have several hundred pages. And a contents page so I can look at my past work, I'm just absentmindedly doodling a grimm monster with nothing else to do. Just then though I turn my gaze to the left, and see a book. Must have been left on it's own, I give a little frown before picking it up.

"Ninjas of love?......Who made this crap?" I mutter, feeling curious I decide to open it. And sift through the pages around the middle, more out of curiosity than anything else. But as I read the pages, I can't help but feel a blush arrive on my cheeks. The contents of this are......spicy.......really........

"Oh......wow, talk about flexible......" okay now that was pretty impressive, and the detail of the action they're taking.......

"Amy?" I hear an Asian voice speak behind me. Oh crap it's Chon!

I let out a little yelp and jerk my head upwards and turn around, dammit he nearly gave me a heart attack. I quickly give a huff and look away before saying "What do you want?"

"You seem flustered, is there anything that's bothering you?" he asks, and it's in a rather concerned tone. Something that I'm not used to from him, perhaps it's because we're used to arguing. And then.....I don't know why but after looking in that book, I imagine us naked and sweaty in a dark room.

Chon is really buff, with scars from the fights he has been in. And he can be troubled too, and......I need to focus! And quickly deal with this situation.

"It's nothing! I need to go!" I quickly grab my sketchbook and make to bolt out the room, thankfully Chon doesn't go after me. Oh God, I need to read all of that book. Dammit Chon, why do you have to cause me no end of trouble even when you don't mean it?!

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Huanle's POV

Well it's been pretty crazy as of late, but I feel that I'm coping well. I'll admit that I'm not the best witch out there, or the best in hand to hand. But I can fight just like the rest of my dorm can, it's kinda funny. Seeing that Viva and Vogue, a couple of 12 year old girls. Who are capable of overpowering and beating the crap out of Charlie's Sisters, who are 4 years their senior is the least crazy thing they can do. It's all thanks to Chon, I remember the disbelief on Mel's face when it was confirmed that he and I are related. Mel and Chon don't really well....get along, though I think it's more one sided now. Chon used to really hate magic, and pointed at the Harrison's as being the ones responsible for the state of the witch community. And Mel hated Chon because of how he murdered several rogue witches, and even tried to hit her in the past. Least according to her.

Still with Remnant, I can't believe that those grimm monsters are able to roam so freely. This place needs help, and I think I can give that. With everyone by my side, speaking of that I'm part of a team now it seems. And there's one member of it that I want to talk with, Dex Bedlam. He doesn't really seem much of a nice guy, but he's going to need to open up to someone if he wants to live in this world. And maybe I can be that person, like Mel was for me.

I'm dressed in a pair of blue jeans with red sandals, a dark denim jacket and a plain yellow shirt with pink Chinese handwriting for "Love" written on the centre. I'm outside the library, and sure enough I spot Dex. He's dressed as he normally is, has the Starmage uniform jacket tied around his waist. His long legs wearing the Starmage slacks, and that green shirt of his. He's looking down at the ground with headphones on, and I can hear heavy metal music blaring from them as I near him.

Dex acknowledges me out the corner of his eyes, I smile and lean down with a tilt of my head. Knowing that I'm not going anytime soon he takes the headphones off of his blood red hair and turns them off, before giving a sigh.

"What do you want Huanle?" Dex mutters, he's not showing me hostility. But it's clear that he doesn't want to be interacting with me if he can help it.

"I was wanting to talk, if we're going to be working on the same time I figured I ought to get to know you. Lunar and Juan I pretty much know, you though I don't. You've got time right?" I say, as I lean on the tree next to him.

Dex sighs, but he can tell that I'm not budging. He folds his arms and looks away from me before saying "Fine, though your not gonna get anything fun or good."

"Well at least you agreed, that means something to me Dex. Why don't you tell me a bit about yourself, the basics." I figured it best to get the ball rolling with something simple.


The redhead pauses, looking away from me. Before grunting and saying "Well my parents are rich as you probably know, tech bigwigs. They're not mad scientists, but they know about it and magic. I never learned mad science, everything that I've done has been through trail and error."

"Like those swords of yours? They're quite nice." I comment.

In response to that Dex gives a little smile. "I made them myself, I can cut with them. Or shock people with them, sometimes it's fun to let them wriggle a bit. Just to let them know who they're dealing with. Sorry if that sounds a bit mean, just I've not had much in the way of friends."

"Mhm. Well hey you've got them now, Juan and Lunar and me. We're gonna be there for you." I say.

Dex stands up and turns to me before saying "Alright, thanks I guess. I'll do the same, I'm not much of a team player though. So don't expect me to go to your big parties, don't think your Brother would approve of me being there. Considering what I did."

"Well what matters is you learned your lesson, I think the Dex before wouldn't even talk to me here. I'll let you get going, if you ever want to do anything let me know. See ya around." I say waving goodbye as I walk away, though I can't help but make my hips sway. Just a little, maybe it's cause he's watching.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Shomei's POV

Matt had requested to see me in private early the next morning, insisting that it was urgent. Considering his age, I did not alert the others in case it was nothing. Considering he was a mad scientist, I had to assume he would not use the term 'urgent' lightly. Upon entering his room, I was slightly surprised by how much if the space was dedicated to his science. Matt had his back to me, looking into a microscope. I cleared my throat to announce my presence and he turned, revealing dark rings under his eyes, he had obviously been up all night which was not a good sign.

"What is the situation, Matt?" Calmly, I asked.

"Ozpin is not being completely straight forward with us." Bluntly, Matt said. "I need your experience and foresight to help confirm my findings."

I took a seat, wondering what findings Matt might have discovered to cause him to believe something was afoot. "I'm listening."

"As I have reported to you earlier, I sensed black magic in the creatures of Grim." Frowning, Matt said. "I had first theorized that that was why they had no soul; they were made and not born. However, that proved to be less than accurate; they are drawn to all things dark including black magic and devour it."

"What does this have to do with Ozpin?" Curious, I asked.

"I am a Neko, Shomei." Serious, Matt said. "On top of that, I am both a witch and a mad scientist. I can sense things normal humans can not." He frowned deeply. "Ozpin was trying to warn me away from something only I have no clue what that might be."

Matt then relayed the entire conversation he had with General Ironwood and Ozpin. He stressed the emotion in their words as he spoke. I listened quietly, searching the words that were said for any clues. When Matt had finished, I nodded. "You are right, to a point." Calmly, I said. "Ozpin is holding something back from you or all of us." I sighed. "Still, remember that we are only here for a week."

Matt shook his head. "That is where you are mistaken." Darkly, he said. "Look at your class schedule; you will find that you, all of us are not scheduled as visitors but full time students." He respectably bowed before me. "Something dark is most definitely afoot, Shomei. Please confirm my findings."

As I took in everything that Matt had said, I found that there was some weight to what he had discovered. Upon studying my schedule card, I discovered that Matt was correct; we were all listed as full time students at Beacon Academy. I decided it best to speak to Ryan about this immediately.

I made my way to the gym where I found Ryan and Light...

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Yang had walked into the school gym as Light, Chon, and I were working out. She threw Light a wink then walked over to us. "Do you boys have a minute?" Lightly, she asked.

I stepped off the tread mill I was running on as Light put down a three hundred pound weight and Chon stopped his Tai Chi exercises. "What's up?" Calmly, I asked.

"There is a great hot springs resort just outside of Vale." Smiling, Yang said. "They are giving out free visits to exchange students in hopes to entice them to come again while on vacation or during travel." She winked at Light. "They have private spa rooms too."

I skillfully hid a grin seeing Light blush slightly. I don't think I had ever seen the man blush before and I'm sure it was a new experience for him as well. Only the levity ended the second I noticed Sho enter the room with a worn look on his face. I did not know the man for very long but I knew the expression he carried all too well; he was bringing us bad news.

I sighed as he approached; might as well get whatever it is done and over with. "You have news for us?"

Sho nodded. "I'm afraid that Matt Moray has stumbled upon something that affects us all."

Crap! It's always something when it involves mad scientists, it seems! "What did he stumble upon?"

Sho showed me his schedule card for his classes at the Academy. "First, we are only supposed to be here for one week and yet we are marked as full time students instead of visitors." Darkly, he said. "Second, Ozpin seems very worried about Matt's obsessive study of the monsters of Grim."

Sho then relayed what Matt told him in every detail. I listened, frowning as I placed all the facts together. "I think we should give Ozpin a visit and see if we can't get some answers."

Sho nodded. "I agree."

Yang seemed lost by it all but also seemed pleased that Light would be staying longer. I motioned Chon and Sho to follow me then turned to Light. "See if you and Yang can discretely get some answers from the other exchange students." Calmly, I said. "Perhaps this affects more than just us."

Yang nodded. "You got it, boss!" Smiling, she said. She took Light's arm. "Come on, big guy, let's go meet new people!"
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Talking with Yang.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

I walked to the elevator with Sho at my side to find Glenda Goodwitch standing guard at the doors; there was a deep look of concern on her face. She nodded at Sho and an before stepping aside. "Ozpin has been expecting you, Mr Carlson." Firmly, she said. "You may go up alone."

Sho raised a single eyebrow but nodded. "Then I shall wait here." Calmly, he said. "I trust that is not an issue with you, madam."

Glenda grunted but did not respond. I stepped into the elevator and rode it to Ozpin's office where I found him alone behind his desk. "I had a feeling you would come to me after my meeting with the young mad science prince." Softly, he said. "Yes, I made you and your companions full time students; Elvira Strange, the head witch of your world is aware of this." He smiled slightly. "I assure you, she is one woman I would rather not annoy."

I smiled slightly, knowing the magical power of Elvira Strange. She was practically invincible by mortal standards with patience to match. "I need to know why we have been made full time students and why we were not informed of this change of plans."

Ozpin sighed. "We are facing a new enemy, Mr Carlson; one who we can't allow to spread her forces to other realms." Darkly, he said. "I reached out to Elvira Smith for help and she recommended your team as well as Matt Moray and Juan Smith." He stood up with his cane in hand. "I did not tell you or your group because I was not certain until; this morning that I was going to ask you and your team to stay."

"I see..." Annoyed, I said. "I prefer people to be straight forward with me, Ozpin."

"You also know that not everything can be made public knowledge, Ryan." Firmly, Ozpin countered. "Dust, what we use for weapons and defense has been stolen and redirected clear across the board, making supplies hard to come by."

"So that is why you need the spice." Catching on, I said. "Since it is grown instead of mined, you can replace the lost dust quickly in case of an attack from this new enemy."

Ozpin nodded. "Precisely. Matt Moray plays a vital role in our kingdom's well being. You and your team also play a crucial role in keeping the kingdom's safe."

"How so?" Curious, you asked.

"You can fight without dust or spice." Calmly, Ozpin said. "An advantage we desperately need."
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: A meeting with Ozpin.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Carlson's POV

Well Ozpin's words had me concerned, from what I've been able to gather Dust is actually gathered in very large quantities. So much so they don't really know what to do with it all, and I think you could actually create more. But then again I've only been here a couple of days, hardly enough time to know everything about Remnant. I will admit it's been interesting, the land's beautiful but marred by the monsters. If they got to my world.......I don't want to think about that.

Right now I'm getting ready to hit the road, we're all going on a trip to a huge set of hotsprings that are just outside Vale. This is more like it, when I was training back in Japan I actually spent time in a hotspring. It can be really, really relaxing. And frankly all the stuff that we've done thus far warrants a rest, pretty much everyone is coming except for Matt. He's locked himself in his room and won't come out, Light tried kicking the door off the hinge but he ended up shattering his leg. It healed quickly but we reckoned the door was altered. So we decided fine then he can stay there, though something tells me he might show up later.

Jenny nudges me with her arm, that snaps me back to where I am. We're just getting off the bus, it's one of many and numerous people are getting off. There's Ruby's group, and a few guys who are led by a guy called Sun. Apparently he and Blake are having a similar situation to Chon and Amy, though it's not as severe in my mind. There's another team, one guy in it's huge and one of the girls has bunny ears.

"Hey Ryan, this is those hotsprings Yang said." Ruby said, in front of us is a rather grand staircase. With very nice trees that look well cared for, this place seems really in touch with nature. Though I'm a bit concerned that grimm could attack, after all it is just outside the city limits of Vale. Granted it's probably protected but still, the fact that it's outside of it concerns me.

My concern is justified, as suddenly I hear a loud pitched scream from the building at the top of the stairs. Instantly I turn to Ruby and promptly run up the steps while shouting "Ruby c'mon! Everyone else stay here!" Me and Ruby are the scouts. We're gonna check it out before anyone else comes up, to limit the chance of us all getting hurt.

As we reach the top of the stairs several people, mostly older people are running past us. Thankfully though most are dressed at least, based off of how they are I reckon they're married couples. I pause briefly and Ruby does the same, but we quickly recover and make our way inside. I can see a woman hiding in the reception desk, I sheathe Azura and near the desk.

"It's okay, we won't hurt you. We're from Beacon Academy, I'm sorry but please tell us what happened." I say calmly, like I do when coaxing Charlie out from hiding. The receptionist is an old woman with cat ears and a Japanese style hime cut, like a proper hot spring owner.

"Y-Your from Beacon? Oh heavens be praised, we've been attacked by Grimm! Oh our customers won't return now!" she says as she kneels in front of me.

I look at Ruby briefly before saying "Look it'll be fine, there's more than just us. Those Grimm won't trouble you."

The receptionist claps her hands and says "Oh thank you kind sir, if you do this you will have free use of the springs for the day. It is the least I can offer, our complex is quite large. Though it's strange, from what the customers said the Grimm ignored them and went right into the springs. That's never happened before."

"They're using the springs?! Oh how dare them! That's our place of relaxation!" Ruby says, stomping her foot after it.

I sigh, I'm no Grimm expert but it does sound odd. Regardless they could be a danger, and I need to step in. "Don't worry, like I said we'll handle it. C'mon Ruby, let's get everyone and divide and conquer." I say as I make to head outside.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: continue.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Carlson's POV

A short while later after telling everyone about the situation at hand we agreed to split up into our teams and take out the grimm resting in the hot springs. The place is actually quite huge, bigger than I first thought. No matter though, we have the numbers to handle everything there is there and then some. I step out with Jenny, Light and Chon. I can feel the heat already, a good thing I'm wearing my summer clothes. We have our weapons at the ready, and enter slowly and carefully. We don't know the exact number of Grimm in our location, so in this case we're playing it safe.

Jenny nudges me and points, and I see......a couple of beowolves chilling in a spring not too far from us. I actually tilt my head in response to this, aren't they supposed to be prowling and snarling monsters? One of them looks at us and gives a little grunt and motion to the other, who simply rolls it's head and does nothing else.

"Ryan, is it just me or do they seem to be enjoying the springs?" Chon mutters.

Before I can say anything Light moves forward with his sword. And he says "Are you fucking kidding me?! These monsters are taking up the spots we were gonna have! That's it I've had it, eat this!" with that he leaps into the air. And brings down his massive stone sword that he named "Big Sister" onto the head of one of a beowolf.

Jenny then steps up saying "This place is meant to be a place of relaxation, that's important considering the state of Remnant. You've got no right to be here!" my girlfriend then conjures up a fireball in her hands and flings it at the other monster. Jenny and Light are acting kinda weird here, but the fact that these grimm are too busy with the springs could be useful to us.

Well most of them anyway, as suddenly to my left my semblance kicks in warning me of an attack. I quickly draw Azura and spin in place, beheading an Ursa grimm in the process. I put my blade back and sigh. "It's clear that we can't allow these things to remain, not this close to Vale and Beacon. Chon scout the area, if you encounter any bathing grimm assassinate them. But don't push too deep."

Chon nodded and lept into the air, I activated my communicator and said "Ruby, this is Ryan. How's it going on your end?"

"Hey Ryan, we're doing pretty well. Most of the grimm seem to be bathing in the springs, it's easy pickings for us." Ruby chimes to me, she doesn't seem too bothered by how odd these monsters are acting. Though she might be more used to seeing grimm as she's from this world.

Regardless I get responses from other teams, Sun says it's all too easy. Coco complains that it's making her glasses fog up, Juan states he intends to study the water for anything that might have attracted the grimm. And I'm done here, once I sign off I hear the loudspeakers going off.

"Attention hunters, upon destroying all the grimm in our establishment. Feel free to return to the reception to claim your complimentary yukata!" the receptionist yells.

Chon comes back to me with his hookswords out, though he puts them away and says "I wiped out 4 beowolves. This is a beautiful place, none of it is artificial and it appeals to my senses. Perhaps I might visit again if time permits it."

I simply roll my eyes and smirk, but yeah this could be a place we could come back to. Maybe after a mission or something, I wonder what's happening back home. My Mom, does she know I'm here? In another world? Probably not, but I want to be safe. So that she can see me again.

I draw my sword and say "We've still got some ground to cover, let's keep going." the sooner we do this the sooner we can relax.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Continue

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

We were making steady progress in pushing the Grim monsters away from the hot springs but we were no closer to understanding why the normally aggressive creatures were so suddenly attracted to them to just lounge around and seemingly relax.

"It doesn't make any sense!" Chasing an Ursa away from the hot springs, I muttered. "I thought these were mindless creatures that plagued the countryside!"

I then heard a sigh before a soft melodious voice reached my ears. "They are not completely mindless, out world traveler."

I spun around to find a young girl with long white hair sitting with her back to me in one of the hot springs. She turned around to reveal a ghostly white face, like a porcelain doll, and red eyes. She looked like a one of the Grim monsters only in human form!

"What the fuck you say?" Taken back, I asked.

"You heard me, out world traveler." Softly, the girl said. "The Grim, as you call them, are not completely mindless; they too require food, water, rest... and relaxation." Her eyes narrowed at me. "What right do you have to interfere? You and your people do not belong here in the first place."

The girl's tone irritated me but I was more curious as to who or what she was. "We were invited here." Ice in my voice, I countered. "We came here to relax."

"Then relax." Motioning to the waters, the girl said. "Why all the drama?"

"The Grim attacked this place..." Firmly, I began.

"Really, were you here to witness it?" Inquisitively, the girl demanded. "I'll make this simple, human; call off your attack and you will not be attacked." She smiled. "My name is Mirage, let us relax together."

I shook my head, trying to fit everything together. This was turning out to be a strange world indeed...
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: A Grim child?!

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

This woman, who the fuck does she think she is?! Comes in here, demanding I call everyone off. And for what? Just cause she's says so? I frown and fold my arms, the way Mirage looks screams evil. Fuck she looks like one of those nightmarish dolls that rogue witches like to keep, least that's what Chon says. He knows more about that than I do.

"Sorry but I'm not in charge of everyone here." I state plainly, I'm told I'm pretty good at talking my way out of things. Time to employ that natural talent, I then shrug and say "That said, my friends here I can call off. Besides at this rate we've already wiped out 80% of the Grimm in this area. Be grateful that you have at least 20% left."

Mirage's smile turns into a scowl briefly, before becoming neutral. "Very well."

I send a message to my fellows with my wristband, telling them to stand down. Though I send Chon another message, to convene at my location. I might need backup, just in case. Light complains but he'll do what I say, Jenny is probably thinking it's odd. But she knows me well enough to know that I'd call Chon, she just needs to be wary.

"It's done, now then....shall we?" I mutter, Mirage nods before proceeding to seat herself in a spring next to us. Without taking any of her clothes off or anything like that, I'm not gonna do that. I unzip my coat and lean on a nearby rock, and I'm silent as I look at her. Daring her to say something first.

After a pause Mirage says "Do you always try to solve your problems with violence?"

I reply honestly after that with "Only when no other option would succeed, your Grimm don't speak English. And have caused this world no end of chaos."

Mirage makes to speak, but I cut her off with "My turn, how did you know I'm not of this world? That's top secret information, tell me now."

This woman wasn't as clever as she thought, saying that I was an out-world traveller. That's confidential, how did Mirage know?

She doesn't speak, and avoids looking at me. Hiding something, I can fucking tell. I chime up with "I know we're relaxing, but why don't we get to know one another. And you know what they say, all good friendships are based on honesty."

Mirage then speaks, moving her hands across the water and saying "I don't question your overall purpose human, don't do the same for my own."

I smirk, I kinda expected that answer. I shrug and say "Well then, I just don't think I can trust you. Look I don't know much about this world, or the Grimm. But I do know is that they are the attackers, and don't feed me any of this stuff that they don't know better. You said it yourself, they're not completely mindless."

A good shot there, Mirage pauses again. I can see her lips purse in a frown. She sighs and says "Perhaps, though they have simply come to believe that nothing good can come from humans being near them."

Touche, but still they do attack even those who can't fight back. I sigh and fold my arms. "I just don't think I can trust you." I mutter.

Mirage giggles, before saying "Oh, your friend can come out now."

After that I hear footsteps approach us. Chon comes near and says "I heard everything Carlson, is this woman the leader of the Grimm?"

"Leader? I am simply one who knows them better than you do, you know who so often speaks of the dangers of magic." Mirage says.

"You gotta be kidding me." Chon grunts out, he takes a couple of more steps. Intent on trying to attack Mirage while she had her back to him, I stop him though with my arm.

"Okay Mirage, I think you've outstayed your welcome. Go, now." I say sharply.

At first it seems that Mirage isn't going to listen, she sighs and stands up. And turns around and glares daggers at the pair of us.

"Very well, I will depart. But know this Carlson, your simply a weapon being pointed at something. Look further, Ozpin hides things from you. He is uncertain of your world and how useful it can be to him, know that." Mirage says, a smirk on her lips.

"Fuck off." Chon says, he draws one of his hook swords and tosses it at Mirage. But she vanishes in the blind of an eye.

"Bitch." the Chinese man mutters, he turns and proceeds to storm off the way he came.

I sigh, it looks like the rest of the Grimm are going away too. This has been so confusing, is that Mirage's intent? I don't care, I don't like her either. Next time we meet, I might just slap her. For now though, the job is more or less done. Time to relax after all.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: continue

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

At least the situation has been resolved, I don't know what that Mirage woman is up to. But it doesn't matter now, we've cleared out the Grimm here in this hotspring. I make a note to mention this person to Ozpin and Elvira, Ruby too. Ozpin and Elvira might keep secrets, but I don't. I have no qualms about stating my opinion to anyone, it comes in handy when helping my friends get over problems.

I put my katana on my side and activate my comm, it sparks to life and I say "This is Carlson, we're all clear here. Status?"

"Hey! This is Ruby, we're done." says the cheerful voice of Ms Rose. Good, the other leaders chime in too. No one's hurt, it was too easy. Was Mirage here for another purpose? Or was she simply doing a case of antagonists out shopping? I don't care at this point, the fight's over. Time to rest.

The loudspeakers crackle with noise before the woman from the reception speaks with "Whew! Thanks for saving the hotsprings! Come on by and collect your yukatas!"

They have those here in Remnant? Strange, though I don't comment on it. After all can't stick out like a sore thumb can I? Mirage seemed to know that I'm not from this world, but what does she know? Ah frack it I'm not going to get anywhere contemplating my navel like this, I begin walking back to the reception with my crew.

A short while later I'm dressed a rather tight yukata bathing robe, it's white with red trimming. To be honest I never did like these things, though perhaps I'm just too used to modern clothing. It's nice to go back and try the tried and true outfits, moreso in a place of relaxation such as this. It's night now, leaving a slight coolness to the air that is above the springs. I'm walking through the complex, checking out what everyone else is up to.

One thing surprises me, I see Dex standing at a bridge. Dressed in a robe as crimson as his hair, though it's open entirely. Leaning near him is Huanle, who's actually making Bedlam smile. Kinda hard to believe that a month or so he was trying to stab me on the rooftop of Starmage. Still, yesterday's enemy is today's ally. Though I wonder how Chon's gonna take it that Dex is getting a bit cosy with her.

Yang and Light trot past me, she's dragging him by the arm. Keeping it held tightly between her chest as I quickly note, they're wearing matching canary yellow bathrobes. Yang's talking about something, though I didn't pick up on and Light was simply looking confused. Lovable oaf.

Jenny comes up to me, she's wearing a nice magenta yukata with white circles around it. She gives me a simple smile which I return, and we simply stand where we are. I've done good here today, tomorrow I'll talk to the folks about that Mirage woman. There's no way she's not important, the way she looked. Yeesh.
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Getting into hotsprings and yukatas~

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Once everyone was settled in Blake came to Jenny and I with a serious expression. She had that look I had only seen on Jenny's face when she was very serious. "I saw to talked to Mirage." Ice in her voice, she said. "A piece of advice; don't ever let her out of your sight when she is close."

"You know this woman?" Curious, I inquired.

Blake nodded. "The old records state that she was once a huntress in training, like all of us." Softly, she said. "Only she became obsessed with understanding the Grim rather than fighting them."

Jenny raised an eyebrow. "What do you mean understanding them?"

"Mirage wanted to discover where they originally came from." Serious, Blake explained. "She felt that if she could stop them at the source, we could kill all the others and free of them."

"What happened to make her... like the creature I saw?" Morbidly curious, I asked.

Blake sighed. "She found where the grim came from... and became one of them."

"How is that possible?" Worried, Jenny asked.

Blake shrugged. "No one is entirely certain." Frowning, Blake said. "I grew up outside of the kingdoms; Mirage has tried to recruit me. That is how I learned about her and began to study her." She shuddered. "The woman is evil and I prefer to know all I can about what or who I may later need to fight."

"Why did she want to recruit you?" Worried, I demanded.

"She is the first of her kind, a human Grim." Shuddering, Blake said. "Do the math."

"I want to know all you know about her." Firmly, I said. "She may become trouble later."

"I guarantee she will." Serious, Blake said. "We'll talk more later, in the library."

After Blake had walked off to another part of the hot springs, Jenny whispered into my ear...
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: Continue

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Jane's POV

I'm dressed in this weird white dress, I don't really know why. John said it's traditional, though I'm not really familiar with that term. I'm trying to learn of the outside world as much I can, like with my Brother I wasn't given a normal childhood. When I was able to compare what happened to me at least, still I really enjoy my freedom. I can move around freely, and get to help people too. Though I'm pretty scared too, these grimm look so big and nasty. Even the little ones look like they want to chomp on me. Thankfully though I made that new weapon to keep them away, plus I've got magic powers too. Oh! And something else, I can do tricks with my mind! Elvira said that I had ESP powers or something, and that was another reason why those mean men and women studied me. It's not often a witch can use their mind as well as magic she said.

I do remember something about that, I could lift stuff just by looking at it. And I just slipped into it, like turning something on in my body. I'm letting myself wander though, and the realisation hits me. My bare feet slip on a rock ever so slightly when I wasn't paying attention, my eyes go wide and I let out a loud yelp. Though as I'm prepared to take the water a pair of hands quickly dart under me, accepting my body and preventing me from falling.

"Hyup, hold on I have you." a male voice says, I turn as I'm propped back up to face the speaker. He has bright red hair, combed neatly to the side. He's about my height too, because I find myself making eye contact with him.

"Oh um, thanks." I mutter.

The man smiles and lightly coughs before saying "Your uh Jane right? I'm Scarlet, nice to meet you."

Scarlet huh? I find myself silent for a moment, then for some reason my cheeks flush. I don't know why though, is it because he prevented me from getting a fall in the water?

He spoke to me though, John said I need to respond to people when they talk to me. I quickly state "Y-Yes, I'm Jane. Jane uh...Yamada. Thanks uh again, I'm not much of a swimmer." I can swim, but I've not had to time to really learn. I was only at Starmage a month before this all happened, though I can use my magic to keep me afloat.

Suddenly I hear a whisper in my head, it sounds like Scarlet's voice just now.

"She's not much of a talker......"

I lightly gasp, but I quickly refocus. Ryan said it's not nice to go about snooping in the head of someone who doesn't deserve it, Scarlet helped me so I don't comment on it. Before Scarlet can respond though he notices something past me, he motions and I turn around.

"Isn't that Yang? What's she doing?" I ask tilting my head to one side, she's sneaking too. Like she doesn't want to be spotted, like Light does when he isn't being loud.

Scarlet smirks and says "That's the boys baths, I think Ms Xiao Long is hoping to eat the eye candy."

That's odd. I respond with "Eye candy? But they don't taste good right?" Lunar said they didn't.

Only silence is there, did I say something wrong? I turn to look at Scarlet and he scratches his head at me, though he then shrugs and says "Well I don't reckon she'll get too far though, my captain Sun's in there. Pretty sure your Brother's there too. Hold on.....3.....2.....1....."

Yang had been peaking through a whole in the wood, but then we hear a loud bang. Might be a bucket, then I hear a voice saying "Yang! Get out of here! Dammit John keep your girl under wraps!"

The blonde woman yelps and promptly begins crawling out of sight, that was so strange. Why did Yang want to see my "Brother" like that? This whole day's been really odd, I ought to go lie down now. Like when my powers are used too much.

I turn to Scarlet and say "I'm.....going, hope to see you around uh Scarlet." I then do what Jenny said I should with people I like. I move forward and give the redhead a hug, wrapping my arms around his neck briefly. Scarlet freezes for a moment, but then he just pats me on the back. I take a couple of steps back and wave goodbye to him, his cheeks are kinda red but he waves back. As I leave I think to myself "Making new friends! Yes I am!"
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.title: your choice.

choices: Mercury knows Dex is on to him.......
1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Well we've had our fun at the hot springs, after doing some Grimm busting of course. Still though, that woman is clearly an enemy. She might act otherwise, but I can tell. I've told everyone about Mirage, Ozpin I recall actually made an important expression for about a second. He's hiding something, gotta be. Though he's like Elvira, plays cards close to the chest even with those who are supposed to be on their side. Why I don't know, I remember that I'm still new. Chances are Ozpin ain't gonna reveal what's on his mind for some time to come.

Speaking of Elvira she's still in our world, making sure everything is hunky dory over there. Someone's gotta hold the fort in the place that's more safer, though I wonder if John's gotten word. Could do with another familiar person here, but I've got all my crew at least. And perhaps things might get more fun. There's going to be an upcoming dance, and speaking of that I'm in a hall that's going to be used for it. I'm just leaning on the wall, trying to gaze a hole in the floor when I hear a voice.

"Hey Ryan! I asked you a question!" Jenny says, I suddenly get back to my current situation.

"Sorry babe zoned out, run it by me again." I state, no point in hiding anything from her after all.

Jenny pouts, but then says "We'll be using the stuff we wore for Charlie's bonding ceremony, makes things easier. What do you think?"

I nod and say "Waste not want not Jen, let's grab our stuff soon. You helping plan this dance?"

In response my girlfriend giggles and says "I don't need to. Check it, Ice Queen's got everything under control." she points and I see Weiss with a clipboard lording Ruby over. No sign of Blake though, she don't speak much. Yang stepped out too. Neptune and Sun enter and the man with the blue hair is giving Weiss the preferential treatment. Smooth.

"Might as well nip out and get our clothes." Jenny says, a smirk from me and we hold hands and exit the building. Though as we walk down the hallway we see Dex leaning on the wall, looking out the window with intent on focusing on whatever's out there.

He looks at me and whispers "Hey Carlson, check this out."

I frown, I've still not really forgiven Dex for trying to kill me on the roof of Starmage. But he seems reformed, so I'll hear him out at least. The redhead points to someone outside the window. It's a guy with silver hair.

"Him. Something's not right about him." Dex says.

"Uhh.....that guy. Mercury Black right?" I say, I remember the face and name. Haven't spoken to him properly though.

"Yeah, he's up to something. I know a prick when I see them, and he's got it written all over em. I'm telling you Carlson watch that one, him and those broads he's with." Dex is usually talking jovial like, this tone isn't lost on me.

"Right, if you find anything out though Dex be sure to tell us all. Only way we can help people is as a team."

Dex smirks at that and says "Heh you know, all this goody goody friendship stuff is rubbing off on me. Sure thing, laters."

With that he departs, Jenny is quiet though she's thinking what I'm thinking.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

Well Weiss guided the whole event's construction, and sure enough she has done quite the spiffing job. Sure she can be pretty snobby with regards to, well a lot. But hey the girl seemed happy enough, so I'm willing to have it slide. And besides, she had fancy curtains installed and has this elaborate theme going on that's really nice. Certainly better than anything we get over at Starmage, it's proof that Remnant has things which are delightful. And sure enough a lot of people are formal here.

I catch Weiss sitting on the sidelines, I figured she'd be centre of the floor right now. But hey I don't know her as well as I should, so maybe I ought to can making the judgements so quickly. I see the guy who has the blue hair, uh one of Sun's guys. Neptune that's it! Seems Weiss is pretty flattered by how he's acting, nice and good guts to him. I'm wearing suit and tie, the same I had with Charlie's bonding ceremony.

The kid's sitting with Viva and Vogue, they're pestering him to do some dance with them. Chon's nearby too, Amy is strangely chatting and joking with him. The Chinese guy is even making an effort to smile, I reckon something good happened with them. Probably burying the hatchet.

Nearby is Dex looking really out of place with that suit and his blood red hair, he's making an effort to dance with Huanle. But still I can tell he's looking at this Mercury person, I'll admit something's not right about him. Has to be if someone like Bedlam can't stand him.

Jenny gets my attention with a tug on the sleeve, and I smirk at the sight. We make our way to the pair that have just entered.

"Well good evening Akatsuki." I say to Shomei, the man is an ex JSDF officer. And needless to say he's looking pretty dapper, he's wearing that old uniform of his. But I notice it has a couple of medals on it, and it's looking real refined.

I don't really know the woman next to him, but she's got some real nice bunny ears and a short black dress on. Must be a Faunus, so there's all kinds it seems. Sho gives a small and polite bow and says "Of course Carlson-sama, I don't miss events like this. May I introduce my date for this evening, Velvet-chan."

The bunny girl blushes and says "Um hi, Sho is pretty good at dancing. I was uh looking for a partner and Sho just happened to come across me."

"Well, I don't like to brag but dancing was part of officer etiquette back in the JSDF." Akatsuki said, that Japanese politeness shining through. He then says "Well shall we then Velvet-chan?"

"Yeah er, bye you pair. Sho you'll really need to teach me about the way you address people, honorifics right?" Velvet says, with that she leaves with the officer in tow. Wonder what she'd think when she found out that Sho's actually far older than he looks, probably take in stride considering all the weird things here.

Light's chatting with Yang, he's already got his suit coat off and leaning on the wall. Yang's eyeing him up and down, probably preparing to eat him alive. Well that's gonna be pretty difficult cause he can put his chin on top of hers.

My gaze then drifts to Ruby, she suddenly looks concerned. And steps out rather quickly, I'm smelling something's up. More so as I clocked Ruby called her weapon down from a giant cylinder thing. Jenny sees it too, because she mutters "Get after her, if she's called her weapon down that can't be good. I'll see if I can get Chon to follow."

I grunt to say yes and swiftly step outside, I know where Ruby's gone. Mentally I request Azura at my side, his voice rings in my head. That aged and strong Japanese tone.

"I answer my Lord."

I stick out my left hand as I run faster, Ruby hears my footsteps and says "Ryan! Look, these guys have been taken out."

Wordlessly I nod, but I choose to chime in with "Something tells me someone's up to no good. Let's go."

The rose nods to me, and we step inside. Guards have been knocked out, all we have to do is follow the path. I'll admit I've not been to this place, must be pretty important if there's all these fucking redshirts around here.

We step into the elevator, some of that corny music starts playing. A stark contrast to the tense situation, Ruby readies her weapon and I draw Azura. It's blade flickers, a subtle sign of lurking danger. The ride stops, and the doors open and we step out. Ms Rose though hesitates, trying to walk in those high heels. How the heck do women wear those anyway? Weiss can do it no problem.

Regardless after that we move forward, Ruby calls out if anyone's there. Lo and behold someone does, she looks real fancy. Catsuit and mask and everything, Ruby begins to speak but I can already tell this woman's up to no good. Case in point she launches fancy dust spikes at us, in the blink of an eye though Ruby blocks them and opens fire. Which is blocked by the woman.

I spring into action, leaping up off the nearby computers and aiming to bring Azura down and cleave her in two. Only she blocks the attack with one arm and the bullets with her other, she makes to swing a trail of flaming dust up at me. But I quickly pivot to the side and dodge as she busts out a pair of swords, I yell and quickly swing into her. She blocks with both blades and sends me backwards with a kick to the gut, Ruby however moves in close with her weapon's bullet recoil.

The blade lock is broken with the enemy falling back, she suddenly turns her swords into a bow and fires dust arrows. Crap. But as she fires those arrows I move in with the spot that isn't being shot at and quickly attempt to stab her in the gut, I'm not playing here. If I must I will kill her.

But the enemy detects it and turns her weapon to swords again and uses them to get in the way of Azura, I grit my teeth and mutter "Bitch." as she quickly backflips away. I put Azura in his scabbard, intent on drawing on our combined will to launch some blade beams at her.

Though the elevator opens again, Ironwood's there. I turn around again though, and the enemy is gone......

"Shit." I state.

"What happened here?" Ironwood says.

I look at Ruby, who's silent. And simply state "You need better men."

Following this the next day I knew I'd need to talk about this with everyone, this went from great to horrible in a matter of minutes.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
(Ryan's POV)

Just then, the elevator opened again revealing the stout figure of Matt Moray who was wielding a strange remote control. I recognized it as a mad scientist's wand, similar to a witch's wand, from Juan Smith.

"I see I missed the real party." Sarcastically, he stated. "If the intruder was in here, it is obvious that his or her intention was to take something from the computers or place something into them."

"If you mean a computer virus, that would not work." Serious, Ironwood said. "Our computer system is too advanced to be breached."

"No defense is perfect, Ironwood." Frowning, Matt said. "To think otherwise is complete arrogance."

Ironwood look insulted but he was not getting any help from me; Matt was right, no defense was perfect, even Light knew that. Matt walked up to the main terminal and pulled out his cellphone, what Remnant called a Scroll. Only, as he did, a powerful image flashed in front of my eyes!

I saw Matt placing his cellphone into a port slot only to be hit with a massive electrical jolt. He screamed before the computer exploded, sending him flying across the room. Ironwood jumped into action and caught him but the mad science prince was dead. There was a flash and I saw Jessica Moray, the head witch screaming to a crowd of witches before I then saw Devlin Moray, the had mad scientist screaming to a crowd of mad scientists; all were armed for battle! The next scene took my breath away. I saw a massive hurricane with a star ship in its eye, the mad scientists flag ship, entering the world of Remnant through a rip with a castle pulled through the sky by huge dragons following with countless witches and mad scientists flying in attacking the world of Remnant! The death of Matt Moray would rekindle the ancient war only the two forces would be united against the unknown enemy Ozpin had spoke of only the world of Remnant would be caught in the crossfire!

As the image vanished, I saw Matt Moray reach for his cellphone! "Stop, you fool!" Firmly, I screamed.

I knew calling Matt a fool would get his attention quickly. It worked. He stopped in his tracks and whipped around, glaring at me.

"You dare call me a fool?" Insulted, Matt demanded.

"Did you care to think that the intruder might have set a trap for anyone trying to follow her trail?" Sternly, I countered. "You are leaping in without even looking." I shook my head. "Tsk Tsk. You are such a novice."

Ironwood grinned slightly as Matt gaped at me, insulted. "I... knew that!" Blushing slightly, he snapped. "Anyone with half a brain would realize that!"

"So how do you intend to follow this intruder's trail, young mad scientist?" Hiding his grin, Ironwood asked. "If there is a trap waiting for anyone trying to stop whatever she did..."

Matt cracked his knuckles, smiling. "We'll just have to do it another way."

I watched, curious as Matt walked away from the computers before pulling out his wand. He fired a beam at the main computer from a distance, causing it to violently explode. Fortunately, no one was hurt as the pieces of the computer never hit the ground; they were suspended by Matt's event. With a satisfied grin, Matt pressed a number of buttons on his wand and the computer pulled itself back together as if nothing had happened. "There, the trap as been dealt with." Smiling, he said. "Now, down to business."

Matt did not pull out his cellphone this time, he used his wand again. "Intruder intentions that do not compute, show us all what you were told to execute!"

"That is the lamest spell I ever heard." Rolling his eyes, Ironwood muttered.

"It's called an event, wise guy." Sassy, Matt countered. "You try to make something up on the fly." He then childishly stuck his tongue out at him.

I grinned at that. "College level one minute and childish the next." Amused, I thought.

Ironwood only grunted but became concerned as he saw a chess piece appear onto the screens. "That is that; a chess piece?"

"That is what we call a Trojan horse virus." Serious, Matt said. "Any computer that hooks up with this system will be under the control of the intruder." He sighed. "It's a very complex program; no doubt littered with booby traps to stop anyone who tries to remove it from the system."

"Can you get rid of it?" Concerned, I asked.

Matt shook his head. "I honestly don't know."

The dance had to end early it seemed, there was a lot of confusion among the folks. But I quickly moved in and got my friends involved, Light was directing traffic and Chon made sure the kids got to bed. Sho was leaning on the wall, but I could tell he was peering through the folks departing. Looking for someone in particular, maybe it was Sho's built in BS detector. The next thing I know I'm standing in Ozpin's office, he glances at me entering before looking at his computer screen again.

"Ah Carlson. I have a problem with my computer, Elvira said you knew a thing or two. What say yo..." Ozpin says but I go right up to his desk and point at the screen.

"This is a virus. It's in your entire system, Trojan Horse." with that I quickly pull the plug on the device and shut it off.

Ozpin lightly frowned before saying "Was that what the commotion was about?"

"Yeah, Ironwood's wrapped it up. Listen you've got a Trojan Horse, it's gonna infect every inch of your system if we're not careful. Try and get every computer you have switched off, Lunar, Sho, Dex and Matt are looking into it." I explain.

"Hmm, right. We'll make sure to keep it as closed as possible, if we can find out who did this that would be the next good step. But first we must defend ourselves. Keep me up to date, I'll look over the camera recordings. Perhaps our enemy slipped up, just a bit." Ozpin says as he scratches his chin.

I nod and exit the office, I briskly walk back to the scene of the crime. Lunar is standing with Matt checking the screen, Sho's standing by at the power source of the network. Dex is on a computer that I assume is separate from the network.

"Tell me you have good news." I say as I approach the robot girl.

Lunar shakes her candy cotton haired head and says "This is a difficult task Carlson. I'm still not entirely familiar with the technology of this world, Matt is also of the same opinion."

"I'm standing by to power this place, my blitzmotor is seemingly able to interact with the computers here." Sho says. Oh yeah, he can produce electricity. It's a universal power source it seems.

Dex waves at me and says "I knew it, that bitch is probably in with those pricks I talked about earlier. Just checking what I know about viruses, my folks might not have had time for their side project but I know tech. And I've dealt with bugs and stuff before."

Lunar nodded and said "Yes, we've already taken the steps to do so as best we can. It's not going to spread to anything out this room, but it's gotten a large amount of data from the present computers. We've preserved what we can and made sure it was backed up."

"The only problem is we can't trace where it's gone. Dammit they got one over on us." Matt said hitting the table next to him.

"Okay I have an idea on how to at least get it off these computers, good things these dolts have USB slots. Lunar this stick should make the virus implode on itself. Logic bomb." Dex says.

"You guys have done good, they might have won this battle. But we'll find them, they're good. But we've got the unity they don't." I say.

Sho smiles and says "You would have been a great leader in the JSDF Carlson-sama, Kami knows that during that time we needed all the positivity we could have."

Even Dex has a little smirk on his face, still we need to be on the attack. Can't always get by on defence, I hope my semblance will tell me something useful. To win we need to attack, that's the key.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Ryan's POV

I'd finally been able to get some shut eye, or rather I had prepared to do so. Matt and the others had been able to mostly solve the problem with the virus, still the damage had been done. Some valuable data had been taken it seemed, we didn't know what it was but it must have been important. But sleep is calling, I just got out my suit and into bed. Didn't bother getting close to Jenny. I just shut my eyes and tried to let sleep take me as my body would demand it.

No such luck, no luck at all. My semblance seems to be different from others like Yang or Ruby, I don't actually have control over when it occurs. It just does, without rhyme or reason. It's happened during battles, one time even when I took a shower. They come to me in flashes, like a glimpse of a photograph usually. Though sometimes they have audio to come with it, usually my voice yelling something which gives me another hint on what I should do.

It's activated, I can tell. When I view it there's always this reddish tint to it, like how you processed those old photographs in a dark room. But it's not like a picture this time, rather a movie. I think it's from my perspective as it always is. I see Beacon Academy, and I also see another place that I'm not familiar with. It looks like some kind of arena, people are running and screaming from something. I'm not sure but I feel panic grip me.

Then it cuts back to Beacon Academy, I'm seeing it in flames. I know this isn't a nightmare, the tint proves it. But I wish it was so that I didn't have to see this, folks are running. There's grimm all over the damn place, the only good thing is I see everyone kicking ass and taking names.

But the worst part? I feel that things are going to get worst. And they do, I feel my hair on the back of my neck stand up. Pyrrha's dead. I see it with my own eyes. How I don't know, I see her look at me. And then she dissolves into dust, not the power source that folks in this world use. She's just ashes, right in front of my eyes. Then suddenly I see this gigantic Grimm monster, bigger than anything I've ever seen before me. And it lets out this roar, that chills me to the bone.

I jolt up, having woken up. I'm dripping in sweat even if my whole body is shivering, this wakes up Jenny.

"Sweetheart what's the matter?!" she says to me as she leans up.

I take deep breaths to calm myself, and eventually do so.

"My semblance worked." I muttered.

"Did it? What did it say?" Jenny asks.

"I saw that Pyrrha woman die, Beacon was in flames." I say, I move the covers to let my body breathe a bit.

Jenny was silent, she might have thought I was mad earlier. But my semblance has yet to be proven false. I still can't believe it, I don't want to. But I have to, what happens from here? It must have been a very dire situation for my semblance to be activated as such. When did that occur?

"Well......let's get some sleep Ryan. No point in thinking about it till the morning, don't worry. What you know can help prevent it, remember that." Jenny says as she runs a finger down my bare chest.

With that I sigh in relief, muttering thanks I then close my eyes. Trying to keep them shut as much as I can to let sleep take me once again.

1351111112121211131111211111123211122312.content:
Dex's POV

Mercury quickly goes on the offence, I'll admit one thing. I tend to enjoy being the aggressor in battle, letting my foe react to me. But since losing to Ryan I've been learning other martial arts, to try and build up a more solid defence. Problem with dual blades is you can't commit both hands, but it provides more options for you. I've studies on single blade techniques in case of being disarmed of one, Mercury seems to favour his legs more than anything else.

He leaps into the air, bringing his left leg with an axe kick. I react by quickly side stepping to the right and spinning, as Mercury lands I spin and slam the hilt of my left blade into his forehead. Mercury staggers back, blinking rapidly. Usually I'd take this chance to lean back and gloat, but Mercury doesn't warrant that. He warrants me trying to batter the shit out of him.

Now that I slowed his assault its time for me to mount my own, I quickly spin again and bring my two blades in at the right to try and slash at his midriff. Mercury managed to rally, the tips of my blade only managed to just nick him thanks to their serrated edges. But I carry on, poking at his legs with a downward stab. Mercury manages to quickly bring his left leg up and blasts me in the chest though.

I go flying back, but my acrobatics allow me to shift back to my feet before I hit the floor. With this new distance I decide on a new plan of attack, quickly putting my right blade away I dig into my jacket tied around my waist. Where I take out three serrated combat knives, flinging them in a spinning motion towards Mercury. I quickly move to go behind them, using those to force a reaction.

Mercury thinks fast, leaping over them. Which I anticipated, I follow up with a leaping uppercut with my left blade. I call this the Izayoi Rise. I catch Mercury on the chin and lift higher than him, following into it with Izayoi's Rejection. A spinning left armed strike, driving the blade into his chest and sending Mercury crashing back down. Leaving a small crater where he lands.

I quickly shift in mid air so that I stand atop him on the way down, my blade pressed close to his neck. I can't resist a smirk as I say "Give it up, your outclassed."

This seemed to get under Mercury's skin, he begins to rise up only for Glynda to move forward and say "Enough, the bout is concluded. Dex step off from him please."

Smirking I say "Fine." Quickly stepping back afterwards and sheathing my blades. Mercury looks totally sour, he knows I got to him. But I quickly move back to my.....friends? Yeah that's what they are. That feels weird to describe, but I like it......

"Way to go Dex!" Huanle says, patting me on the shoulder. I can't help but grin, it feels really genuine too.....so this is what being good feels like......I like it.
