".........I dunno, I mean I am really behind on my school work right now. Any other side tasks and I might have to retry the year again..." I respond.

"Well that can wait, with what's happening you might not even need to graduate from Starmage. You have no say in this Carlson, a team of rogue witch hunters will be escorting you to the Edinburgh witch HQ from the school grounds in 10 hours." Elvira says all without missing a beat.

There's a voice in my head telling me to hang up again. I am really tempted. But so long as I can get back to school that's fine. "Fine, if there's anything more to say it can be done then. Goodbye for now." then I can get away with hanging up. Which I do, going to need to get dressed and all that. But for now I check up on Jenny, and she's shivering.

I instantly go up to her in the bed, she flinches at my touch. But Jenny wakes up and realises it's me, and she huddles close to me silently. I just want to spend some time hugging, which I do. Ten hours is plenty of time for that.
1433111121111112213223222.title: It was Elvira Strange.

14331111211111122132232221.content:
Ryan's POV

In the ten hours before the arrival of the rogue hunters, I noticed something was off. Chon received a mysterious phone call three hours after my call with Elvira Strange. He soon left with Charlie the V twins in a black helicopter. I asked the dean what was going on to which she told me it was a personal matter; one I would have to address with Chon in person.

This got me worried as I knew Chon had several enemies in the rogue community. Damn, trouble just seems to follow me everywhere! Three hours after Chon hastily left, Light vanished without a single word. This greatly unnerved me and I hurried to his dorm to see if I could find any clues. Light never left my side unless it was extremely important. It did not take long for me to find a newly scratched image on the wall with a knife jabbed right next to it. This was how Light secretly left messages. It was two circles intertwined. Only that was it, there was nothing else. The symbol could have meant anything.

Three hours later, Amy vanished as well! Now panic was beginning to set in as I held Jenny close in my dorm room. She was just as worried as I was after her terrible ordeal. "Where did everyone go?" Tearing up, she asked. "Ryan, I'm frightened!"

"Don't worry, Jenny." Fighting my own fears, I replied. "We will get to the bottom of this."

"There is nothing to fear, Master Carlson." Startling me, a female voice replied. "Your friends are safe and sound in Edinburgh."

I turned to find four women in police uniforms standing at the door of my dorm. I shook my head at them, not liking whatever game they were playing. "I demand answers!" Forcibly, I yelled.

"You will get them in Edinburgh." Firmly, the witch in command replied. "However, due to security reasons, you will take separate helicopters."

"Like hell we will!" Angered, Jenny snapped. "Just who do you people think you are!?"

The witch sighed. "I guess we owe you twenty bucks, Mr. Moray."

I jumped hearing a familiar mad laughter. In the next breath, I was alone in a helicopter flying over the ocean with only my pen pal, John Harrison with me. He gave me a sympathetic smile before stating. "Just relax, I went through this myself. Patience will bring its rewards."

I was fuming at this point only John was somehow preventing me from moving out of my seat. He again smiled as he shook his head. "I know you are concerned for your friends and furious with us but it has to be done this way."

Something in what John told me caused me to pause to think. He had gone through this himself?

The helicopter landed just outside of Edinburgh only to vanish an reappear somewhere underground! I looked around and recognized nothing! However, Devlin Moray was waiting for us.

"Welcome, Prince Ryan to Olympus!" Grinning, he said. "Here you will bond with Princess Jenny Forth and forever halt any future attempts to take her away!"

My head began to spin. I looked past Devlin to find Chon and Light in tuxedos standing on either side of a pair of massive doors at the end of a long underground hall. "Where exactly are we?"

"This is a temple under Mt Olympus on Mars, Ryan." Smiling, John said. "Here, no one will be able to interfere with the bonding ceremony." He chuckled. "Elvira Strange and Devlin Moray set it up together for you and Jenny."

"Wait! I thought Devlin Moray was not permitted to enter our world without permission!"

Devlin smiled madly. "This is not their world."

I rolled my eyes. "Loophole..."

Devlin and John then escorted me to the two door where Chon and Light were waiting. Light looked very uncomfortable in the tux he was wearing but he seemed to be grudgingly tolerating it. Chon nodded respectfully before he and Light opened the doors. I was escorted through into a huge grand hall! I saw chairs set up, all filled with the students and teachers from Starmage Academy! Hering a giggle, I turned to see Charlie in a tux of his own to my right and the V twins holding baskets of flowers to my left. Tears began to well in my eyes, seeing all the work everyone had put into this for Jenny and I.

"You guys really went all out for this."

"This is just the beginning." Grinning, Devlin said. "Now get your lover boy ass to the alter so Jenny can walk down the aisle!"

"One last thing." Serious, John said. He waved his hand and I found myself in an impressive black tuxedo with Asura, sheathed at my side. "Now you are ready to become bonded with Jenny."

I nodded, grateful and hurried to the alter to await my love to make her entrance. Soon after, a door at the end of the aisle opened and Jenny walked out wearing...
14331111211111122132232221.title: Later in Edinburgh

143311112111111221322322213.content:
Ryan's POV

It was a simple but elegant two tier dress with ruffled sleeves and a pink sash. Jenny walked down the aisle with former dean Tanaka escorting her in a fine tuxedo. He walked her to the alter and released her to stand by my side. We smiled at each other then faced the head witch, Elvira Strange who was presiding over the bonding ceremony.

"Do you, Ryan Carlson take Jenny Forth to be your girlfriend; to honor and hold, to defend and provide, to love and cherish until you break up?"

I nodded. "I do."

Elvira nodded then turned to Jenny. "Do you, Jenny Forth take Ryan Carlson to be your boyfriend; to honor and hold, to defend and provide, to love and cherish until you break up?"

Jenny nodded, smiling. "I do."

Elvira smiled. "Then by the power vested in me by the witch council, I now pronounce you boyfriend and girlfriend, you may now kiss."

Jenny and I embraced each other and kissed passionately with the crowd of witnesses cheering. We were now bonded with the protection of both our families and both realities protecting us. It was the best thing that had happened to Jenny and I in a while.

Later, at the reception, I met up with Devlin Moray. "How did you defeat the Savage after you teleported us out?" Curious, you asked. "They are usually not a group to back down."

Devlin smiled. "I did not defeat them." Calmly, he said. "I paid them off."

Jenny's eyes went wide. "You what!?"

Devlin chuckled. "The two who had originally hired their services were no longer in a position to pay." Smiling, he said. "Therefore, I simple offered them three times their normal bounty to consider the events that had unfolded a training exercise and leave it at that." He grinned madly. "They accepted."

I could only shake my head. "Whatever works, I guess."


The rest of the reception went smoothly and we were later all returned to Edinburgh where I and Jenny were to face the witch council. At the same time, Devlin Moray requested an audience with John the Light Killer.
143311112111111221322322213.title: a simple dress.

1433111121111112213223222133.content:
Chon's POV

It was a couple of days after that bonding ceremony, Ryan and Jenny are back and safe. That's good. Ryan, he's a good man. My first real friend, the man who helped me towards the path of redemption. He deserved Jenny and vice versa, Carlson just looked so lost without her. To the point where he was acting like me, only concerned with blood. I knew first hand the path that can lead you to, thankfully he won't walk down it now. I have other matters to attend to however while Ryan speaks with the witch council regarding his new status.

I'm sitting in a helicopter, that's flying towards Witchbloom academy for girls. It's an all girl school, all witch school. I used to despise magic, hated it with all my being. It killed my Brother, the only member of my family. Or so I thought. During the raid on the Edinburgh witch HQ Ryan uncovered records that proved I had a long lost sibling, a younger Sister. It all makes sense now, she was why my parents left. They saw my Sister as a chance to come out of being poor, plus China frowns on having big families.

Huanle Kay, no doubt about it. She is my younger Sister, long lost. I know what the witch council sees me as, a demon. Someone who is a story told to keep people in line, with my killing in the past of rogue witches they kept Huanle a secret. Her name changed to prevent her from knowing about me, other than the lies that was fed to her.

The copter lands, I'm dressed in a black suit with white shirt and red tie. My girls are staying at Starmage, this is a matter that I must do alone. I open the door and step out, Elvria Strange is there standing before me. With a squad of elite rogue witch hunters alongside her, a precaution of course.

"Chon Kay! I was informed of your arrival. I hope your not going to be slaying all the witches in this school." Elvira shouts over the copter blades. Even with her statement she keeps a smirk on.

I smile in response before saying "I'm here to visit a student here. You know her I trust. Huanle Kay!"

Upon hearing this Elvira's eyes go wide, before narrowing. "How did you find out blind vengeance?" she stated with a hint of anger in her voice.

"It doesn't matter. I have a long lost sibling, I wish to see her." I state with my arms folded.

The copter dies down, and Elvira walks to me. She sighs and says "Very well, come with me. I will place you in a empty room and bring Huanle to you, please wear this bracelet." the head witch hands me a bracelet with a pink flower on it.

Ryan's POV

"I will handle your relative." I state.

I can tell from the reactions of the people in the room that they aren't necessarily happy with what I'm doing. But if this Samantha bitch has info then I need to know, before our foes do. Hayley then hands me a file saying "Samantha was last seen at a crackhouse in Brooklyn, we suspect the place might be peddling magic infused drugs. And that rouge witches are present there, find Samantha Ryan. And please restrain yourself, there's enough witch presence in this city already. The last thing we need is for it to spill on the streets."

I nod, sticking the folder in my coat. "Are Chon and co safe?" I ask.

John nods "Yeah their in the floor below us, room on the far right after going down the stairs." he explained to me.

I say my goodbyes to them and leave, there will be plenty of time for jovial fun later. Right now though I need to discuss things with my friends, we need to come up with a plan.

And sure enough I find the door no problem, I knock and in a second Chon answers. He peeks out at me, no doubt sensing me past the door. "Come in." the blind man says to me.

I do so, everyone's settled at the dinner table. They are all tucking into some pizza, I've never really been a person for it. But I make the effort to smile and take a couple of slices, we all eat and then after that's done I bring them up to speed.

It's a bit of a doozy. I make sure not to miss any points out, like me learning what I have from my Mom and Granny. Me nearly dying at the hands of an assassin, and finding out a possible lead. "This crack den....are you sure?" Chon said.

I nod "She's gotta be there, there's magic infused drugs going on there. And it's run by rouge witches, she'll be there no doubt." I reply.

"So what's the plan?" Amy asks.

"Well Charlie and the V girls need to stay here. Amy you watch them with Light." I say.

No sooner do I say that Light plans to object, I say to him "I'm sorry but this calls for a subtle approach, Lunar can stake the place out and me and Chon can sneak in."

Light frowns, it's clear he doesn't like that. But it's the right call. Me and Chon are the best at sneaking in our group, I had training from ninjas in Japan. Meanwhile Chon honed his skills through hunting rouge witches, Lunar with her flying powers and scanning devices will also be an important asset.

"We'll be back with intel, and then Jenny is getting saved and those fuckers are dying." I mutter to Light. Chon and Lunar follow me down the stairs and out the building, there's a car waiting for us with Hayley standing next to it.

"You'll find some stuff that might help you infiltrate the building, sometimes the more mundane methods beat magic and machine." she said pointing a thumb at the backseat. There's some makeup and rag clothing, the kind that could let me pass off as a junkie in search of a fix.

"Smart." I merely say, Chon gets in the back seat. Lunar takes the driver seat, I'm about to enter when Hayley stops me.

"Carlson, I know that your feeling intense anger right now. But we need Samantha alive, she'd be more useful alive than dead. She's family to us even if we don't like that, I repeat to you. Don't kill her or there's going to be more problems." she mutters to me.

I'm silent, not even making eye contact with her. She has a point, but at this point I don't really care. I'd blow up this building if it'd get me closer to finding Jenny, nothing else matters to me right now.

"No promises, but you've said nothing about me beating the shit out of her." I mutter back, and then I proceed to get in the front passenger seat.

After buckling up we drive off into the streets of New York, Chon hands me the clothes and make up. "I'm known to rouge witches, my red blindfold's a dead giveaway. I'm not gonna be able to sneak in the front Ryan, I think Hayley gave you this stuff to wear. Make infiltration easier."

No shit, Sherlock. I start applying the makeup and stick on the old beanie hat. Chon must sense how I'm feeling and says "Remember to show restraint Ryan."

I turn around in my seat and shot a glare at Chon, his eyebrows lowering under his blindfold. "Restraint?!" I hiss out.

Chon's not backing down though, and he says to me "How your acting reminds me of myself before I met you and the V twins. Have revenge yes, but show focus and discipline while doing so. Else you'll only lose yourself in the process."

Fuck he's right, Chon usually is. I sigh heavily, and put my balled fists in front of my forehead. I think of Jenny, and what she must be going through right now. I just wanted a normal life, but the fucking magic and supernatural has to rear it's ugly head. And......

I'm thinking like Chon used to, I can't think like that. I need to remind myself that I'm the leader of my team, they look for me to guide them. More so considering we're saving one of our own, with that I give a determined expression and make sure to look the part of a young junkie in need of a fix.

"We have arrived at the location, Carlson you will be dropped off here. I have scanned the building. One moment. Samantha is located on the top floor, the room at the far left. Carlson the window is open, what I recommend is the following. Chon take Ryan's katana and place it on the nearby roof, that way if the situation turns hostile Ryan can quickly summon his blade through the window. I'll drive around the block and meet you back here for extraction." Lunar explains. All without missing a beat, I love that. Light's got one heck of a partner, makes up for the fact he's book dumb.

"I'm going in, Chon make sure your in a good spot to interfere. One way or another Samantha is gonna squeal, even if she's turncoat. Good luck everyone." I say, giving a smile to both Chon and Lunar before leaving the car.

I see the building ahead, it's showtime.

14331111211111122311.content:
Ryan's POV

I've left the car, and sure enough no one's seen me do so. That's good, a hobo coming out a car into the building would look odd to be sure. I look like some young wino, the fact that I've not slept much in a while really adds to the effect. I have a really pissed look on my face, like I really just want to start busting stuff up. And I do believe me, Samantha better have spill her guts. Else I'm gonna spill them for her, I got a lot of pent up anger. And I just need one good reason to unleash it, and if she has gone turncoat then I'm gonna go for it.

But for now I play it bogus, as of right now I'm just some junkie looking for a fix. And as I near the building I pretend to look hungry, and like I'm really down on my luck. Chon's probably found a good spot to stake out the place, he's an assassin of rouge witches after all. That man can track one through a crowded street and nip her in the bud before she can even begin a spell, his mastery of the art of chi is something that the western witches can't comprehend.

But he can't walk in here, his red blindfold makes him stand out too much for something as subtle as this. Chon could wear sunglasses but....I'm not actually sure what lurks under his blindfold, he's never spoke of it. There's probably nothing there, either way there's also the chance that the rouge witches here could know him by sight and appearance.

I look left and right, then knock on the door twice. I hear footsteps coming to the door, the slider opens and a pair of female eyes look right at me. Gazing and trying to gain my intent, but I'm great at poker. So I'm still in character.
"You wanting a fix?" she mutters to me. The tone is sultry, as if she's already trying to tempt me.

"Y-yeah, the kick. I need it! Like, really really badly....." I mutter back, my tone one of desperation. It's half fake and half truth. I'm desperate to act the part, and desperate to find Jenny. So perhaps that helps enhance my acting here, the slider closes.

And then the door opens, the woman is average in height with brown hair. A typical American woman, only I know that she's a rouge witch. All the women here are, I'm only here for one though. That's the only reason I'm here, after this I might just burn the place down. Or maybe I just send another statement, me and Chon beat up all the rouges here. Tell them that we're coming for them.

I don't entertain those thoughts anymore, but I'll rely on them for drive. I've kept up my persona so far, and I'm gonna keep it up with "I-I want the best you've got, I can pay honestly." I show a large wad of dollars. I felt them in my pocket, Hayley stuck them there to help the image along.

The rouge witch takes them from my hand, and counts the money. It's legit it seems, I don't know much about US currency. But she looks up at me and smiles, saying "Well your in luck, we've got a new upgrade to our hum drug. Head upstairs and to the left at the farthest door, that's where you'll taste salvation."

"T-Thank you." I muttered, giving a nod of my head. Just need to behave like a good little bitch for a bit longer, when I find Samantha I'm gonna make her talk. I move up the stairs.

I pass another junkie, laid on his left in the hallway. He clings to my left leg. "S-Spare some change?" he mutters to me. The guy seems out of it, I don't have time for this shit.

"Get some rehab fucker." I mutter, yanking my leg free. A furious look is on my face as I march down the hall, and then I reach the door. I knock twice, calmly.

The door opens, and Samantha is there. Fucking perfect, that makes everything very easy for me. But there's just one problem, she seems to know who I am. Despite the makeup and shoddy clothes that I wear, her eyes tell me so. Samantha says nothing, she motions for me to enter. I hesitate, I don't know if this is a trap. But she's right here, I won't get another chance like this and time is short.

So I move in, and Samantha closes the door behind me. The room looks like your typical drugs lab, and there's magic books and runes drawn about. I don't care right now, I've got an important matter to attend to.

"What brings you here Carlson? Sad you lost Jenny?" she taunts. In an instant my body goes on instinct, I quickly swing my right arm. Punching her square in the jaw, she's surprised.

I glare down at her, Samantha says "You can't assault me! The witch laws will prosecute you for this!"

"Sorry, guess Jenny is a bit of a sore spot for me. But let's keep this civil, the Harrisons sent me to you." I mutter.

Samantha then becomes more serious after hearing this, she doesn't seem to have expected this. She snaps her fingers and mutters under her breath, I get ready but she says "I've cast a silence spell, we can talk in private here. What do you want Carlson?"

"Jenny's been kidnapped, and is gonna be married off at the end of this week. You've been missing for some time, tell me what you know. And make it good." I say, I'm wasting no time in getting to the point. I don't have time for any bullshit.

"What's in this for me? I'm just a quasi rouge, you think they trust me anymore than Elvira trusts me." she says, folding her arms.

"Your record isn't looking good Samantha, it makes you suspicious. Tell me who would have the most to benefit from all of this?"

"Who's to say it's rouge witches that are doing this? Maybe the chaotic scientists are also involved." Samantha says. She makes a good point, but she's not being helpful. And that's why I'm here, she needs to give me something useful. And I'm not leaving till I get it.

"Names. I want the person who's responsible, you better give me something to go on. Or else....." I growl out. Taking steps towards Samantha, it's time to get serious here.

"I suggest you back off Carlson, need I remind you that I've not been proven of any wrongdoings. Jenny's held your leash it seems." Samantha's not showing any fear. And I'm pissed off now, that's twice she's used Jenny against me.

And then in an instant I've got my blade quickly summoned, it flies through the open window in a heartbeat. And in a second afterwards I'm pressing the blade against the neck of Samantha, her eyes go wide in surprise. She's pinned to the wall, her face reflected in the blade's sheen.

"TELL ME WHAT I WANT TO KNOW!!!!!" I scream out, moving the blade ever so close to her neck. It's enough to nick blood, Samantha winces in response to this.

I really want to turn her into sashimi, she's scum. She knows it and I know it, the world could honestly be better without her. And then I.....

Stare into the window, it's glass is broken. And I see my reflection in it, shattered along with the window. And it's in this crucial moment that I realise how far I'm falling, without Jenny to hold onto. This isn't me, Chon's right. And he's probably watching right now.

But I can't press any less on Samantha, I won't hurt her too much. I just need a name, something. Anything to go on, and it seems that after realising my falling fate smiles on me. Samantha says "Elena Kurse! She said that she kidnapped a neko witch a few days ago, that's probably Jenny. Find Kurse and you'll find Jenny! Just let me go!"

I remove my blade from her, swinging it down to wipe the blood off it. Azura is then sheathed. "Consider washing yourself of this line, it'll be the death of you." I mutter. I can't show any emotion to her other than what I'm doing right now, she'll take it as a weakness and get to me. With that I make to leave.

145.content:
*Ryan's POV*

Before I or Light could talk any further, the doorframe was occupied by Jenny. Her small frame looked dwarfed to Light's 6'9 height, she appeared to be rather out of breath to say the least. Heavy panting, looking a little sweaty, hands on her knees the works.

"I....*huff*...need to tell you something." she said.

I instantly went over to Jenny and put a hand on her back.
"Okay slow down Jenny, deep breaths and then tell me." I stated to her.

Jenny gave a brief nod and then took my advice, standing up to her full 5'3 height and took a few breathers.
"Mr Tanaka contacted me, he wants Light and you to head to the reception hall at once. He didn't give me any other details." Jenny said, a somewhat worried look on her face.

Now why would the headmaster want me? Usually it was to handle some delicate matter, as I had the reputation of being someone one could trust. That I could understand, but why Light? Aside from the people in our dorm no one knew of Light's true identity, something bad was going to happen I could tell.

And yet what options do I have? I can't just say "Fuck it, not my problem." Because it always wound up being my problem in one way or another. And now I could just tell this was going to spiral into something too, but again what choice did I have?

"Right come on Light, Jenny you stay here." I said, motioning for Light to follow me. He had a light frown on his face, but he followed my lead.

We made our way out the dorm and through the grounds of the school, past several students of different years. As we were in the middle of summer during this period of time most were just wearing their shirts. I found myself tying my jumper around my waist, I often did that so I could sheathe Asura when I wanted to use my Iai-jutsu.

Soon enough we were in the entrance hall, near the reception. The place was arguably the most expensive place in the academy, what with red carpet and plush leather sofas. Wish we had that stuff in our dorm, nope we just plastic chairs and circular tables with which to eat corn flakes.

We saw Mr Tanaka, the headmaster of Starmage Academy. He was in his early 50's, small streaks of grey showing on his features. He was half native American and half Japanese, with a body built like a tank. Even with that black formal suit on.

"Ah you've arrived." he said to the pair of us.

"So sir, what is it this time?" I asked, I was half expecting him to say that there was an enemy that needed dealt with. But what he would say would be quite a shock, more for Light than me at any rate.

"There's...an odd woman who arrived at our school in the dead of night yesterday. She was swiftly detained by our prefects, however she's requested to meet someone named Light Killer." Mr Tanaka muttered to us.

John's eyes went wide, mine's were as well. Only a handful of people, me and Tanaka included knew of his true identity. He had a cover story here that he had amnesia and took the name John Doe, and now someone who knew was here! This wasn't good, not good at all. Now you know why I go on about how I seem to be flung from one shitty situation to the next, why me?!

I then said "So who is it?"

Mr Tanaka sighed "She claims to have been from the same place where Light was brought up, if this is true then she's either been involved in the project. Or...."

"She was subject to testing, something that wouldn't be considered human." Light said, that was rather rare. Having him finish a sentence.

"Alright let's get this thing over with, so you know we can all get back to our lives." I muttered as Mr Tanaka made to open the door.

"Be careful the pair of you, the prefects say they saw this girl flying. Without magic, and if she's got something to do with Light. That alone makes her dangerous." our headmaster muttered to both of us.

Light merely nodded, it was kinda hard to tell what he was thinking at this point in time. But then again aside from screaming fury, Light never really revealed much emotion.

So with that we went into the room, it was a lounge sort of place. With fancy leather sofas and round coffee tables.
But that wasn't what caught our attention, no it was the woman sitting in the middle of one of the sofas. She was looking at us with a smile as she crossed her legs.

Light gave a small gasp, I thought to myself "Jesus, she knows Light?!" as we looked her over.
http://fc04.deviantart.net/fs70/i/2011/1...

"Greetings, I am Lunar Messiah. It's a pleasure to finally meet you Light Killer, when do we commence our first mission?" she asked, it was a pleasant voice right enough.

"Who....are you?!" Light said, his hands going up to go through his dirty blonde mane.

The woman, who I assumed to be called Lunar frowned. Almost as if she expected Light to know her.
Before this got any more out of hand I stepped in and said "Look, uh why don't you tell me who you are. And we'll see if Light remembers you then."

She sighed and fiddled with one of the flowers in her hair "Very well, please take a seat."
145.title: A new arrival?!

1451.content:
Ryan's POV

Well things took a turn here, I had to admit this wasn't what I was expecting. Nope not at all, to be honest I thought we were done with Light's past. We torched that place, anything we couldn't burn got smashed instead. So how'd she survive? And why did she want to meet Light?

"Okay right, before we get started. I want to be clear on one thing. You're name is Lunar correct?" I asked her.

The pink haired girl nodded and said "Yes that is correct, now I shall begin."

"I may not look it but I am what you'd call a robot girl, although I am real enough fear not. I was created and placed into cryo-sleep several years ago, around the time you were born Light." Lunar said.

Okay now that was kinda odd, not the fact she was a robot girl. I'd seen plenty of those before in manga and what not, a real life one was rather shocking. But I've been thrown into a sea of madness ever since I got to this place. What was odd was how she was made around the time Light was born, but I thought robots were usually rather recently made. Even more so with a girl like this, God she might be prettier than Jenny.

"Carry on." I said simply.

"Well I was placed into a deep sleep after being created, once Light had reached the age he is now I was to join him and carry out missions for our creators." Lunar said.

That seemed to have touched a nerve with Light, he promptly leaned forward and started glaring at Lunar.
"I fuckin torched that place, you should have been dead by it. Anything we couldn't burn we wrecked." he muttered.

"I was in the facility yes Light, however I was placed underground. To be awoken at a certain time, when your powers had grown enough. I would then become your partner, the one who would aid you during your missions." Lunar said, fiddling with a strand of her cotton candy hair.

"Hold up, what do you mean by missions?" I asked.

"Anything our masters told us to do. Assassinations, kidnapping, demolishing etc." Lunar stated in a machine like tone.

"But about me? I'm not a living weapon. I shall not fall to that fate." Light said, leaning back and crossing his arms.

"I'm also suppose to take orders from you Light, is there an overall mission you wish to achieve here?" Lunar said, leaning forward. I had to keep my focus on her flowers, her leaning down and her dress didn't leave much to the imagination. And considering she really was from the same place as John Doe, yeah it wasn't wise.

I then leaned to Light and muttered "This might be our chance, say you wish to graduate from this school."

Light noticed what I was getting at, he then stated "Lunar, since I've arrived here I've felt happier than I've ever been. My goal is to graduate from this school, I want you to enlist as a student here. And reside in my dorm."

I inwardly sighed, it seemed Light had got the ball there right. Now to see if Lunar would agree or not.

14511.content:
Ryan's POV

"Hmmm, very well. If the mission parameters demand it. Then I shall conform to your wishes, I will speak to the headmaster about enrolling in this school." Lunar said.

"Tell her no killing." I quickly muttered to Light's ear, just a precaution you understand.

"And there's another rule as well Lunar, you are to slay no one. Otherwise the mission is over." Light said, I always assumed Light to be well....primal. Not dumb but like animal-ish, I can't recall the last time he washed his hair. Although we told him to bathe on a regular basis at least. But it showed he could think logically here, providing an incentive to make sure Lunar obeyed him.

"Understood, however I trust I am permitted to use non-lethal force?" the pink haired girl said.

"Yeah sure, so go on and talk to the headmaster. Ryan, you might want to go back and tell the team." Light said turning to me.

I nodded and made to stand up, Lunar then spoke "Team? So this is not a mission you are handling alone then?"

I saw Light getting more annoyed, I'd have laughed if the situation weren't so important. But I kept a straight face and said "Yeah, Light lives in a dorm with me. So you could say he's part of a team, will explain to you later. I have to go tell everyone."

With that I quickly left the room, not letting the pink haired girl get even a letter edgewise. I then shut the door behind me and gave a heavy sigh, Mr Tanaka came up to me and said "How'd it go?"

"Well she's not hostile, but she plans to enrol here. In my dorm of course, at least we can keep better tabs on her. You know." I muttered, the headmaster gave a nod.

"I knew I could trust you with this, you've really got your Mother in you. I see to it she gets a uniform and timetable alongside the one you and Light have, here's hoping for the best." he said back to me. You gotta love that, a reasonable authority figure. Better for everyone that way.

So with that I trudged back to my dorm, I nodded at Chon who was sitting on the couch with the V twins.
"Everyone, I have some news to tell you all." I said as I entered and shut the door.

Chon turned the TV off with the remote in his hands, Charlie, Amy, Jenny looked at me.
"What's it this time? Underground monsters? Time portal?" Amy said, in her usual deadpan voice. She never took anything seriously, least on the surface.

"Not that I'm afraid, now you all know about where Light is from yes?"

"A secret testing facility, but we blew it up." Jenny said.

"Yeah, but something survived. And that something has made it's way to our school."

Chon stood up and said "So why haven't we fought it yet?"

I raised a hand up and said "Easy Chon, remember fighting isn't always the answer. No it seemed that a woman was created in that lab, stored underground. Her purpose was to assist Light, and she's going to be a member of our dorm now."

Instantly Chon balked "What?! Are you sure we can trust her? What if she ends up going on rampage or something?"

I kept my calm composure, I knew what Chon was thinking. "Light has explicitly ordered her not to do so, although I'm sure she would fight if he was attacked. But other than that I don't think we can expect an attack."

Chon was silent, I could tell he was thinking. I can't blame him, I'm still a bit surprised by it as well.

Just then a knock was heard at the door, I quickly moved to get it. And sure enough Lunar the pink haired girl was standing there with Light.

"Speak of the devil." I thought to myself. Motioning for the pair to come in.

"Everyone, this is Lunar Messiah. Our new dorm mate. Lunar I've explained the situation regarding you, although there might be questions that they have." I said.

She nodded and said "I shall do my best to answer any inquires you may have."

145111.content:
Ryan's POV

I leaned on the wall, with my arms folded. I was taking the time to size up my crew and the reactions on each of their faces. Chon looked concerned, Amy had a mix of concern and interest. Charlie and the V girls looked stunned, most likely cause of Lunar's pink hair. It kinda reminded me of cotton candy now that I think on it.

Jenny leaned close to me, for security most likely. Chon was the first to speak up with "Okay first off, how did you survive? The place where Light grew up was torched to ashes, how are you around then?"

"To answer your question Mr Chon, I was placed in cryo sleep below the facility. I was to be awoken at a designated time when Light was to be deemed "Suitable for missions." and my purpose is to assist him in his missions." Lunar stated, in a very polite tone.

"If your made to help Light in combat then what can you do?" Jenny asked.

"I am equipped with flight capability, I can recon over a large area and provide advice on the safest routes through an area. For combat I can sprout blades from my wrists or shoulders, my hands are also capable of accepting 9mm bullets for firing via the fingers. I am also have the search engine known as google built in." Lunar said as she tapped both sides of her head.

I just stood there, a bit dumbfounded. I thought I had seen it all, but I always keep getting taken aback. And not in a good way sometimes. Just who to heck were the people that created her and Light? I hope they don't try to "Reclaim their research." I have enough shit on my plate just trying to pass my homework.

"Your a pretty lady!" Viva exclaimed, seemingly not aware of the tense mood that had covered us. Although I was thankful for it at least.

I then sighed and said "Look people, we know how what happened. Lunar has agreed to stay at our dorm, to assist Light in graduation. And if her claims are true, then she can make a good aid to the team. Are their any objections?"

The room was silent, although Chon said "You better behave, that's all I'm saying." coming from Chon that was great. Usually he was all like "Why should I let this witch live? Magic is a blight!" etc etc. Perhaps it was because he was in front of the kids, parent of the year to be sure.

"Well if that's all, let's enjoy the rest of our day. Chon put the TV back on." I muttered, Jenny had said not a thing. But merely cuddled up to me.
145111.title: Questions for Lunar.

choices: They try their usual thing on Light, but Lunar teaches them a lesson.
Light grabs Lunar and they leave for the next day.
1451111.content:
Light's POV

I was not showing it, but inside I was a whirlwind of emotions. I thought I was done with my past, that place where I grew up had been fucking destroyed. Anything that wasn't burned was blown up, this girl...she had survived by being under the rubble, safe in an ice cube. I had my arms folded and just stood there till Ryan piped up with "Hey Light, why don't you show Lunar around the school. It might help."

I bit my lower lip, had Ryan just said what I thought he did? I sighed, I couldn't argue with Ryan considering the debt I owed him. Besides he was correct, it would help prevent annoying questions later on. "C'mon, follow me." I muttered, patting Lunar on the back of her school uniform.

She nodded and we left the dorm, and then she slinked her hand into mine. My eyes went wide and I looked at her. "Uh...the hell are you doing?" I said to her.


"It is so I do not get lost, now please lead the way." she stated. I knew inwardly that Lunar probably wouldn't take no for an answer, this day just kept getting better.


I sighed and said "Fine, just don't talk to other people right now. They might think the wrong thing."


"And what might that be?"


"That we do things like Ryan and Jenny do, I think the meaning is dating or something...." was she thick or something? It was probably because she's a robot.


"Dating.....Ah the concept of courting another and engaging in foreplay. Why not? It could be useful as a cover for our identities." Lunar explained, no doubt using her "Google database." to check on the meaning. It did sound like it could be useful, but I didn't want to think on it and just stand here.


"C'mon, if we say we are together and you’ve just come here then people might get concerned that something is up.” I growled out, letting go of Lunar’s hand as I did so.


Then the pink haired girl stopped walking for a second before nodding and said “I understand, please accept my apologies.”


I just wanted to get this over with, I clicked my tongue and said “Just come on, curfew will be on and we can’t walk around during it.” Lunar took this as a motion to follow me, we walked in silence for a wee bit down a stone path from our dorm. There were other dorms that looked just like ours, it was where the students stayed. My room was…well I didn’t tidy it for a good while to be honest, but I’m messy by nature.


So we walked towards the large building at the end of this stone path, past the pristine grass lawns in front of it. The building looked old but well looked after, like a fine wine Ryan would tell me.
“So you came here last night yeah?” I asked, not looking at her cause I didn’t want to give anything away.


“Yes, I was using my flight mode to scout the location. Whereupon I was caught by the security forces that you refer to as prefects. After a minor battle I was blindsided and shot down, I then woke up in a room with shackles that I couldn’t break. I complied with the headmaster of this school, figuring it best to cooperate to locate you. Then you and your leader arrived and you know the rest.” Lunar explained, it was all…..machine like. Like she was firing off a series of facts to me.


I merely just grunted, I then had a thought and decided to voice it to Lunar with “Hang on, if you can fly. Then why do you need me to show you around? Haven’t you seen all the buildings?”


“Yes, but I have yet to see their internal structure.” Lunar had retorted back to me.


I stood there for a couple of minutes and then nodded, she made a fair point. With that I said “Well you’ve probably seen the entrance hall, I’ll take you to the literature building.”
The building in question had about 4 floors, and was about the size of a football field. It had several windows as well, I saw this place as an enemy to be honest. I was still learning to read and write, but with Lunar perhaps I can get it done more easily.


“So this is the literature building, the first floor covers math’s. Then it’s English, and then History and then it’s uh….Languages. I’ll just show you the first floor, they all look the same anyway.” I said, opening the double doors for both of us. True enough there were about five classrooms that I could see, and I knew there were about five more to the left. I motioned for Lunar to take a peek in one, neatly placed tables and chairs. Fucking gripping.


“Next.” I said, I took Lunar by the hand and walked out the building. I could tell there were people looking at us, a few guys too. Although none of them knew me, so they didn’t want to test me. Now off to the next one.


It was a small building, with a rectangle shape and red bricks. Outside was several sport fields.
“In case you can’t already tell this is the sports place, here things from football to martial arts happen here. They won’t let us into the building unless a teacher is nearby, magic barrier. So don’t get any funny ideas, you can go in there tomorrow.” I said to the pink haired girl, she merely nodded.


I then lead her to a large building, it looked like some large tower converted into a learning center.
“This is the library, any book you need you can get here. And if it’s not they know where it can be found. Come on.” I said to Lunar, I actually enjoyed this place. I was still learning on how to read and write, considering I’d lived most of my years as a highwayman. Least that’s what Ryan said I was.


“Stay quiet.” I muttered to Lunar, the librarians here could be quite annoying if you didn’t follow the rules. Although I was confident I could handle them if need be, but I wasn’t going to start any fights for sure.


The library was large and grand, with bookcases taller than I was. And there were several old tables and chairs, with several students around. Lunar walked ahead of me to look at some of the books, I wanted to stay and read too. At least as best I could. But there were other things I had to show her, and it needed to be done today as school started tomorrow.


“C’mon.” I muttered out, grabbing her once again. The last building was probably the oldest out the lot, it clearly looked aged to be sure.


“And this is the last one, the magic and science department. One half of it is for science and technology and the other is for magic practicing and other shit.” I said to her. Out of all the buildings this was the one I disliked the most, it looked fine but….magic and science don’t’ mix. Like magic and armor, like Chon and witches and…..I’ll just stop here.


When I said science and technology Lunar perked up and said to me “Can I use these facilities to upgrade myself?”


I had a rather contorted glare on my face, I shook my head and said “Uh no Lunar, we can’t have everyone knowing that you’re a robot. It could….jeopardize the mission.” I didn’t want to get into any trouble, at this rate Lunar was being more of a liability than anything else. But I’m sure if anyone could smooth this over it’d be my boss Ryan, he could do it.


Just then I saw a couple of familiar girls walk past, it was Charlie’s older twin Sisters. I forgot their names but I hated their guts. From what I remember their Mother had been a part of the witch coven that killed Chon’s Brother, now Chon had chosen to spare the woman. Charlie and his Sisters were sent here, the girls were being given a chance to not end up like their Mother.

But I could tell it wasn’t working, they still hunted the poor kid every chance they got. Despite getting beaten up more than once for it. Just then they noticed me with Lunar, and then…..

14511111.content:
Light's POV

Fuck they saw us, and fuck they're coming. Now that I think on it more I remember their names, Rose and Carla I think. Bastards, the stuff they did to Charlie was just cruel. Granted I've heard that it gives magic resistance and all that, but when I was growing up I learned there's a fine line between cruel to be kind and just plain fucking cruel.

"Oh look, it's the big dirty mongrel!" Rose said, she was the one with the higher pitched voice. The pair stood there, grinning like hyenas. I wish they were so I could kill and eat them, and get away with it. But alas can't do stuff like that, British magic immunity and all that.

"What's this, is the big idiot playing with a doll? Awww." Carla said, I could taste the mocking in her voice. I snarled and went to go for them, I knew I couldn't start a fight. But maybe breathing down their neck would cause a fright or two, they had bark but no bite. Once you got to them they folded like pound notes, even Amy had some backbone.

Lunar stopped me though, and then closed her eyes. A few seconds later she said "Rose and Carla Ren, your Mother is known as a rouge witch. Someone who disregards the laws of magic use, you have a younger Brother called Charlie."

"Oh the little doll is smart, who are you bitch?" Rose said, getting right up to Lunar and poking her in the chest. I had figured that was enough, and decided to weigh in on her. Maybe I can get away with chomping on her ear perhaps?

But Lunar kept going with "My name is Lunar, I am a new student here. And I believe you require a proper punishment, allow me to give one to you." she said.

Time had slowed down at that point, I saw Lunar placing her arm in front of her. And then suddenly half of a black steel blade appeared out of her wrist, my eyes bulged out at this. But Rose took it worse, she passed out from the sheer shock of it. I could understand that, but I was fine due to knowing about Lunar earlier today.

Carla was stunned by this, and Lunar took advantage of it. Only instead of using her powers to shred the bitch into oblivion, she grabbed Carla's underwear with her other hand and yanked up. Giving her a harsh shove to the ground near her Sister.

I took that as the cue to get the hell out of dodge, before any more shit happened to us. It was Lunar's first day and already she had started something, fucking brilliant. So ignoring the crater before us, I rushed away holding Lunar by the arm.
14511111.title: They try their usual thing on Light, but Lunar ...

145111112.content:
Ryan's POV

It was supposed to be just another day of school, learn stuff and not be involved in any supernatural world terrorist actions. Or at least be assumed to be involved in. Yeah just have a day at school. I didn't expect to be driving a motorbike at over 100mph fleeing from witches on broomsticks in the dead of night, my uniform in tatters and Azura strapped to my back. The rain battering down hard on my hair and eyes, my teeth gritted and clenched while blood drips from my lips. All I cared about was fleeing, then coming up with a plan.

So what happened was........

There was a bombing, at a witch school. Long story short its been pinned on me, they have footage of me placing the explosives somehow. That's all I know, next thing I know is the Rogue Witch police are hunting me. It was 7PM then, in a split second I summoned Azura and attacked them. I know I'm innocent, but they held their weapons against me. I fled the dorms, I don't know where my friends are. In the confusion I ran into the nearby forest. With its thick trees and canopies it made for good cover, I recalled Chon had left a motorbike in the woods. Just in case he always said. Good a time as any, I get on board it and start driving. I head north, the Rogue Witches give chase.

I'm simply acting on instinct at this point, Azura's mental voice speaks to me in a roar "My Lord! What is happening?!"

"I'm on the fucking run Azura, protect me!" I yell out.

That's all the indication he needs. His blade activates and surrounds me, blocking their spells from reaching me with his barrier powered by his will to protect. The rain is getting too much for me now, eventually I don't notice that barrier........

In slow motion the road vanishes, time slows down. Azura moves close to me, the flat of his blade catches me from hitting that cliff too badly. I still plummet down hard, my body hits rocks, twice. Then crumples into what feels like sand, the bike lands nearby and explodes in a heap......

Is this the end? I feel weak, the blood pooling around me. My head feels split in two. Azura nears me, I can actually see his spirit. He looks just like Sho but older with a beard. I see the Rogue Witches land near me.

"Is he dead?" one of them says.

Azura nears me and says "My Lord, hold and do nothing. I will slow your heart beat......."

I feel it, I have an idea and Azura knows it. Chon taught me a technique to slow one's heart through a yoga technique. I meditated, felt my own pulse dwindle. They look at me with a flashlight, eventually they say "I think so.......You stay here and guard the body, we'll report back to Elvira!"

With that all but one of them fly away, the one left looks at me. Before muttering "Scum, witchkind will be better off without a monster like you."

I remain motionless, eventually she moves away. To check on the wreckage of Chon's bike, in that instant it's all I need. Azura channels his energy into me, I find the strength to stand up. I drive the hilt of Azura's sword into the back of her head. She grunts and slumps to the sand in a heap, now I can get to work in getting out of here. Wherever I go next that is........
145111112.title: The last day of normality.......

1451111122.content:
Ryan's POV

I stagger away from the crash site, Azura clutched in my grasp. I cough, what I think is blood. I start to get a move on, its only a matter of time before those witches come back. I didn't kill that one, last thing I need is to not help my case further. I see a clearing ahead, with a path. I wheeze inwardly, I count at least one broken rib on my end. Thankfully no limbs are broken, but I feel something's broken inwardly. I'm not gonna survive long if I don't get treatment I worry. Azura can stabilise me for the most part but he can't heal broken ribs.

I take a deep breath as best I can, then prepare to move into the clearing. I heft Azura and mutter to him to guide me forward. I see a faint blue wisp on the floor. I walk towards it. Azura's senses are far greater than mine, so he'd likely sense people far ahead. Each step feels heavy, like my guts are made of lead or something like that.

Coughing blood, I stagger forward. No way I'm going out here, I'm not giving those bastards the satisfaction. Its then I hear a voice. "Ryan!"

I know it, I see him. "C-Chon......" I mutter, he must have tracked me somehow. Still wearing the uniform. He quickly moves to help me, putting my arm over his back. I grunt and wince heavily. Chon quickly puts his other hand to my chest, I see a faint blue light emerge from it. This is the art of Chi Healing, Chon can promote a body to heal at a much faster rate.

I feel my blood coagulate faster, the bones are knitting. I feel sedated, just a bit.

"Hang in there Ryan, I've found a cave we can hide in. Quite hidden off, we can camp out there till this rain blows over." he says, I nod. I move as much as I can with him so that we can get there quicker. A good long walk takes us through trees, clearings and eventually a path tucked away that leads to a small cave entrance.

A short while later he takes me in there, we get a fire going. Though I can't exactly do much with how I am.

"What's happening?" I mutter as I lie down slowly, thankfully Chon seems to have brought a bag of stuff including a couple of blankets. We're wrapped up in one each, the fire goes strong at least.

"We don't know Ryan, your wanted by all witches. Even rogues are getting in on this it seems, me and the rest of the group have scattered. They're saying we're accomplices to you bombing a witch school somehow." he says.

Damn.

"Do you know where the rest of the gang is?" I say

"Yeah, Lunar managed to connect us all to her. Private network stuff. I've messaged I've found you, Light and her will be on their way." Chon says

That's a relief. We've got a plan of sorts at least. I grunt as I feel my wounds.

"Take it easy, Ryan get some sleep. I'll put out the fire and keep watch for a bit." he says, I simply nod and let sleep wash over me.......
1451111122.title: Chon finds me

14511111221.content:
Ryan's POV

Funnily enough I actually manage to have something akin to a sleep after what happened, maybe its because of how my nerve are simply shot at this point. Like I'm so burnt out I can't help but sleep, I don't dream. My body has just shut down at this point, Chon is keeping watch I'm sure. I'll let him do that. My thoughts had drifted briefly to my mum and Jenny. But that was all before I blacked out......

I'm prodded awake after I don't know how long, I jerk upwards and shoot my eyes open. Chon is there, as are Light and Lunar. Light isn't wearing his usual uniform, instead a black leather jacket and grey shirt with black leather pants and black sneakers. Lunar still wears that dress of hers. We've got duffel bags around us too it seems.

I nod to him, wondering what to say. Images of what happened last night flow into my mind, I just want to think I'm dreaming and I'll wake up again and go to class. But I know that won't happen, I've got a job to do.

"So. What do we know?" I say as I get up and stretch.

Rogue witches are apparently getting involved with this too, supposedly they had relatives that were harmed in the bombing. Light puts a hand on my shoulder and say "Ryan if they hurt her in any way I'll tear them limb from limb I can say that right now."

1511112111121121111111.content:
Ryan's POV

I was watching my beloved sing, she was in the choir back in high school and in primary school too. And it amazed me how this normally bookish and quiet girl could carry the voice of an angel from heaven. Ave Maria made it all the more fitting when you know what the lyrics are.

Once Jenny finished the whole ballroom erupted in applause, Jenny smiled and bowed before going off the stage. Taking a seat next to me, I wrap my fingers around hers. Turning my head to crack a grin the likes of the Cheshire cat, Jenny winks in response to me.

Just then I notice that people are getting up, I see Charlie entering the ballroom. Chon's kids with him, Viva and Vogue holding both of his arms. The kid's in a black tux, with the girls in white dresses.

"Shouldn't you three be in bed by now?" I ask, raising an eyebrow as they walk over to my table.

Charlie smiled and said "Well Chon said we could, it's alright though isn't it?"

Oh that smile, the kid is pure gold. How can I say no?

I ruffle his hair and say "Enjoy yourself then, play nice girls. Charlie's only one guy." I look at Viva and Vogue as I say that.

The girls in turn lean in on Charlie's shoulders and say in unison "Oh we will Ryan, come on Charlie! Let's see if we can find some people to do the dashing white sergeant with!" with that they drag the kid away from me. Although Charlie turns his head and lets out a smile towards me.

I turn to see Chon, he's fuming over the "Dance" he had with Amy. They fight all the time, the fact our dorm hasn't been torn down yet is a bloody miracle.

Then Jenny stands up, as I hear music start to play. Other couples, John and Megan as well as Harry and Mel start to stand.

"Oh no...." I think to myself as I hear the music.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pFXZ618p...

"C'mon Ryan, let's dance!" Jenny said, tugging at my wrist.

I sigh, I look around. Everyone's getting into it, I'm afraid of making a fool out of myself and Jenny. After that perfect singing she just did, we'd most likely end the night on a foul note. I mutter "I can't dance."

Jenny rolls her eyes and says "Please Ryan, do it for me. I don't care if you suck at ballroom dancing, your the best man I've ever known. When I see you I feel that the impossible can be achieved. So come on, and no arguing!"

With that my darling tugs on my sleeve a bit more forcefully, I sigh. Let the babe have the bottle, how bad can it be?
"Okay, I'll follow you." I mutter.

With that I stand up, looking around I witness Lunar talking with Light. No doubt telling him how to go about the dance movements, Lunar's a robot so she's probably got a database of dance moves in there somewhere. Oh how I wish I could walk over to her and get advice, but no I'm gonna have to wing it in my usual fashion.

Me and my darling kitten step into an open spot on the ballroom floor, my heart is pounding. I've never done this shit before in my life. It's funny. I've learned of the supernatural, and seen and done things I'd never thought possible. And yet here I am, getting worried about trying to do ballroom dancing.

"Now put your arm here." Jenny said, I let her sort out my arms and that. Once we start moving I'll be able to catch on quick and do what everyone else is doing.

And sure enough I'm decent at it, Jenny is my soulmate. So we have that going for us, maybe it just comes natural to true lovers. I cast glances to what's going on around us after getting the hang of it.

Amy's sitting down, fuming at Chon as per usual. Chon meanwhile is kindly dancing with Vouge, like a caring Father with a daughter. He's even smiling warmly, yep that's right. Viva was the lucky one and was dancing with Charlie, casting a smug look to Vouge as if to say "I'm dancing with our boyfriend and your not so hah!"

Light and Lunar, are doing somewhat okay. Granted Light's huge compared to the doll that is the robot girl, but Lunar uses precision and grace. And Light's just going with the flow. The guy just doesn't suit the tux though, good thing it's all black otherwise his tattoos would glow out from under it.

Me and Jenny continue the motions, and now I can only focus on her. Time seems to slow as we bring each other close, and we see a shooting star fly past thanks to the glass ceiling atop the ballroom. Followed shortly by fireworks, I look at my darling kitten and smile. She grins and kisses me on the cheek.

154.content:
-Ryan's POV-

I was surprised to find an eight year old girl in a Witchbloom school uniform standing in the doorway with a shy grin on her face. "Hi. I'm Hannah Harrison." Softly, she said. "I had to get special permission to come meet you."

I nodded in greeting. Hannah was the youngest sister of my pen pal, John Harrison who had been dubbed the 'pseudo witch' due to his science that mimics magic. It seemed that his family was full of surprises as Hannah was found to have surprisingly strong magic for her age.

"I would have appreciated a call first." Politely, I said. "I have classes in less than an hour."

Then, dean Elvira appeared behind Hannah. She was a tall and slender 34 year old woman with shoulder length dust blond hair and ocean blue eyes that seemed to dance in the dim light. She had been appointed dean of Starmage Academy by the head witch, Elvira Strange who had every trust in her abilities. Mr Tanaka, the former head of the school took the chance to retire from the job. Ryan still kept in contact with him, he viewed the man as the Father figure he never had.

"We apologize for the short notice, Mr Carlson." Kindly, she said. "However, due to the fact Hannah is the granddaughter of the head witch, the transfer had to be kept secret. The head witch, Elvira Strange has requested you be her body guard as you are a trusted friend of her grandson, John Harrison."

I inwardly moaned, hearing that as Elvira handed me Hannah's profile folder. She sensed my discomfort and lightly touched my shoulder. "Hannah has greatly matured over the last year." Assuring me, she said. "All you need to do is keep an eye on her during classes. She has a body guard detail for her dorm room."

I sighed but nodded. I was not exactly thrilled with watching over a little girl but this request came from the head witch herself. No was not an option in this case. "Who is her body guard while in her dorm? If I am to be an effective body guard, I need to know all of the facts."

Elvira smiled. "Her body guard while in her dorm is..."
154.title: Body Guard Duty.

choices: I escort Hannah to our first class.
Today's classes are cancelled but why.
A witch tries to bully Hannah.
1542.content:
-Ryan's POV-

I raised an eyebrow, hearing that. Viva and Kay were the adopted daughters of my friend, Chon. They were very talented witches, there was no question about that but they were no older or experienced than Hannah herself. "Madam dean, is that really wise?" Worried, I asked.

"Anyone else would be aggravated to tears, watching over a hyperactive little girl." Amused, she said. "Viva and Vogue are well trained and they are just as hyperactive. They will get along just fine." She chuckled. "Chon Kay is not exactly thrilled with the idea." She then turned serious. "All of this had been preset by Elvira Strange; these orders come directly form her."

I sighed, looking at Hannah who seemed to have become slightly nervous. "Why now?"

Elvira closed the door to my room and waved her hand. I could sense a powerful magic and realized that she had sealed the room for privacy. She then gave me a deadly serious look; what she was about to say held a lot of weight so I braced myself for the briefing.

"Hannah has been dubbed the junior head witch due to her incredible magical powers." Softly, she began. "This is a new position of which Hannah watches over the young witches of the world. It bears a great responsibility of which she will eventually grow up to become the next head witch."

"That's unique." Surprised, I said. "Only I thought that the eldest male was transformed into a girl to be dubbed the next head witch."

"That would exclude those born in the UK and other pocketed regions of the world." Serious, Elvira replied. "The laws had to be modified to be fair to everyone. Even so, John Harrison has been dubbed this world's head mad scientist so he is automatically out of the running."

This was a shock to me. John Harrison had wrote that a great honor had been bestowed upon him but he never mentioned this! "What of Hayley or Mel?" Curious, I asked.

"Hayley is this world's witch ambassador." Calmly, Elvira replied. "It is a position of great responsibility as she must keep the peace between witches and mad scientists." She smiled. "Things will be much easier now that her brother is the head mad scientist."

I nodded, remembering the war between the two powers. It became so intense that everyone born in the UK was immune to most, if not, all forms of transformational magic and science. "I take it Mel is out of the running as well?"

Elvira sighed. "Mel has been bonded to Harry Rich." Serious, she replied. "They are now the members of the Watchmen, a very selective group."

"The who?" Raising an eyebrow, I asked.

"The Watchmen are people of all walks of life who are aware and immune to magic and mad science." Calmly, Elvira replied. "They act as private investigators for both sides. Another method of keeping the peace as they help keep young witches and mad scientists in line."

"It's not a matter of lack of options." Annoyed, Hannah said. "I worked hard to earn this honor."

"No one is questioning that, dear." Patiently, Elvira said. "We are merely giving Mr Carlson all of the facts so he can perform his duties to their fullest." She sighed, turning to me. "This is a new position; one that alarms some of those dear to the old ways."

"You believe some may try to bully her into stepping down." Concerned, I said.

Elvira waved her hand, causing Hannah to fall to the floor, unconscious. I glanced at her then turned back to Elvira, surprised. Only I inwardly moaned as she explained, "For now, her position is purely symbolic with no real power. It is a test on Hannah and the witch council."

This did not impress me at all. "You are using a child as bait for this test?"

"The head witch is using her granddaughter as bait for this test." Patiently, Elvira countered. "This is a double test, Mr Carlson." She drew in a breath. "The purpose of this is to test if Hannah will be able to resist using her position to gain what she wants in life. It is also to test if the witch council had learned their lesson from testing John Harrison with his power of science that mimics magic."

I remembered John writing about the cruel tests he had endured to prove he was able to use his powerful science safely and remain male rather than the next head witch. Now it was Hannah's turn and I was thrown into the middle of it with my friends. "Damn, this sucks!"

Twenty minutes later....
1542.title: A cruel test of power.

15423.content:
Ryan's POV

School has started, though thankfully I'd say this is the easiest day of the week for us. Nothing really strenuous and the teachers are cool, and it's just things like plain ol English and Maths and what have you. Stuff that's normal, which I can totally get behind. We just need to babysit Hannah for a while, should be easy. It won't be for long I till myself, just need to keep her out of trouble in the first place and then there's no problem.

Though myself and Jenny and the older members of the dorm don't have the same classes as Hannah and Chon's daughters, given that we're in our teens. No matter though, the school's not that big enough. Anyway classes go by simply enough, I have no problem with anything. And the good thing is if any of us don't understand something Lunar can use her robot nature to tell in an easy to understand manner too! Either way it's impossible to lose, awesome for us. Essential for Light, the guy is pretty brick thick. Though he once punched a tree so hard it turned into a book filled with pages of the letters OW! I ain't joking on that one.

The bell rings, and I promptly get packed up and begin to head out. We've got lunch break now for the day, Chon and co are heading outside. But something's not right, call it my intuition. I decide to check on the class that Hannah was in, I know Charlie's timetable and he's in the same class.

Sure enough I'm walking with Jenny and in the hallway I see Hannah walking briskly with Viva and Charlie, from a taller girl.

"Hey get back here you runt, I'm talking to you!" she says. I think I know her, not personally but I've heard of her. Kristy Hart, some kind of cheerleader. Right bitch too from what I'm told, and she's seemingly intent on making a statement to Hannah.

"Ignore her Hannah." Viva says as she makes eye contact with me, no doubt feeling relief inwardly that I'm here now.

"Hah! Looks like the runt of the Harrison pack has some fleas to cover herself." Kristy sneers, wow. Not even Charlie's older Sisters were this unsubtle, I simply frown at her words. No doubt she's trying to harass Hannah by playing the old she's the youngest Sister and therefore lowest in level card. Times like this I'm glad I'm an only child.

Just before I step in though I see a figure walk past me, I have to admit I'm surprised to see him here right now.

"Sho?" I ask, he turns his head to me and nods.

The man is Japanese, one can tell from his hair and skin tone. He might look like a young exchange student, but make no mistake. He's far older than he looks though, Sho was apparently an officer in the Japanese Self Defence Force when it was first founded. And he's related to Azura, the same sprit that lurks inside my katana. They look quite similar save for Azura sporting longer hair and some stubble.

"That's enough Gaijin. Stand down." Sho said, he's right up to Kristy with his arms folded.

Kristy tries to stare into Sho's soul but he's having none of it, that old Zanshin stuff Sho has means he's not very easily shaken. Even when he was brought out of that block of ice and into our supernatural world he adapted fairly quickly, didn't take kindly to the fact that he was frozen for over 50 years and his faction forgot about him though.

Finally it seems this bitch gets the message, she scowls and turns around and storms off. Sho simply huffs and cracks his neck, no doubt he wasn't fazed in the least by her. What the hell is she doing here anyway?

"Where's Vogue?" Jenny asks.

"Nipped to the bathroom, Hannah are you okay?" Viva asks.

Hannah simply nods before saying "Yeah I guess, what did I ever do to her?"

I shrug and say "Sometimes people just don't like others, that's the kind of person that isn't worth a thing."
15423.title: A witch tries to bully Hannah.

154231.content:
Ryan's POV

"Everyone has worth, Ryan." Softly, Hannah said. "It's just that some people are not worthy of the attention they yearn for."

I nodded, pleased by Hannah's level of maturity. "You have a valid point."

Hannah sighed. "I used to be like that girl, you know." Almost sadly, she said. "I thought that I could get anything I wanted if I pouted or protested enough." She threw me a rueful smile. "I learned that the best way to get what you want is to make it yourself."

"That kind of fits what Chon teaches us." Smiling, Viva said.

"Mike Cutie taught me that." Smiling, Hannah said.

Viva and Vogue looked at Hannah confused. "Who?"

"Well, he kind of my boyfriend." Blushing, Hannah said. "He has a power too but I can't say."

"Then you should not say he has a power." Serious, Sho said. "It is best not to arouse one's curiosity."

Hannah blushed even more. "Good point."

"Will he be studying here as well?" Curious, I asked.

Hannah shook her head. "No, he's not magical or anything like that..."

"Enough." Scolding, Sho said. "If this child's ability is to be kept secret, we should change the subject."

Sho was indeed wise. Still, I had to ask as it was my job to keep the kid safe. Later on, I asked Sho what he made of Hannah and her new role in the witching world. Sho sighed before turning to me, serious.

"You know that I can sense power from a person." Calmly, he said. "Hannah's power is nearly 'off the charts' by what I understand magic to be." He gazed over at Hannah who was busy talking to Viva and Vogue then turned back to me. "Hannah is obviously a very powerful witch though she is not yet aware of this herself yet. I suspect that this friend of hers is partially to thank for that."

"What makes you say that?" Curious, I asked.

"Hannah allowed it to slip that this Mike Cutie as not magical but yet there is something about him that needs to be kept secret." Serious, Sho said. "My guess is that Mike has the ability to enhance others gifts; in this case, Hannah's magic. It's rare but I have seen this happen first hand."

"That complicates things." Wincing, I said.
154231.title: Sho's assesment of Hannah.

1542311.content:
Sho's POV

Its at times like this I miss my time in the JSDF, when things were more disciplined and ordered. We were driven to atone for our forefathers errors and to defend the homeland, now however I instead am involved in global supernatural issues and must aid my ancestor and his master. I perform well regardless however, indeed I've discovered powers of my own. Combined with my mastery of karate, I regularly spar with Chon and Huanle. The pair show the exemplary martial arts of China indeed.

Ryan sometime later approached me in our dorm, I greet him with a bow. No matter what I always make sure my uniform is well presented. "How goes it Carlson-sama?" I ask.

"I'm well, but I have a mission for you Sho. We've gotten reports of a Neko Witch in town, she's been causing a ruckus. Lunar's located her to a mansion, I'd like you to get her brought before Elvira here and be reminded of the fact she needs to be a student here." Ryan said leaning on the wall of my bedroom. My place is neat, not a speck of dust to be found.

"Understood, I'll depart now. You've made a file for me I take it?" I say rising up and donning my electric gloves.

Ryan hands me a thin file and says "We've established she's a Neko Witch, Lunar managed to produce a picture of her. She's been sighted at a rundown mansion on the outskirts of Edinburgh. Head there at once please and stay safe."

I salute and depart, a quick use of the Starmage teleporter and I find myself five minutes away from the mansion Ryan mentioned, I quickly purse through the file. She looks very much like a Neko.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/yugi...

I step forward slowly with intent to the mansion, it looks fairly rundown. The greenery around it seems tended to somewhat, indicating someone is likely living here. There was a dried up fountain in the centre, I walk past it when suddenly I hear a meow noise. I quickly turn to it, energy crackling from my fingers.

Only to find a stray cat, it looks at me then proceeds to walk away. It then turns to look at me, as if to indicate I should follow. This is likely a trap, but traps work both ways. I walk towards it and we come to the door, the cat slides through a flap. I open it with a loud creaking noise.

The entrance hall is dusty, the drapes cover almost all the windows. But what strikes me here is the entrance hall is filled to the brim with cat themed objects and statues. Also suddenly over 20 cats leap down from the floor above and file up at the front of the steps.I flex my fingers in preparation of a fight.

Then suddenly I hear the clacking noises of heels on what is most likely marble flooring. From the shadows of the upper floor emerges the girl, 18 or so. I estimate her height to be about 5'5, dressed in an elegant gothic dress with a opera mask covering her features.

"My my, look what the cat dragged in....." she says in a voice as smooth as velvet.

I'm straight to the point. I state to her "My name is Shomei Akatsuki. Identify yourself at once Neko Witch."

She pouts and takes off her opera mask, her tail swishing behind her. "You've got some nerve, striding in here demanding answers. Fine, I'm Kath Lancaster. What brings you to my humble abode?" she says.

As before I get to it "You've been causing disruptions and must register as a student with Starmage Academy, come with me at once."

I know I'm in hostile territory, Kath has the home field advantage. No doubt these cats might be magically empowered by her, but my spirit powers will make me untouchable.......
1542311.title: Sho meets a cat that isn't Jenny....

155.content:
"Madam dean!" surprised and stunned, I said. "What gives me the honor of your visit?"

Elvira Smith smiled; she was a tall and slender 34 year old woman with shoulder length dust blond hair and ocean blue eyes that seemed to dance in the dim light. She had been appointed dean of Starmage Academy by the head witch, Elvira Strange who had every trust in her abilities. Mr Tanaka, the former head of the school took the chance to retire from the job. Ryan still kept in contact with him, he viewed the man as the Father figure he never had.

"I'm sorry to disturb you before classes, Ryan Carlson." kindly, she said. "However, I am in need of your services."

"How may I assist you, madam dean?" politely, I asked.

"My daughter, Christina has been given the honor to attend this academy." with a hint of pride, Elvira replied. "However..." she sighed, shaking her head. "Madam head witch has insisted that my son attend this academy as well."

"Forgive me but... is he a poor student?" worried, I asked. "I can try to mentor him, if you wish."

Elvira giggled darkly. "Far from it, I'm afraid." sighing, she said. "You see, my son, Juan has chosen to follow in his father's footsteps and become a mad scientist." pausing, she added, "You, of course, know of the ancient war that existed between the two powers."

"I do indeed." nodding, I said. "It became so intense that all people in the UK were eventually born with an immunity to Transgender, shrinking, and body swap types of magic."

"The war finally ended in the early 1990s." serious, Elvira said. "However, some still hold on to the hatred of that conflict as it raged for centuries. This academy was partly founded to maintain that delicate peace."

"I see your concern." looking at Elvira, I said. "You fear Juan will not set well with this academy and attempt to enroll into Eligere Sententia boys' boarding school on his own."

Eligere Sententia, Latin for 'elite way of thinking', was a school that constantly changed location. No one who resides near the school where it appears is ever aware of its presence. There, they molded young mad scientists into the powerful beings they were 'destined' to become. Most who graduate from this institution of learning move on to influence the world for the better but a few...

"I need you watch over Juan for a few days, see how he reacts to being trained as a witch hunter." interrupting my thoughts, Elvira said. "If I thought for a second you were not qualified, I would not have asked you, Ryan." she sighed wearily. "Do not judge my son too quickly, he is kind and carries an undying loyalty to his friends but..."

"What?" curious, I asked.

"I love Juan as equally as I do his sister but his father has placed it into his head that he is invincible with his science, making him reckless and impulsive." sadly, Elvira said. "He's a loose cannon, Ryan. I need someone to snap him out of this as, while at this academy, I can not treat him less or more harshly as any other student."

"What a way to start the morning." mumbling, I said. *Man, this sucks! Trouble comes to me in heavy doses I guess.*

"Will you accept this assignment?" looking at me, Elvira asked.

I sighed and replied...

Elvira nodded and snapped her fingers. A black folder fell onto Ryan's hands, the 17 year old opened it to show things like Juan's most well known power and thinking tendencies. "You must have a file like this about me as well I take it?" he asked.
